loans.name: El Faisan Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario El Faisán , son originarias de la Ciudad de Masaya, viven en el Barrio Monimbó, ellas se decidieron a trabajar con Adim porque escucharon en la promoción que era para mujeres pobres con negocios pequeños.

Doña Lourdes  del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo, una joven mujer de 33 años, casada, madre de una hija de nueve años que estudia  la primaria en una escuela cercana al mercado, después de sus clases le ayuda a ella en el negocio.Su negocio es venta de productos perecederos en el mercado Municipal en el sector de leñas, en la periferia del mercado, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la conoce de su madre que aún  vende en el mismo sector; los productos que ofrece son : lechugas, tomates, repollos, zanahorias, papas, etc. expresa que son los que tienen mayor movimiento en su inventario.
Compra en el mismo mercado en el sector mayorista, estos productos los compra asociadas con las del grupo y así consiguen rebajas en los precios. Su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 3 a.m. y termina a las 3 p.m. Tiene casa propia hasta hace un año, esta la terminó acondicionar hace unos meses.
Su esposo es comerciante del mercado pero, de productos como sandía, melón y plátanos, hace unos años vendían juntos ahora ella se independizó porque así ella puede comprar lo que decida de sus ganancias. Él le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y de estudio de la hija, ella maneja su propio dinero, siente que esto ha mejorado su condición como persona y económicamente, tiene más derechos en el hogar. Expresa que en Adim le enseñaron el valor de su trabajo y que su negocio es de ella así como sus logros.
Todo lo anterior hace que anime a sus compañeras a ser muy cumplidas con el pago.
texts.en:
This is the solidarity group El Faisán. They are all from the city of Masaya and live in the Monimbó neighborhood. They decided to work with Adim because they heard the promotion for poor women with small businesses. Doña Lourdes del Socorro is the coordinator of the group. She's a young woman, age 33, married and the mother of a nine year old daughter in elementary school near the market. After her classes, the daughter helps her mother with her business. Her business is the sale of perishable goods in the municipal market in the firewood market on the outskirts of the market. For many years, she's dedicated herself to this activity. She's known for her association with her mother who sells in the same sector. The products that she offers include: lettuce, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, potatoes, etc. (these are the ones that have the most movement en her inventory). She buys in the same market in the wholesale sector. She buys these products with the other women of her group and in this way she gets the reductions in price. Her workday begins at 3 am and ends at 3pm. She has had her own house for a year which she just finished setting up a few months ago. Her husband is a market trader but of products like watermelon, melon and bananas. For some years now, they have sold their products together. Now she is becoming independent because this way she can buy what she wants with her profit. He helps her with the house expenses and their daughter's schooling expenses. She manages her own money and feels she has improved her condition as a person and economically, while having more rights at home. She says that in Adim, they have learned the value of work and that their business is hers, just like her accomplishments. All of this motivates her group-mates to fulfill their payment.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for business

loans.name: Nasrulo

texts.ru: Джалолов Насруло проживает в городе Вахдат, в возросте 54 лет.Женат имеет 5-рых детей, имеет среднее техническое образования.Сам клиент занимается торговлей, штор и зановесок у клиента имеется собственная торговая точка. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается более шести лет на местном рынке Хайр.На полученные деньги, клиент увеличит свой товар от получаемого дохода клиент содержит свою семью.
texts.en:
Nasrulo J., 54, lives in the city of Vahdat. He is married and has 5 children. He completed vocational education. This entrepreneur has his own store where he sells window blinds and curtains. He has been selling at the local Hayr market for over six years. The funds received will be used to expand inventory, bringing income to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Mrs Eva C. is 31 years old and married. She sells fish and deals in ready-to-wear goods in order to help her husband generate enough family income to feed their two children and support their education. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, PMPC, as additional capital for her business. She hopes that one day she will have a permanent stall in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children but only one is currently in school. Through hard work, Abena has provided support for her first three kids' education. She is a food vendor who has sold banku in her neighborhood for the past 18 years. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains. It is cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy banku as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her child to enter teacher-training college. She is a member of a community group called “Mo din mmo” (hard work) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en: Punkhan J. is forty-five years old and married with four children. He lives with his family in his own house, which is stocked with the basic necessities. Punkhan has owned a small general store for five years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use, such as sweets, flour, macaroni, sugar, preserved food, soft drinks, etc. The reason for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. A greater variety of goods will attract more clients and generate a better monthly income to help his family. Please support this man who has the strength and courage to keep working!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock the store

loans.name: Deya

texts.en:
Deya L. is currently in the business of selling tea at Konyokonyo market and is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar to make tea to sell. Deya is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land for setting up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more sugar to make tea to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A., 38, lives in Phase 4, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband died seven years ago. She has three children. The eldest has just finished college and is now helping her send the two younger kids to school.

Dionesia, like many Filipina women entrepreneurs, sells cosmetics, shoes, and bags consigned from prominent brands to clients on installment terms. She earns P2,500.00 every week from this business, augmenting her regular salary as a storekeeper at a nearby water refilling station. Working at the water refilling station also provides an opportunity to market her products (see picture of Dionesia inside the water station with her products).

While most of the loan she has applied for will be used for inventory for her business, Dionesia will use part of the P14,000 loan to construct a perimeter fence around a parcel of land she purchased with her savings.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, shoes and bags and build a perimeter fence

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Maura es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Maura tiene un puesto en el mercado Sr. D. Arequipa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Maura venD. condimentos molidos que ella misma prepara.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. jabón y cereales.
Los sueños D. Maura son mejorar su negocio, su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y apoyar a su nieto.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Maura is married, 50 years old and has 6 children. Maura has a stand in the Sr. D. Arequipa market where she sells general groceries, a business she runs every day. In addition, Maura sells ground condiments that she herself prepares. Maura needs a loan for 1500 soles to invest in buying soap and grains. Maura dreams of improving her business and that her youngest child finishes school, and that she is able to support her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap and grains

loans.name: Azeez

texts.en: Azeez is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells shoes and bags. Azeez has been in this business for the past seven years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high.  Helena sells maize, she buys maize at the market and resells them at Elmina near Abreshia, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a trade.  Helena uses her income to support the husband in the payment of fees.  Helena will use the loan to enable her buy more maize in big sacks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Helena will use the loan to enable her buy more maize in big sacks to sell.

loans.name: Okeke

texts.en: Okeke sells palm oil in both the wholesale and retail markets. Palm oil is used in the preparation of local soups like egusi, okro, etc. She is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N 100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She would like to say "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Wilfridah

texts.en:
Wilfridah O. boasts of being the only sisal rope maker in the whole of her village. Unlike many businesses, she says this is pure art and not just the exchange of money and goods. “You have to be skilled to produce a perfect rope that can hold and last,” she says.

Wilfridah is 51 years old, married and blessed with 11 children. She started her business back in 1990 and admits she did it because the competition was low as most people back then preferred easy money: buying goods and selling the goods. She says she prefers to be the manufacturer and enjoys the joy of creation. She requires a loan of 10,000 shillings which she will use to purchase raw materials from the sisal plant. Her future dream is to open a mega-store for sisal ropes and products.

loans.use: To buy more sisal to make rope

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 32 years old, married and a mother of four kids. All her children attend school in the community where she lives with the husband and the children. Her husband, she said is very supportive in helping her take care of the kids. Diana is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as a breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children especially with their education.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for resale

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha A. is married to a driver and they have three children. She has received junior high education. Agartha has been selling cloth, glasses, and shoes at Elmina since 2001. She supports her husband in paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more glasses and cloth to sell. Agartha hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more glasses and cloth to sell

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 37 years old, married with four children, aged between 2 and 12. He lives in the Gicumbi district in the northern province of Rwanda which is approximately an one hour's drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Jean Bosco has been a butcher for 13 years. His immaculately clean shop provides the community with quality meat products at fair prices. His business hours are from 7 AM to 4 PM every day except Sunday.

This is Jean Bosco's second loan - he paid back on time and in full his first loan from VFC. The reason why he is requesting his second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company is to purchase more goats and cows for slaughter. As it stands, demand outstrips his available supply each day. Jean Bosco is certain he will make more profits with this loan to purchase more product to sell. With the profit which is not reinvested in his business, he will continue to save for his family as well as pay for any immediate family problems for his extended family.

loans.use: Purchase more goats and cows to slaughter

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
La señora CELMIRA C. V. , tiene  40 años, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II, presenta estudios hasta 5to. de Secundaria y tiene 1 hijo  quien depende económicamente de ella. 
La socia se dedica a  sembrar chala en sus chacras para luego venderla en los establos y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò sacos de fertilizantes al por mayor para arar sus tierras y tener una buena siembra. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito de 2,300.00 nuevos comprará también fertilizantes.
Ella sueña con tener una buena cosecha para así poder generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Celmira C. V. is 40. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She went to school until the fifth year of high school. She has one child who is economically dependent upon her. She plants “chala” (corn husks and cobs) on her fields. She later sells them to stables. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought sacks of fertilizers wholesale. She used it to plough her land and to have a good planting. Now, with her next loan for 2,300 PEN, she will also buy fertilizers. She dreams of having a good harvest to be able to generate income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en: Batsukh T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her two children, ages 12 and 18, attend a local secondary school. Batsukh is a livestock herder and operates a meat trading business at a rented stall at the local market in her town. She raises a variety of different animals which supply all of the meat for her business. Her husband assists her in running the business by delivering meats at the market while she tends to the animals in the countryside. Batsukh and her husband started their business in 1999 and have made a consistent living over the years. They enjoy their hard work and are always looking for ways to increase their earnings. In the near future she hopes to begin growing vegetables in order to sell them. She says, “One must work hard in order to have a happy life.” Batsukh is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase cows and sheep in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Tusuubira Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Kulusum is 40 years old and a single mother of five children aged 22 – 12 years. They are all in secondary and primary schools. She also takes care of other siblings. Kulusum has a retail shop in Lugazi central market from which she is able to make 150,000/= profit a week although there is a lot of competition from other retailers. She is grateful for her loans and the good customer care she gives her clients. These have made her successful. She hopes to turn her shop into a wholesale shop for better sales and more profits as well as making personal businesses for her children and siblings since she is divorced. Kulusum needs a loan to be able to buy more shop items to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Daizy

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Daizy O. lives in one of the very remote municipalities of Antique Province. In the small town of Libertad, with her three children, whose ages range from four to eight years old, and her loving husband, Daizy dreamed of having a life that is simply happy. Instead of focusing on negative thoughts and emotions brought about by poverty, as a mother and a wife Daizy knew that she served as the light for her family, especially for her children, to keep from succumbing to the trials of life. She tries to see opportunities that life can offer them beyond being poor. Though she discovered a lot, it was in 1997 when she found the greatest of all. That was when she became a member of ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines.

Through ASHI, Daizy has been able to obtain credit and has started her own small business. Over time, the loan amount she qualifies for has increased, as her hog-fattening business has grown. The larger the volume of hogs she sells (either alive or slaughtered--the pork is sold per kilo after four months of fattening), the more she profits. Daizy's business proceeds since then have been a great provider of food and other basic commodities her family's needs. She is no longer dependent on her husband’s sporadic and small income; instead she takes part in earning money.

Daizy has been so happy with her achievements since obtaining membership in ASHI because she feels that she has helped not just her family but also people who live in their inaccessible village. The pork and pigs she sells has brought people convenient access to food. Therefore, Daizy would like to request another loan, which she will use for growing her business. That way she will be able to increase the number of hogs she is raising and selling, and increase the profits which improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to fatten and re-sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 femmes du groupe  Benkadi, toutes mariées,  ont en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent  toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou une des sous préfectures de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de l’habillement,  des tubercules et du poisson fumé et séché.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur 5 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  des paniers de poissons fumés et séchés  et des  paquets de condiments alimentaires  tels les tomates fraîches,  les oignons et les sels de cuisine, les feuilles vertes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  à Mopti (la cinquième région administrative du Mali) en poissons et  sur place auprès des producteurs en condiments. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes à domicile, au marché et dans les foires environnantes de Konobougou, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven woman of the group Benkadi, all married, average 38 years of age and five children each.  And they all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Ségou (4th administrative region of the republic).  These women know one another through ties of community and kinship. They do commerce in a variety of items, such as condiments, clothing, tubers, and smoked and dried fish. After having properly repaid the four preceding loans, the group members are now on their fifth solidarity loans that will be used to buy some baskets of smoked and dried fish, as well as packages of condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, onions, salt, and greens.  Supplies of fish are gotten in Mopti (5th administrative region of Mali), and those of condiments are gotten from local producers.  Sales are made out of the home, at the market, and at the fairs surrounding Konobougou.  Cash or credit is accepted at the retail level from customers composed of women and men.  The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses concerning healthcare, food, and schooling costs.  The rest will be reinvested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Wilmer Humberto

texts.es:
Wilmer Humberto R. A. es un joven de 27 años de edad el cual vive con sus padres en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Wilmer está a cargo de sus padres por lo cual inició un proyecto de cría de cerdo para engorde. El vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy feliz puesto que su negocio día con día crece.

Actualmente Wilmer está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento y otros insumos necesarios para este fin. Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Wilmer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Wilmer Humberto is a youth of 27 who lives with his parents in a community called Santa Fé located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is notable as a mountainous zone and for being near the northern frontier of the country. Its principal economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture specifically, and for producing basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Wilmer is obligated to his parents and for that reason, he began a project of raising and fattening pigs. He sells his products to neighbors in the community, who seem quite satisfied with their quality. He comments that from the beginning of this project, he has been very happy to see the business grow day by day. At present Wilmer is requesting a micro-credit of 656,000 colons to buy more pigs to fatten, and to buy feed and other supplies necessary for this end. With the investment he hopes that his micro-enterprise will be strengthened and grow more. All this will help to better conditions for him and his family. Wilmer is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fé, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his 2nd loan and with it he hopes to grow more as an individual and economically. Also, he points out that thanks to these types of organizations and means of facilitating loans, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PIGS TO FATTEN, PLUS FEED AND NECESSARY SUPPLIES

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is single and has received no formal education. Mary sells spices, onions, canned tomatoes, beef and other food supplies at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Mary uses her income from her sales to pay for her rented apartment and electricity bills. The loan, which will serve as additional capital, will be used to purchase provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a house for herself.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for sale.

loans.name: Sylviane

texts.fr: D. Sylviane est née le 21 avril 1968 et vit depuis maintenant sept ans à Aïdjedo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Sylviane est mariée à ZOFOUN Christophe, un soudeur. Sylviane vit seule avec ses enfants mais est aidée par son mari pour assurer les divers besoins des enfants. En effet, pour contribuer à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants, Sylviane mène comme activité,  la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, piles, papiers hygiéniques, conserves, huile, etc.) à son domicile. Sylviane s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Sylviane a arrêté les classes au cours primaire mais exerce son activité depuis environs huit ans. Sylviane a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Dans l’espoir d’élever le niveau de son activité, Sylviane sollicite un deuxième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sylviane D. was born 21 April 1968 and has been living for the past seven years in the Aïdjedo borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Mother of three children, all having attended (or still attending) school, Sylviane is married to Christophe ZOFOUN, a welder. She lives alone with her children but is assisted by her husband in meeting the children’s various needs. In fact, to contribute to her children’s education, Sylviane has been retailing various products from her home (pasta, batteries, toilet paper, canned goods, vegetable oil, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She stopped going to school at primary level, and has been running her business for almost eight years. Sylviane has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan, with the hope of raising her level of activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of vegetable oil, canned goods and pasta

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 30 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y calzado. Ella tiene más de 11 años de realizar esta actividad, ella da inicio a este negocio porque tenía que ayudar a su Mama ya que además Claudia tenía que pagar sus estudios ya que esto obligo a que estudiara sabatino, así podría vender los productos y  ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, por lo que agradece a su Mama que desde muy joven le enseño el trabajo humilde. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, trajes de baños para la temporada de verano. Su deseo es tener su propio establecimiento.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria is 30 years old. Her business is the sale of clothing and shoes. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She began this business because she needed to help her mother, and furthermore, she had to pay for her schooling, and this obliged her to study on Saturdays, so that she would be able to sell her products and help with the household expenses. She is thankful to her mother, who, from the time when she was young, taught her humble work.

She is asking for this loan to buy pants, shirts, and swimming suits for the summer season. Her wish is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nelly Norma

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, se reúne en la parroquia Los Bajos en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

La señora norma es casada tiene 7 hijos mayores ella se dedica a  su casa  y le ayuda la esposo con el préstamo que esta solicitando llevan 10 años en el negocio de ladrillos el negocio esta ubicado por la vía,   tierra aserrín, es para invertir en el negocio familiar, en la vía tiene 7 hijos dos casados, el mayor le ayuda en la casa en la alimentación, el horno se arma a base tierra, aserrín y agua y lo maja y lo ponen en un molde y lo dejan secar, tiene 3 trabajadores según lo que se vende ellos ganan los vende en Portoviejo y hace contratos en las construcciones, cada mes 10.000 ladrillos, los ladrillos el millar esta por los costo 80 dólares y cuando no llueve bajan las ventas, todos los ladrillos que sacan los venden, ella es la que se encarga de preparar los 

alimentos para los trabajadores de su negocio, desde las 4 de la mañana, tratan de madrugar porque como trabajan al aire libre sin cubrirse del sol, es un trabajo bastante sacrificado, con el negocio tiene 10 años, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en comprar los materiales para construir un nuevo horno, los quemadores de martes a viernes.
texts.en:
The community bank Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer meets in the parish church Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi in the province of Manabí. Señora Norma is married and has 7 grown sons, 2 of whom are married. She works out of her home along with her husband, who is helping her with the loan which she requests. For ten years they have worked in the business of bricks, and the loan which they request is to invest in their familiar trade of making bricks. The eldest of her sons helps her at home, preparing food for the workers who make the bricks for their company. To make bricks, Señora Norma's husband and their workers load their brick-baking oven with a base mixture of dirt, sawdust and water, which they grind together and put in a mold, where they leave it to dry in the oven. They have 3 workers, who are paid an amount that corresponds to the amount of bricks they sell. They sell their bricks in Portoviejo, and make contracts with construction companies, requiring them to produce 10,000 bricks per month. They charge 80 dollars per thousand bricks, and when it does not rain, their sales go down, since there is less water to use for producing bricks. They sell all the bricks that they are able to bake. Señora Norma is the one in charge of preparing food for the workers who produce the bricks for their business. Everyone tries to begin working by 4 a.m., because at that hour they can work in the open air without having to protect themselves from the harsh mid-day sun. It is difficult work, requiring the sacrifice of comfort, and they have worked hard at it for 10 years. With this newest loan, they will purchase materials to build a new oven, which will be firing bricks from Tuesday to Friday.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar materiales para construir  horno para ladrillos

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos ya adultos. Juntos viven en el poblado de Rosario, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia. Hace 2 décadas pasaban por una crisis social y económica, por ello su familia vivía en condiciones precarias, a veces no tenían nada que comer. Es por ello que Máximo, siendo muy joven decidió cultivar las chacras de sus padres, terrenos que anteriormente no lo utilizaba. Con el tiempo empezó a involucrarse en esta actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de café y a partir de ahí le encantó estar en el campo. Hoy tiene hectáreas considerables, donde produce de manera masiva, con el propósito de que satisfaga a sus compradores potenciales. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su propia comunidad. Normalmente recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en tiempos de cosechas, pero usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, empezando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es remodelar su casa, con la finalidad de darle comodidad a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con el cronograma de pagos, además agradece a la institución por la accesibilidad y confianza que depositan su persona. Con el crédito que solicitan, invertirá en la compra de abono e insumos para sus cafetales, de esa manera sus productos no sufrirán alguna alteración en cuanto a calidad y cantidad.
texts.en:
Máximo is 55 years old. He’s married and has 4 children who are already adults. They live together in the settlement of Rosario, located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho, where they have their own home. Two decades ago, there was a social and economic crisis, due to which they were living on meager means. Sometimes they had nothing to eat. For this reason, Máximo, feeling very young, decided to cultivate his parent’s land, which was not being used. With time, he began to involve himself in this agricultural activity, specifically the production and commercialization of coffee. Since then, he has loved to be in the fields. Today, he has a many hectors, where he produces in mass, with the goal that he can satisfy his potential buyers. In general, the products are sold in wholesale markets in his community. Normally, he receives help from his children during the harvest, but usually he works for himself, beginning at 7 in the morning and working until 6 in the evening. In the future, he plans to remodel their home, in order to increase his family’s comfort. This is his second loan with MFP, for which he promises to follow the payment schedule. Furthermore, he is grateful to the institution for the accessibility and trust that they have allowed him. With the loan that he requests, he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer and other consumables for his coffee plantation. In this way, his products won’t suffer any fluctuations in quality or quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other consumables for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.ru:
Порою, начиная какое – либо дело, мы сами далеко не осознаём, к чему оно нас приведёт. Но по прошествии уже определённого промежутка времени, мы начинаем получать конкретные результаты за проделанный труд и приложенные усилия. Мы также начинаем получать и материальное, и моральное удовлетворение за все старания и лишения и только тогда, мы начинаем понимать, всю значимость проделанной работы. Поэтому сильные люди никогда не сдаются, а наоборот упорно ждут плодов своих начинаний, зная, что временные трудности на то и временные, чтобы их переждать. Айсалкын Шерматова – лидер данной группы. Она из г. Балыкчи. Айсалкын начала торговать десять лет назад на старом рынке, накопив сбережения в размере десяти тысяч сомов. Сейчас она – опытный предприниматель и те самые деньги, что она вложила, чтобы начать свой бизнес, Айсалкын теперь зарабатывает за месяц. И её бизнес – это неотъемлемая часть семейного дохода. Муж Айсалкын работает водителем. Он возит клиентов за товаром. У Айсалкын двое детей. Сыну двадцать лет. Он учится в физкультурном институте. А дочке десять лет. Она учится в начальной школе. Благодаря своему бизнесу Айсалкын удаётся оплачивать контракт за обучения сына, а это семнадцать тысяч сомов в год. Недавно они также отремонтировали свой дом и купили машину. Айсалкын понимает, какое важное решение она приняла десять лет назад, когда отправилась торговать на рынок. Сейчас Айсалкын нуждается в кредите. Ей нужны средства для того, чтобы купить летний ассортимент детских вещей. 
Партнёры Айсалкын по группе:

Бозовой Алтынай 43 года. У неё двое детей. Алтынай с мужем – предприниматели. Он торгует обувью в г. Бишкек, а она продаёт женское бельё. Она обратилась за этим кредитом, чтобы помочь мужу в увеличении ассортимента товаров, а именно, купить летние сланцы. 

Койчумановой Бурулсун 34 года. Она разведена и одна воспитывает семилетнюю дочь, которая этой осенью пойдёт в школу. Бурулсун продаёт детские вещи. Этим она уже занимается пять лет и сейчас её доход составляет двенадцать тысяч сомов. Бурулсун нужен этот кредит, чтобы купить вещи летнего сезона. 

Чуменову Кайраткелди 37 лет. Он – отец двоих детей. Сей час вместе с супругой Кайраткелди торгует детскими вещами. Его доход составляет двенадцать тысяч сомов. Кайраткелди обратился за этим кредитом, так как хочет увеличить ассортимент товаров и сделать закупку новых видов детских вещей. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
At times, when starting any kind of business, we do not realize what the outcome may be. But after a certain period of time has passed, we begin to obtain concrete results for our labor and efforts. We also begin to have financial and moral satisfaction for all of the efforts and sacrifices, and only then do we begin to understand the meaning of our work. This is why strong people never give up; on the contrary, they stubbornly wait for the fruits of their beginnings, knowing that difficulties are temporary and designed to be endured. Aisalkyn S. is the leader of this group. She is from the city of Balykchi. She started sales ten years ago at an old market, having saved a sum of ten thousand som. Now, she is an experienced entrepreneur and earns that same amount of money that she invested to start her business in one month. Her business is an essential part of the family income. Aisalkyn’s husband works as a driver. He transports clients to get merchandise. Aisalkyn has two children. Her son is twenty years old. He attends a sports and exercise college. Her daughter is ten years old. She goes to elementary school. Thanks to her business, Aisalkyn is able to pay her son’s education contract, which is seventeen thousand som per year. Recently, they also remodeled their house and bought a car. Aisalkyn understands what an important decision it was to start sales at the market ten years ago. Currently, she needs a loan in order to buy summer assortment of children’s goods. Aisalkyn’s group partners are: Altynai B. is 43 years old. She has two children. Altynai and her husband are entrepreneurs. He sells shoes in the city of Bishkek, and she sells women’s undergarments. She requested this loan in order to help her husband expand merchandise assortment and primarily, to buy summer sandals. Burulsun K. is 34 years old. She is divorced and raising a seven-year-old daughter, who will start school in the autumn, alone. Burulsun sells children’s goods. She has been involved in this business for five years, and her current income is twelve thousand som. Burulsun needs this loan in order to buy summer merchandise. Kairatkeldi C. is 37 years old. He is a father of two children. Currently, together with his wife, Kairatkeldi sells children’s goods. His income is twelve thousand som. He requested this loan because he wants to expand merchandise assortment and make a purchase of new kinds of children’s goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer assortment of children's goods

loans.name: Jalilah

texts.en:
N. Jalilah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is single and has no children, and currently lives in her family’s home.  Jalilah has a business selling used and new clothes in Kinoni.  She has had her business for approximately one year.

To expand her business, Jalilah is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for buying more inventory of clothes which she can resell at markets in and around Kinoni.   Jalilah hopes to expand her clothes business, sell more product, and generate profit in order to help support her family.  


Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: More stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel operates a mixed farm on the outskirts of Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for twenty years and employs two farmhands. He produces milk, bananas, maize, beans, tree seedlings and tea which he sells locally and to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, respectively.

Samuel is 42 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 18. All the children attend school.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to provide enough milk for his family and to pay school fees with the income from the milk sales. He plans to buy a bull for his dairy cows to avoid the high cost and risk of artificial insemination.

His primary challenge has been the lack of enough money to buy animal feeds and to treat the animals when they fall sick. He appreciates the help given by Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen L., 47, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. L. produces traditional baskets to sell for an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $2 per day. 

L. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mr. Houn H. (shown in the photo), 56, and his wife, Mrs. Touch Nhoung, 55, have been married since 1979. They have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Five of them married and live outside the family home, one attends school and other two have full-time employment in Phnom Penh City. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Houn has been a fisherman for 15 years, while his wife sells the fish that her husband caught. Houn is asking for a loan of $200 to add to his own money to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver J. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Oliver lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

Oliver has a business selling cooked food at the market. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and maize flour for her restaurant. Oliver's main business challenge is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas, rice, Irish potatoes,cassava and maize flour

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto F. vive en casa propia solo sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y están casados, el vive en la calle Venezuela de la zona de san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz, es jubilado rentista y con su renta el cubre todas sus necesidades, el crédito que solicita es para hacerse un chequeo medico ya que sufre de algunas dolencias en el estomago que los médicos de la caja no pueden curar, por consiguiente el acudirá a un medico particular, es cliente de Impro hace 4 años y forma parte de Kiva por segunda vez, esta satisfecho con el trato y con las tasas de interés.

Por tener un buen historial y por el carácter social califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto F. lives alone in a house that he owns. His children are grown and married. He lives on Venezuela Street in the Lower San Antonio neighborhood of La Paz. Humberto is retired and his pension covers his basic needs. He is applying for a loan to pay health care costs. His doctors have referred him to a specialist because they cannot cure a long-standing stomach ailment and he needs the loan to cover the related costs. Humberto has been an Impro client for 4 years and he is pleased with the terms and the interest rates that he gets. He qualifies for this loan because he has a good borrowing history and because his need for the loan meets the social objectives of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical exam.

loans.name: Flor Del Comercio Group

texts.es: Don Onofre Y. P. es Casado, cursó Segundo grado de primaria, tiene seis hijos, cuatro mujeres y dos hombres,  tres de sus hijos están casados y los otros tres están bajo su cargo, Él se dedica a la comercio, (Compra y venta de Ropa Nueva) tiene 20 años ya con este negocio. Cuenta con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunos vecinos y amigos organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El grupo solidario se denomina “Flor del Comercio”, cuenta con cuatro integrantes. Las cuatro personas se dedican especialmente al Comercio Compra y venta de ropa nueva, venta de  plásticos. El préstamo que solicitan es para la ampliación de capital así podrán  incrementar el volumen de ventas. Esperan que con el prestamos obtengan mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Onofre Y. P. is married. He finished second grade and has six children – four daughters and two sons. Three of his children are married and the other three are still under his care. He works buying and selling new clothing and has been in the business for 20 years. He is enthusiastic and has the help of some neighbors and friends who organized a group to be able to request a loan.

Their solidarity group is called Flor del Comercio and has four members. The four individuals work specifically buying and selling new clothing, and selling plastic. The loan that they are requesting is to increase their capital so that they can increase their amount of sales. They hope that they earn more income with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sofía Inés

texts.es: Sofía Inés F. D. C. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. únicamente junto a su esposo en el departamento D. La Unión. Sofía posee un taller D. corte y confección, en donD. se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. batas y camisones para niños, ponchos para personas adultas, ropa para damas y caballeros. Esta la comercializa, visitando diferentes oficinas, en donD. las ofrece a los empleados del lugar, los cuales incluso le hacen pedidos previos, lo cual es muy bueno para Sofía, ya que elabora un número D. prendas D. vestir las cuales son ganancias seguras, así mismo comercializa sus productos en su casa D. habitación en donD. venD. con sus amigos y vecinos. Sofía solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: ropa interior, telas, hilos, botones y otros elementos más los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración D. la ropa que comercializa, lo que le permita contar con mayores ventas y D. esta forma mejorar su negocio y la estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en: Sofía Inés F. D. C. is 55 years old. She lives only with her husband in the Department of La Unión. Sofía has a tailoring workshop, where she makes and sells smocks and dresses for children, ponchos for adults and clothing for men and women. She sells them by visiting various offices, where she offers them to the employees of the place. Some people place orders with her, which is very good for Sofía, since it means that some of the garments she makes represent guaranteed profits. She also sells her products from her home, to her friends and neighbors. Sofía is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other items which are necessary to make the clothing she sells. This will permit her to achieve higher sales and thus improve her business and the stability of her household.

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread and buttons to make clothing

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el barrio Samanacruz, una zona urbano marginal que se ubica en la ciudad de Cajamarca, una  de las ciudades mas representativas de la sierra norte del país. Conocida por sus festividades y movimiento comercial.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a los vecinos de su barrio diversos productos de uso diario. Su negocio cuenta con grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su negocio debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato con el que los atiende. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea expandir su negocio ampliando su inventario, de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante tranquila y trabajadora. Sus ganas de salir adelante hacen que siempre se esfuerce por mantener su negocio. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Ysabel is a 28 year-old mother who lives with her husband and her youngest child in the Samanacruz neighborhood which is a poor urban area in the city of Cajamarca, one of the most characteristic cities of the country's northern mountains.  It is known for its festivals and its commercial activity.

María sells basic necessities and groceries from a small grocery store located in her home. There she offers her neighbors a number of everyday products.  Her business has a group of loyal customers who prefer her business owing to the quality of products which she offers and the politeness and friendliness with which she serves them.  With the income which she earns from this activity she helps her husband contribute to the family's finances.

María would like to expand her business, expanding her inventory so that she can satisfy the increasing demand from her customers.  For this reason, she decided to request her first loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a pretty quiet and hard-working woman.  Her desire to get ahead in life means that she is always working hard to take care of her business.  People who know her consider her to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase of basic necessities and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: abla est une femme de 40 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce commerce. elle a remarqué une hausse de la demande de sa clientèle liée probablement aux activités de fin d'année, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 5 cartons de fils à coudre, 10 boîtes de bouton, 4 cartons de fermeture et divers.
texts.en: Abla, aged 40, is a very dynamic lady. She is married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by selling haberdashery. She has a 3-year experience in this trade. She noticed that the demand from her clientele was rising, probably due to the end-of-year celebrations. She came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 5 boxes of sewing thread, 10 boxes of buttons, 4 boxes of zippers and various articles.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery articles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 34 años, convive con Teófilo, de 48 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Sherly, de 16 y Robert, de 13 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. El tejido de sábanas, chompas, ponchos y tapices. Es su principal actividad, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a este oficio, que le da muy buenas ganancias, ya que después de culminar sus tejidos los comercializa en la ciudad de La Oroya, Cerro de Pasco, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Según cuenta la habilidad que adquirió en el tejido, le permiten acabar 2 sábanas a la semana. Verónica se siente satisfecha con los logros que está alcanzando, ya que ayuda económicamente a su esposo Teófilo, el que se dedica al trasporte público. Ahora ella, está planeando adquirir un nuevo telar (instrumento que le permite tejer), para poder tejer en mayores cantidades. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como buena socia de su banco comunal, siente que tiene que trabajar arduamente, para poder sacar adelante a su familia y a su organización. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 70 libras de lana de colores y sintético, asimismo comprará hilo de algodón, que sirve para tejer sábanas.
texts.en:
Verónica, 34, lives with Teófilo, 48.  They have two children: Sherly, 16, and Robert, 13.  They live together in family unity in their own house located in San Pedro de Cajas.  Her main activity is weaving sheets, sweaters, ponchos and tapestries.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  It provides good profits because when she completes items she sells them in the cities of La Oroya and Cerro de Pasco where she goes twice a month.

According to what she relates, her weaving skills allow her to finish two sheets per week.  Verónica feel very satisfied with her accomplishments to date because she is able to help Teófilo, who is in public transportation, economically.

She is now planning to acquire a new loom (a tool that allows her to weave) in order to weave more quantity.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and, as a good member of her communal bank, she believes that she has to work hard to move her family and her organization ahead.

She will use the requested loan to buy 70 pounds of colored wool and synthetics as well as cotton thread that’s used to weave sheets.

loans.use: To buy 70 pounds of colored wool and synthetic fabric as well as cotton thread to weave bedsheets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah S. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Sarah is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as cosmetics and lotions from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sarah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sarah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe L. is 55 years old, married and has six children. She is from the village of Poblacion on the island of Mindanao. To make a living, Maria Fe sells a variety of different dried foods to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Maria Fe joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her third from PMPC, of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru: Сафаров Файзали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается перевозкой людей по маршруту Яван-Душанбе. В этой области уже 12 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Fayzali S. lives in the Yavan Region. 47 years of age. Married, with five children. He has secondary education. He transports passengers between Yavan and Dushanbe. He has been in this business for 12 years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mrs. Un S. lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province and she was born in 1963.  She is a Khmer cake seller in local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family and she is a duck breeder too.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  So to improve her business, Mrs. Un S. is asking for a loan to buy more than two hundred ducks and duck food for breeding.  She is a widow who has a child who is married.

loans.use: To buy more than two hundred ducks and duck food for breeding

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn M. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Marlyn is separated from her spouse and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals, like adobo and afritada, to customers in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients & working capital

loans.name: Oyugi

texts.en:
Oyugi, 51, is married with three school-aged children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. His main products are tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, pineapples, bananas, maize and milk, which are all sold locally. He depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. In the future, he would like to expand his farming activities and own a posho mill. He says that his major challenge has been poor weather conditions, which affects his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun C. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more supplies to expand her husband’s construction business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more construction supplies to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  G.  LABORA COMO ANALISTA DE RECLAMO ,ES CASADA ,TIENE  TRES  PERSONAS A SU CARGO, ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRAR CINZ PERLINES, MANO DE OBRA, PARA  ENTECHAR  YA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO EN SU VIVIENDA
texts.en:
Mrs. G. works as a claim analyst, is married and has three dependents. 
This is her first loan from Ceprodel and she is grateful for the opportunity given by the institution. This loan is needed to buy zinc sheets and pay labor to put a roof on her house which is in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bangu

texts.en: Bangu is currently in a business of selling food items in a hotel. She is 36 years old and married, with two children who go to school. Bangu requested a loan to stock more food items to sell.  In the future, she hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more food items to sell.

loans.name: Los Reyes Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Los Reyes", porque decidierón invertir en su negocio pidiendo un prestamo el 6 de enero día de los Reyes Magos. Se ubican en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 09 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Maria Elena A. es un integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de tooper, que inicio hace tres años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra e inversión de mercancia y asi poder tener mas variedad en sus productos obteniendo una mejor calidad de servicio para sus clientes. La señora Maria Elena tiene 20 años, estudio hasta eltercer año de secundaria, soltera, vive con sus padres. Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio por su caracter, con variedad en sus productos y buenos precios, además cuenta con lo necesario para satisfacer sus necesidades. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre ya que va a poder cumplir con las espectativas de sus clientes y así contribuir en los gastos economicos y necesidades de su familia, logrando así una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group is called “Los Reyes” (The Kings) because they decided to invest in their business requesting a loan on January 6th, Three Kings Day.  They are located in the state of Puebla in México.  The group has 9 members and this is the second time they’ve asked for a loan.

Mrs. María Elena A. is a group member.  She sells Tupperware; she started three years ago.  She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise in order to have a wider assortment of products available to provide better customer service.

María Elena is 20 years old and finished 9th grade.  She is single living with her parents.  Her customers are of the opinion that she has good service thanks to her character, the variety of products and her good prices.  Besides, she has everything needed to meet their needs.

She feels happy about the loan because she will meet her customers’ expectations and be able to contribute to her family’s expenses and economic needs attaining thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy Tupperware.

loans.name: Troeng

texts.en:
Troeng is a businesswoman who sells many different wares in the Toul Krang High School, Kompong Chhnang province. She has been running this business since 2006, making a profit of, on average, $3 a day. Most of her items are study materials, souvenir goods, soft drinks, and other essential products. 

To share responsibility, her husband works as a motor taxi driver. They have four single children, two of whom are working. The other two are studying and depend on her care and her income. In order to increase her daily income, Troeng would like to request a loan to purchase additional goods for resale.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 31 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she operates a retail shop.  She has sustained her business for 11 years.  She has managed to increase her business stock with previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  In five years, she sees herself opening another retail shop and building rental houses.  She has requested 100,000 KES to buy rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old, and has two children with her husband David.  She has been operating a restaurant in Tala town where she sells various types of meals to her customers.  Her monthly income is KES 9,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and this is her second loan from the organization.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy cooking oil, baking flour, corn flour, firewood, charcoal, salt and sugar.  The anticipated profits will help her to educate her children, and, in the future, to grow her business and own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking flour, corn flour, firewood, charcoal, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Yolanda radica por mas de 20 años en Huancayo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Vende ropa y accesorios para bebes, niños pequeños y personas adultas desde hace más de 6 años en un puesto de ventas que tiene en la feria comercial de su localidad. Asimismo se establece en otros puestos cuando hay ferias en otras localidades, por el momento su negocio realiza de manera ambulante y dispone de su carpa para armar provisionalmente su puesto de ventas. Manifiesta que su negocio es rentable porque compra su mercadería al por mayor  directamente de las fabricas de confección de ropa porque es ahí donde consigue  mayor variedad a menor precio. Se entero de los créditos que otorga MFP por medio de un familiar y desde ese entonces ya son 23 veces en las que tiene un préstamo de manera grupal y considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia de trabajo solidario que hoy es su gran aliada en el desarrollo de su negocio. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. En esta ocasión con el dinero comprará más ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda has lived in Huancayo for more than 20 years.  She lives together with her husband and her four children.

Yolanda's business is selling clothes and accessories for babies, small children and adults.  She has been in this business for more than six years.  She makes her sales from a stall in the street market in her town.  She also sets up her stall when there are street markets in other towns.  Right now, she makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and has an awning that she uses to temporarily set up her sales stall.  Yolanda tells us that her business is profitable because she buys her merchandise wholesale directly from clothes factories.  This is where she is able to obtain the best variety of products at the lowest prices.

Yolanda found out about MFP loans through a family member.  She has now had 23 group loans and she believes that she has good experience of working as part of a team and that this team is now her greatest ally in making progress in her business.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her to continue in her work.  On this occasion, she will use her loan money to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to stock her business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with seven family members,  three of whom work.


Hussein has had a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 


He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy showcases,  a generator and a refrigerator for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy showcases, a generator and a refrigerator for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for fattening his pigs.

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru:
Махмадрачаб женат и отец 3 детей.  Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек.  Его ценят все его соседи и друзья. Он всегда помогает другим и сделает добро. Более 14 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. За многие эти годы он изучал все слабые стороны данного бизнеса и набрал достаточное знание, чтобы продолжат и развивать данный бизнес в дальнейшем.  Махмадрачаб хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота, горюче смазочные материалы, минеральных удобрений и семена с целью расширения бизнеса и получение прибыли. Заранее хочет поблагодарит вас за вашу поддержку. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mahmadrajab is married and the father of three children. He is a very hardworking and good man. He is appreciated by all his friends and neighbors. He always helps others and does good. He has been farming for more than fourteen years.  For many of those years he studied all the weaknesses of his industry and gained enough knowledge to continue to develop his business now and in the future. Mahmadrajab would like to receive a loan of $1000 to buy livestock, fuel and lubricants, fertilizer, and seeds to increase his yield and his profits. He wants to thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy livestock, fuel and lubricants, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Sadia

texts.fr:
Sadia est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un soudeur ferrailleur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.  
Sadia travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle achète et revend des céréales à sa clientèle. Elle est seule impliquée dans son activité. 
Sadia a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sadia voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Sadia is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a welder and scrap metal merchant. They couple have 4 children aged between 3 and 9, who all go to school. Sadia has been a small retailer since 2000. She runs a one woman business selling cereals. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy more grain for resale. Over the next few years, Sadia would like to grow her business and plans to use the profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy grain for resale.

loans.name: Janina Claudina

texts.es:
En el Barrio Santa Isabel (Localidad de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil) reside Janina de 21 años que fue motivada por su cuñada a vender mercadería como ropa, perfumes (AVON), y joyas (Yanbal), además lo que le gusto es que de acuerdo a sus ventas puede ganar premios como electrodomésticos, sabanas, tv etc. Ella trabaja de lunes a domingo de 8:30 a 19:00 pm.
Está casada con Héctor que es albañil y tienen un hijo de 8 meses. En sus recorridos a vender sus productos ha pasado inconvenientes como asaltos, pero eso no la desanima ya que debe seguir luchando. Ellos quieren un crédito para comprar perfumes, ropa y bisutería, además quisiera tener un local propio en su casa y poder compartir con su pequeño hijo más tiempo.
texts.en:
Janina is 21 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Isabel, which is located in the Isla Trinitaria section of Guayaquil. She was encouraged by her sister-in-law to sell merchandise such as clothes, Avon perfumes, and Yanbal jewelry.
