Janina enjoys making sales because she is able to win prizes such as appliances, bedding, TVs, and other items. She works Monday through Sunday from 8:30am to 7pm.

Janina is married to Héctor, who works as a mason. They have an eight-month-old son. She has been assaulted before while traveling to make her sales, but this has not discouraged her from continuing to strive in her work. Janina is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, clothing, and jewelry. She would like to have her own shop in her house so that she can spend more time with her young son.

loans.use: to buy to buy perfumes, clothing, and jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
Maria Roxana nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Maria Roxana tiene 42 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos de (16 y 13 años de edad). 

Maria Roxana vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en el colegio particular El Carmelo. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. En sus horas libres Maria Roxana se dedica a la venta ropa a pedido del cliente.   

En esta oportunidad Maria Roxana requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo zapatos, botas, polos, casacas y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Maria Roxana es que sus hijos se han profesionales. 
   
El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria Roxana was born in the Cusco department. She is 42, widowed, and has two children ages 16 and 13.

Maria Roxana lives and works in the city where she was born. She is a teacher and works at the El Carmelo private school. She has taught for 25 years and it is going very well for her. In her free time, Maria Roxana sells clothing based on customer orders.

Maria Roxana needs this loan to purchase clothing, for example shoes, boots, polos, jackets, and more. Maria Roxana's dream is for her children to be professionals.

The “Comuzone IV” Communal Bank meets every month in Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a tourist and business zone, and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival. It is also known because it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shoes, boots, polos, jackets, and more.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children.

Haydar has owned an upholstery shop since 2004. He works in providing furniture, especially chairs, with padding, webbing, and fabric or leather covers. He has more than ten years experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of potential customers who pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan in order to renovate his shop and to make two sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make two sliding doors.

loans.name: Ruth Yory

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth se dedica   a la venta de salteña y de pan casero, desde muy tempranas horas del día prepara sus masas, la Sra. tiene 48 años, esta casada con el señor Oscar quien es tornero pero por el momento le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio repartiendo junto con ella sus productos, tiene  4 hijos todos estudian, realiza sus ventas por diferentes partes de la ciudad, viven por la zona del plan 3000, trabajan de lunes a domingo, su panadería se encuentra en su propio domicilio. La Sra. Ruth es clienta de  la institución, es una persona responsable que demostró buen historial de pago también algunos fines de semana vende comida, su esposo le colabora con la entrega de salteñas, pero quiere reabrir nuevamente su taller de tornería es por eso que solicito el crédito para la compra de calaminas para  ampliación de un tinglado. Son personas que luchan para ver a sus hijos profesionales, ese es su deseo.
texts.en:
Ruth sells home-made bread and turnovers [salteñas].  She starts preparing her dough very early in the morning.  She is 48 years old and married to Oscar who is a lathe operator but currently helps his wife in the business delivering her products with her.  She has four children who are all going to school.  Her sales happen throughout the various parts of the city.  They live in the Plan 3000 neighborhood and work Monday through Sunday.  Her bakery is located in her home.

Ruth is a client of the institution.  She’s a responsible person who exhibited good repayment history.  Occasionally on weekends she also sells food.  Her husband helps her deliver the turnovers but he’d like to reopen his metal shop and this is the reason for the loan request: to buy plywood sheets to enlarge a shed.  They are people who struggle to see their children become professionals; this is their wish.

loans.use: to buy sheets of plywood to build a small shed.

loans.name: Vicente Alcibiades

texts.es:
El señor Vicente tiene 46 años de edad, está casado con la sra Maria y tienen 4 hijos de 20, 18, 15 y 13 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores ya trabajan y los dos menores están todavía en el colegio.
Don Vicente  comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba  por su cuenta como Talabartero(trabajos realizados sobre Cueros) contaba con máquinas y también con personales, pero que luego hubo una época de escasez y dejó ese trabajo.
Actualmente  se dedica como comerciante en forma de macate (ambulante) ya que lleva todo tipos de productos  para la venta por el interior del país y por sobretodo en el Chaco, para ello alquila una camioneta donde una vez a la semana sale a vender a los pequeños comercios de la zona que visita, normalmente ya tiene su propia clientela formada.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra al por mayor de los productos que vende, como ser prendas de vestir, frazadas, pantalones, calzados y demás.
texts.en:
Vicente is 46, and married to María. They have four children, ages 20, 18, 15, and 13 respectively. The two eldest are already working, and the two youngest are still in school. Vicente tells us that previously he worked on his own account as a saddler (work done with leather). He used to have machines and also a workforce, but then he had a lean season, and left this line of work.

Currently he works as a travelling salesperson, as he carries all kinds of products to sell in the interior of the country and especially in the Chaco region. That's why he rents a small truck, and once a week goes out to sell to the small businesses of the area that he visits. He already has his own established list of customers. 

The loan he is applying for, is to buy at wholesale the products he sells, such as articles of clothing, blankets, pants, footwear, and other merchandise.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing, blankets, and other merchandise for later sale.

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna is a mason, while his wife, Savang (pictured together) stays at home and does housework. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have five children- four sons and one daughter. Two are traditional musicians and other two are still young.  

Bunna is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Margen

texts.en:
Margen a 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.  She is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Margen grows corn to sell, which she has been doing for over five years.  She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Margen is requesting her sixth loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for services to increase her crop yield. Margen joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Sael

texts.en:
Sael is a 32 year-old young man.   He is married and has three sons and two daughters.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary and he also works in agriculture to improve his income. Sael wants to prepare the green houses well for the coming winter's agricultural season by purchasing seedlings, fertilizers, etc,, but he hasn't enough money to pay for them.
   
He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Sael gets the loan, he will purchase what he needs to have better crops.  Then he will compete with others and increase his sales in agriculture.  That will increase his income and offer his family better living conditions. Sael is photographed in his green house.

loans.use: To prepare the green houses for the season by purchasing seedlings, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y gaseosas. Tiene más de 9 años de experiencia en este medio de vida. Ella es una persona responsable pues disfruta el tener un medio de trabajo. Elida sueña con llegar a tener un local mucho más grande y poder ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Elida is 49 years old. She sells clothing and soft drinks. She has more than 9 years experience in this way of life. 

She is a responsible person and she enjoys her work. Elida dreams of having a much larger facility and to be able to offer a greater variety of products. 

Her reason for this loan is to buy pants, blouses, skirts, and suits, among other products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, among other products

loans.name: Salau

texts.en:
Salau has been farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 32 years old, married, and supports six people.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Veronica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Tutor Jaya Group

texts.en:
Nuryanih is pictured in the middle wearing a blue jacket. Nuryanih is married. She is a mother of three children. They are Fajar, Satrio and Wiji. All of them are still going to school. She has been selling crickets since 2010. The business is going well but she needs a cage to accomomdate the cricket's harvest. That is why she is taking her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use her part of the loan to make a cage for her cricket's harvest. She likes to run this business because when the harvest time comes, she does not have any competitors. Income from her business can help her husband who is a policeman to prepare their daily basic needs.

In the future, she wants to keep expanding her business and she hopes she can continuously give her children a better education even until university.

The other group members will use their part of the loan to expand their businesses, which include selling vegetables, selling snacks and running a beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make a cricket cage

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né en Novembre 1964 à Doumanani préfecture de Sikasso, Souleymane est polygame avec 2 femmes et père 11 enfants résidant à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur  Souleymane après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié il y a environ deux années au domaine du commerce notamment à la vente du bois de chauffe dans lequel il s'approvisionne à Denderso et environnants. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel; le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Avec ce deuxième prêt, il compte acheter 5 chargements de camion “10 tonnes” en bois de chauffe. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Souleymane was born in November 1964 in Doumanani, a prefecture of Sikasso. He is a polygamist, and he has two wives and eleven children. His family lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

About two years ago, after having pursued several business activities unsuccessfully, Souleymane began buying and selling firewood. He buys the firewood in Denderso and its surrounding areas. He is in very high demand thanks to the quality of his product.

To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second individual loan through Soro Yiriwaso. His first loan was repaid properly.

With this second loan, he plans to buy five truckloads (10 tonnes) of firewood.

With this loan, he plans to achieve monthly profits of 175,000 FCFA, which will mainly the used to cover family expenses and pay the interest of his loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine âgée de 41 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Madeleine  est veuve. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine vit ensemble avec  ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Madeleine vend depuis dix ans du mais. De plus, Madeleine vend aussi de l’igname et de la farine de blé comme activité secondaire. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Madeleine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite pour une sixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de l'igname, du haricot et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Khusnul

texts.en: Khusnul is a diligent student who still lives with her family at Rengel of East Indonesia. She is young and attractive student. Her parents are food sellers who earns more than enough income for cover their daily needs. Khusnul is a student of the one of prospective Ronggowale University in her city. Khusnul faced lack of money for university fees, which is why she borrowed a loan to pay for those fees. She is grateful for a micro credit thus she can continue studying and achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en: Hak’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: María Norma

texts.en:
Miss Maria and her family, her husband and two children, whom are still minors, live in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Because their house is very small she started to help her family to improve their living conditions and be more financially stable. This is when, three years ago, she started making a selling foods from her own home. Her husband is a labourer and his employment is occassional which is why their income is so unsteady.

The commitment to her family and the will to pull them through has motivated Miss Maria to find a solution to their problems. But now she requires a loan in the amount of $375. Her primary goal is to ensure an education for her little ones, which is why she needs your help today. Become part of Miss Maria's and her family's successes.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María y su familia, esposo y dos hijos, aun menores de edad, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Debido a que su casa en muy pequeña ella decidió ayudar a su familia a tener mejores condiciones de vida y una mayor estabilidad financiera, y entonces cuando, hace ya casi 3 años comenzó a elaborar y vender comida en su propio domicilio. Pues su marido es albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por lo que los ingresos no seguros.

El compromiso con su familia y las ganas de salir adelante impulsaron a Doña María a encontrar una solución a sus problemas, pero ahora ella requiere de un préstamo para continuar, por la cantidad de $375 DLLS. Su principal preocupación es asegurar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños, es por ello que ahora necesita de tu ayuda, se parte de los logros Doña María y su familia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy 4 bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor produces cow's milk, the same kind that is processed at the Pil Andina in La Paz (the industrial milk plant). He also works as a tractor driver, readying the soil to plant onions and potatoes. This work is his principal source of income, and with his earnings he supports his three children and wife.

Victor lives Achacachi, a small community 2 hours outside of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to purchase a cow of medium breed to increase his milk production. It is the first loan that Victor has applied for from IMPRO, and the evaluacion done by his loan officers has qualified him to enter IMPRO's program.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Víctor es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); el también trabaja como tractorista (prepara la tierra para sembrar cebolla y papa) y es su principal fuente de ingreso para la manutención de sus tres hijos y esposa que dependen de él.

Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos hora de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Dr. Sykes

texts.en:
Dr. A. A. Sykes is a 54-year-old medical doctor. She is divorced with three children, all in secondary school. Dr. Sykes runs a dispensary, Sykes Medical Dispensary, which can accommodate about twenty patients, located in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s busiest trading area. Her dispensary accommodates cases like malaria, cough, and non-complicated sicknesses together, with first aid services. Complicated cases are referred to the main hospitals immediately.

Alongside the dispensary, she runs a pharmacy which is now two years old, where patients can always go and get medicine after prescription by the physicians. She buys stock from the main suppliers, most of them in the Kariakoo area. She is in need of USD 1200 to help her expand the stock to satisfy the increasing demand of the medicine, and because the number of patients has also increased.

loans.use: Buy stock for the Pharmacy

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en: I am Hafeezan B. and I live in Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. My husband is a daily wage laborer while my daughter and I stitch clothes on order from my neighborhood. My eldest son works for a local newspaper printing press whereas the other one makes embroidered clothes on a four-legged embroidery frame. I want my children to have a decent living, which is possible with a good income. I have planned to create a joint-venture between my stitching business and my son’s embroidery business. The outfits that we will prepare we will sell  to various expensive boutiques in our city. This venture can generate decent profits to us. We need USD250 to buy the required stuff.

loans.use: EXPAND CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. Larrea lives with his wife and their thirteen-year-old son in Villeta, Paraguay. Together they run a small wooden stand from which they sell fast local-food favorites, such as empanadas, sandwiches, and milanese. They have had this stand for eleven years. A year ago, they began working with the Fundación Paraguaya, which utilizes programs like Kiva to give mico-financing to small business owners like Pedro and his wife.

Since their first loan, they have been able to paint their stand. Though otherwise a small achievement, paint is quite expensive, and the loan has allowed them to accomplish this without making sacrifices that would hurt business. In their newly-refurbished stand, they are doing better than ever. However, the couple tells us that they must get up at 3am daily in order to commute into the city and stock their stand. They are forced to shop in the nearby supermarket, though slightly more expensive, because it is the only store open at that hour. Additionally, all merchandise must be carried to the store for lack of other transportation.

In the future, Pedro and his wife would like to buy a van. The van will allow them to transport their goods with greater ease and purchase more at one time. Also, they want to start a delivery route. As he continues to improve his business and his life, Pedro tells us that his dream is to open a store closer to his home and to earn enough money to ensure the education of his son. It is important to Pedro and his wife that he have the opportunity to become a professional and not have to sacrifice as they do.

The money will go toward purchasing flour, eggs, meat, and drinks.

loans.use: The money will go toward purchasing flour, eggs, meat, and drinks.

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en: Gataiala is a married woman from Lepale village. She is 54 years of age. She is one of the longest standing members of the SPBD centre. She and her two sons run a taro plantation. Her first and second loan were used to buy chemicals and tools for her plantation business. She sells two to three bags of taro twice a week and she gets $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD). She would like a third loan to buy farming supplies for her taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Zinyet

texts.en: Zinyat is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. She and her family of her husband and two children were relocated to Sumgayit as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She is engaged in mobile household goods sales. She travels with the goods and sometimes sells them from her house. She has many good clients that know her and buy goods from her. Now she is a bit short in her goods. She has taken loans from Normicro Sumgayit branch and successfully repaid them back. Now she applies again for the fourth time for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the number of goods

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en: Biljana is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in Trno, near the town Laktaši. Her children are both in primary school. Her husband has a permanent job and earns a monthly income of 700 KM. Biljana runs a small bookkeeping shop, and plans to use this loan to renovate her office. This will ensure better working conditions and allow her to offer more services to her clients.

loans.use: Renovation of a bookkeeping office.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
A. Muslima is 45 years old. She is married with two children. Muslima is a market vendor. She sells fabrics for the national dress. As a rule, Muslima travels to Dushanbe to purchase goods to sell, and increase her stock. The national dresses are very popular in Tajikistan, which has allowed Muslima to run her business successfully for 8 years. She has generated a stable and significant income for her family.

Now Muslima is planning to enlarge her stock once more. With this purpose, she requests $875.00 for the term of 4 months. Muslima has taken out a loan already from IMON, and had proven herself a reliable client. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for the national dresses to increase my range of goods.

loans.name: Kagwada South 2013-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Esther D.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Esther is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has 3 children ranging from ages 4 to 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately 240 Sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Esther is joined in her small group by Rose K., Hellen F., Flora K., and Tabu L.. Rose K. sells bread and wants to expand her business. Hellen F. runs a hotel and wants a loan to expand her business. Flora K. operates a business of brewing alcohol and wants to expand her business. Tabu L. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Jose Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio is married but does not have children. His wife is a housewife. A year ago, Claudio was unemployed and began to sell soft drinks, later fried foods, and, little by little, started his business. Now his business has a greater assortment, also selling "pan dulce" (pastries) and some groceries. Each day he wants to improve his business and to increase the products he sells so that he has what people want.

He needs a loan of $600 that he will repay in six months to remodel his store. With your support, he will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudio esta casado, pero no tiene hijos su esposa se dedica al hogar. Hace un año quedo desempleado y empezó a vender refrescos, y luego frituras y así poco a poco emprendió su negocio, ahorita ya lo tiene mas surtido ya que también vende pan dulce y algo de abarrotes pero quiere cada día acondicionarlo mas, y aumentar los productos que vende conforme la gente se lo solicite.

El necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su tienda. Con tu apoyo el lo lograra.

loans.use: Remodelar su tienda

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena baji is the wife of M. A.. She has been married for the last 35 years. She is a mother of ten children: five daughters and five sons. Her first son is a dentist. Her first daughter is a nurse. One of her sons quit his studies after he received an education to the 5th standard. Her husband is a driver and drives a horse cart. She is applying for a loan for her son, who wants to drive an auto-rickshaw.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Sumera baji, who wants a loan for her grocery shop; Rabia baji wants a loan for her food business; Zikran baji wants a loan for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Trabajando Unidos Group

texts.es:
Hi!  We're the Trabajando Unidos ("Working Together") group.  We're all merchants, each with our own small business.  We have various years of experience operating our businesses.  We know each other well, having long worked together.  Thanks to the incomes from our different businesses, we can support our families.  We should mention, too, how grateful we are to all of you for the support that you extend to us so that we can push our businesses forward.

These are the businesses that we've created:

Rosa Idalia Del Carmen E..  I'm a merchant.  I have a general store in the center of my town.  I'm a single mother and I have a high school-aged son who helps me with the business in his spare time.  I'm asking for your help so that I can stock my business and meet the demand of my customers.

Carlos Alberto C..  My main work is reselling merchandise but I'm also the pastor of a church in my town.  I work as a street vendor, selling milk products.  I have 5 elementary school-aged children.

Jose Daniel C..  My main work is selling and repairing bicycles.  I've made a living this way for some years and, thanks to God, it generates enough income to cover the needs of my family.  I'm married and have 4 children, all of whom are school-aged.  They help me with the business and together we're pushing it forward.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Hola nosotros somo sle grupo Trabajando Unidos, todos somos comerciantes cada uno tenemos pequeños negocios, los  que son administrados por nosotros,  tenemos varios años de experincia en nuestras actividades que hacemos, nos conocemos bien siempre hemos trabajado juntos, gracias a los ingresos que percibimos de nuestros diferentes negocios podemos cubrir los gastos de nuestras familias . Es importante mencionar que gracias al apoyo que ustedes nos brinden, podemos salir adelante con nuestros negocios.

estas son las actividades que realizamos:

Rosa Idalia Del Carmen E. soy comerciante tengo una puperia hubicada en el centro de mi  comunidad soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo el que esta cursando la secundaria  el que me colabora su tiempo libre razon por la cual solicito el apoyo de ustedes para poder abastecer mas mi negocio y poder cubrir con las exigencias de todos mis clientes.

Carlos Alberto C. mi actividad principal es el comercio y  tambien pastoreo la iguesia de mi comunidad cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos lacteos los que  distrbuyo de forma ambulante tengo 5 hijos los que estan cursando educacion primaria. 

Jose Daniel C.   Mi actividad principal es la venta y reparacion de Bicicletas, tengo  varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, estoy casado y tenemos 4 hijos,  actualmente mis hijos estan en edad escolar,  ellos me colaboran y asi juntos sacamos adelante el negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mary's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12. She owns her own clothing store. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and finishes at 6PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $225.

Mary is now requesting a loan in order to expand her current stock. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven M., 43, is a rice farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To earn a living, she is also a rice dealer and is able to make US$4 each day. Her husband is a construction worker and normally makes US$2.5 each day. This couple has four children; two of whom are students and two others who work in construction building houses. Mrs. Ven is requesting a loan from Kiva to add rice stock and raise pigs for extra profit to support the family.

loans.use: To add rice stock and raise pigs for extra profit

loans.name: Kossi-Doh Agbémavi

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kossi-Doh Agbémavi est né en 1961 à Tsévié. Infirmier de profession, il est marié et père de six enfants.

Fonctionnaire moyen , il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille étant donné que le salaire est insuffisant. Après les soins médicaux, les patients sont obligés de faire d’autres distances avant de pouvoir acheter leur prescription, ce qui les fatigue. Pour  cela, une mini pharmacie à côté du dispensaire serait un atout pour ces patients.

 Ainsi, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit pour réaliser ce projet dont la réalisation sauvera beaucoup de vies humaines.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi-Doh Agbémavi A. was born in Tsévié in 1961. He's a trained medical assistant, he is married and the father of six children. His position as mid-level public servant does not enable him to provide for his family due to an insufficient salary. After being treated, patients have to travel to buy their prescription, which weary them. To this effect, a pharmacy near the dispensary would be very useful. Mr. A. is thus seeking a loan to realize this project, which will save many human lives.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a pharmacy to sell generic medicines

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es estudiante universitario en la carrera de informática y se dedica en sus horarios libres a dar clases se calculo, matemáticas y estadística y también realiza mantenimiento de computadoras.
Es soltero y los ingresos provenientes de las actividades que realiza alcanzan para cubrir sus costos de universidad 
Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz,  en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de un curso de informática que Carlos necesita para actualizar sus conocimientos.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial le califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos is a computer science major in college. In his spare time, he gives calculus, mathematics and statistics lessons. He also repairs computers. He is single, so the income he earns from his business activities is sufficient to cover his university fees. He lives in his parents’ home in the Alto Obrajes district of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to pay for one of his computer science courses, which he needs in order to bring his computer skills up to date. This is the third time he requests a loan from Impro. His credit history qualifies him as a client 1, which means he pays off his loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a computer science course

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth N. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Elizabeth sells groceries in Abakrampa, near Abura, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Elizabeth plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak C. is a 34-year-old resident of the Kompong Tom Province. She earns a living by sewing clothes as a local tailor. She is running her business very well and a lot of clients recognize her good service. She started her work in 2005, and currently earns a profit of $5 a day. C. is a mother of three children, all of whom are single and are employed. Her son is a construction worker; her two daughters assist with her farm business, and her husband is also a construction worker. C. now requests a $250 loan to buy oxen to raise. Oxen is a main source of raising income for renting by farmers. (C.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy oxen to raise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 27 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive sola en casa de unos familiares. Se dedica a la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante, el cual puso en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hace 6 años y felizmente le arroja buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos cada vez son mejores, gracias a los clientes que cada vez prefieren su sazón. Lo que le gusta a Vilma de su trabajo es la cocina, siempre le ha gustado la preparación de ricos platos los cuales son el deleite de sus clientes, lo complicado muchas veces es el abastecerse para cocinar para tantas personas, para lo cual a veces no se da abasto. Vilma al hacer crecer su negocio decidió obtener un préstamo de Microfinanzas Prisma para lograr expandirlo y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien, este es su cuarto préstamo en esta entidad y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar algunas mesas, ollas, y otros utensilios para mejorar la atención y si es posible contratar a un asistente de cocina que le ayude a abastecerse para toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Vilma is 27 years old and is from the city of Juliaca. She lives alone in the home of one of her relatives. She works selling food in her small restaurant, which she started with a lot of effort and dedication 6 years ago. Happily, she has had good results and her earnings continue to grow, thanks to her customers that choose her seasonings. What Vilma likes most about her job is cooking; she has always liked preparing delicious dishes, much to the pleasure of her customers. The complicated part of her job is gearing herself up to cook for so many people, sometimes she doesn’t have the energy. Vilma decided to apply for a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma in order to help her business grow and expand. Since then, things have gone very well for her and she is now in her fourth loan with this organization. She is always on-time with her payments. With the money she is asking for she wants to buy some tables, cooking pots and other utensils in order to improve her service. Also, if possible she would like to hire a cook’s assistant to help her feed all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod M., 32, is married and has 4 children. He lives in Istaravshan town and works with his brother in agriculture. Five years ago, he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Farhod grows potatoes and onions, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. Farhod has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun M., 52, is a widow with three children: one son (shown in the picture with her), and two daughters. One of her daughters is a garment factory worker and her son has full-time employment. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been selling fruits and ansorm (a kind of Cambodian cake that is made from banana, sticky rice, and coconut) for two years.  She buys ingredients from Prek Anhchnh market to cook and sells in her village. She hopes to expand her business so that it will be better support her family, and that why she is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fruits for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene una refresquería, golosinas y venta de ropa, con cinco años de estar en las ventas, ella inició con fondos que sus hermanos le dieron, ya que ellos viven En los Ángeles, USA, lo cual ella invirtió en la compra de una mantenedora y vendía refrescos en el mercado oriental unos de los mas frecuentado por los Nicaragüenses, pero después de un tiempo trasladó el negocio a su casa de habitación. Tiene 55 años de edad, reside en el barrio La Fuente, sus hijas son independientes, su esposo se desempeña como técnico de reparación de electrodomésticos. Con este crédito va invertir en la compra de frutas, comprar el azúcar por quintal, gaseosas y otros productos que puedan sastifacer a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder agrandar el negocio y captar clientes para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
For five years Maria has had a small market stand where she sells soft drinks, sweets and clothing. She opened her shop with funds given to her by her brothers, who live in Los Angeles. She invested the money in the purchase of a market stand and since has sold soft drinks in the eastern market, which is one of the busiest markets in Nicaragua. After a while she moved the business to her home. Maria is 55 years old and lives in La Fuente. Her daughters are grown and her husband is employed as a household appliances repairman. She plans to use the loan to purchase fruits, sugar in bulk, soft drinks and other products her clients will like. She would like to expand the business and attract new clients to increase her revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, sugar, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат Абдурахманова  1956 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Вышла  на рынок торговать мелочами. Сейчас торгует почти 20 лет фруктами на центральном рынке Панчшанбе. Сын привозит товар, дочь помогает торговать фруктами и овощами. Её точка находится на  хорошем месте в центре рынка. Сотрудничает с  Микроинвест с 2007 года. У нее хороший спрос на фрукты, сейчас у всех авитаминоз и все покупают  у нее. Её сын привозит товар с Узбекистана, в этом он ей помогает.
Она благодарна Микроинвест  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Saodat was born in 1956, and is married with three children. She did not attend college, but instead began selling small items in the market. For almost 20 years she has sold fruit at the Panchshanbe central market. Her son keeps them supplied, while her daughter helps to sell fruit and vegetables. Her stall is located at an optimum place at the center of the market. Saodat has collaborated with MicroInvest since 2007. Her fruit is in great demand as vitamin deficiencies are common and everyone buys from her. Her son assists her by bringing in the produce from Uzbekistan. Saodat is grateful to MicroInvest for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu N. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. One of her children is in junior high school while the rest are in primary school. Abibatu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband trades in livestock while she trades in foodstuffs. Abibatu buys food stuffs such as maize, yams, and other cereals all the way from the Northern part of the country. She sells her stock to food vendors and retailers in her community. Abibatu has run this business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. is 30 years old. She lives with her family in Mambuaya Cagayan de Oro City. Her two kids go to school and her husband is a hardware employee in the city. Analyn and her husband work hard for the education of their children and for the nice future of the family.

Analyn owns a variety store at their place, where she earns 2000 to 3000 PHP each day. She wants to have more stock to accommodate the needs of her customers. She needs money for the procurement of additional items for her variety store so Analyn is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner. The amount that will be granted to her will be used for her business and partly for payment of her planned residential lot. According to Analyn, this amount would be of great help to her business and to her family. She is determined enough to change and lift their standard of living. She would be grateful to the organization that assists with her plans of improvement.

loans.use: Purchase additional items for her variety store and for payment of residential lot

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aterei A Akurut Mary Gorreti Group

texts.en: A. Mary Gorreti is 30 years old. She is married with six children who go to school, and she takes care of two other dependents. She has been selling chapati for over 5 years in her business. She is using the loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc., improving her business. She is a hard-working business woman, targeting to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a steel burner.

Ama cooks rice and sells it with variety of sauces at Kormantse near Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 1998. She uses her income to pay for feeding her family and also for paying her children’s school fees.

Ama will use the loan to purchase rice and other ingredients and also to buy utensils to add to what she uses to cook the rice. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to pay her children’s school fees.

At the time this picture was taken, she had finished selling the food and was packing up her cooking bowls.

loans.use: To buy rice and ingredients and more utensils

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R., 59, and her husband live in on the hillsides of Malaria, Caloocan City. They have one child, a son, in high school.

Teresita has been into the piggery business for the past 10 years. Wanting her to do something for herself, her husband Carlos encouraged her to venture into pig farming to do away with boredom while he is away working. Having her husband's support has greatly motivated Teresita to excel.

Teresita joined CCT in 2005 along with other small-business women in her community. Teresita plans to use this loan of P 14,000 from CCT to buy materials for the expansion of her piggery. She also plans to buy more piglets. She is very happy because she has another five pigs that are due for sale to slaughter houses by next month. She plans to continue expanding the business and greatly appreciates the opportunity to help her family.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions. www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Expansion of pig pen and buying more piglets

loans.name: Dionisia Yolanda Luisa

texts.es:
Dionisia es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga. 
Dionisia es  casada tiene 55 años, tiene cinco hijos que trabajan,
Dionisia  solo se dedicaba a su casa, pero su mamá le pidió que le  ayudara en su tienda por que ya estaba  muy anciana y sufría de asma, de repente su mama murió y cerraron la tienda, allí ella aprendió mucho sobre negocio sus hermanos le regalaron un carrito sanwichero y se puso a vender en la puerta de su casa pollo broster sandwich, salchi-papas.
Dionisia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra  mayonesa, papas, pollo. 
Desde que Dionisia esta en Finca aprendió la importancia de ahorrar y lo esta logrando y su economía ha mejorado.
El sueño de Dionisia  es  tener un restaurante
texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of Jesús de Praga community bank. She is 55 years old and has 5 children that are working. Dionisia used to only work at home, but her mother asked her to help with her store because she was old and suffering from asthma. When her mother died suddenly and the store had to be closed, Dionisia learned a lot about business. Her brothers gave her a sandwich cart and she began to sell roast chicken sandwiches and salchi-papas (fast food consisting of hot dogs and french fries) from her doorway. Dionisia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy mayonaise, potatoes, and chicken. Since Dionisia has been with Finca she has learned the importance of saving; she is currently saving and her financial situation has improved. Dionisia's dream is to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mayonaise, potatoes, and chicken.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a married man with 5 children. He is hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Mahmud has worked in farming for 20 years, and is very happy with the support of IMON International, as thanks to the loans he has received he has been able to plant more crops. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and well being. Mahmud started this activity on his own. He plans to be able to diversify his crops. With the proceeds of the loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers for his fields, in order to obtain better production and ability to sell at a better price. Be an important part of the growth of Mahmud’s business.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Culture des arachides

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy es socio del Banco Comunal Minka.
Fredy es soltero, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, de profesión profesor, Fredy viaja a la selva ayacuchana de donde compra maní, cacao, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo. Fredy tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de bebidas.
Fredy necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas.
Los sueños de Fredy son tener una empresa y hacer obras de bien social.

loans.use: Para la compra de bebidas.

loans.name: Felinda Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Felinda Caridad B. C.  es socia activa del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad ubicado en  Rocafuerte, provincia de Manabí; ella vive en la comunidad Las Jaguas a unos diez minutos de la ciudad de Rocafuerte.  Este lugar  se caracteriza por ser  un centro turístico donde todos los fines de semana  llega mucha gente a recrearse con toda la familia y a degustar de la mejor comida típica de la región.

Felinda tenía un terreno con pasto para su ganado porque su esposo se dedicaba a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno en la región,  entonces decidió ocupar una parte del terreno y montó su restaurante de comida típica llamado  Valle Hermoso, ya lleva tres años en esta actividad junto a su esposo y sus hijos; nos asegura que le va muy bien  y los platos más apetecidos por los turistas  son: caldo de gallina, empanadas, suero blanco, bolones, seco de gallina criolla, etc.

Con el crédito que la Fundación ESPOIR le entregue va a incrementar su negocio comprando otros productos para preparar  otros platos típicos como pescados, camarones, además un bar en el que ofrecerá bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral  y cerveza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felinda Caridad B. C. is an active member of the Sweet Friendship Community Bank located in Rocafuerte in the province of Manabí. She lives in the community of Las Jaguas, about ten minutes from the city of Rocafuerte. This area is characterized by being a tourism center which many people visit every weekend to enjoy themselves and sample the best traditional food of the region. Felinda had a plot of pasture land for her cattle because her husband worked raising and selling cattle in the region. She decided to use part of the land and set up a traditional food restaurant called Valle Hermoso (Beautiful Valley). She has run the business for three years, with her husband and their children. She assures us that it is going very well and the dishes most fancied by the tourists are: chicken soup, empanadas, suero blanco (whey from milk), bolones (banana/egg pastry), seco de gallina criolla (a chicken dish with a traditional sauce), etc. With this loan from the Foundation ESPOIR she will increase her business by buying other products to prepare other traditional dishes like fish and shrimp, and a bar which will offer soft drinks, mineral water, and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to add other traditional dishes and start a bar with soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en: Rosemond is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. Rosemond is a baker; more specifically, she bakes bread and then sells it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Rosemond also sells directly in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Rosemond has been in business for five years and is requesting a loan, with which she will buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: purchasing bags of flour

loans.name: Pillars Of Tomorrow Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in foodstuff. Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called Pillars of Tomorrow. Most of the group members are either into trading or farming activities. The group is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Elizabeth, the group leader, is the first from the right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Rita Cuna

texts.pt:
Rita Cuna C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 15 e 12 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Não estudou, perdeu os pais muito cedo e não teve quem fizesse seu acompanhamento. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e um sobrinho que perdeu os pais.

Mudou se da Matola para Boane há mais de 10 anos, altura em que havia conseguido um espaço para construir a sua casa. Actualmente é comerciante e dona do seu próprio negocio a 12 anos sem trabalhadores os filhos tem ajudado sempre que necessário. Vende mais roupa usada e consegue render cerca de 1.000.00mt a 2.000.00mt por dia. Poupa através do Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku porque esta perto da banca onde ela trabalha. Este é o seu 7º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para diversificar ainda mais o seu produto e satisfazer o seu mercado. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.200.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 15.500.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos aplicados para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de terminar a sua obra e solicitar mais empréstimos para canalizar a água para a sua casa.
texts.en:
Rita Cuna C. was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo. She is 42, single, and the mother of 2 children who are 15 and 12. They both go to school. She never went to school. She lost her parents very early and never had anyone to support her. She lives in her own home with her children and her nephew who lost his parents. She moved from Matola to Boane over 10 years ago because she had obtained a space to build her home. She currently is a merchant and has owned her own business for 12 years. She doesn't have employees and her children always help her when she needs it. She sells used clothing and earns between 1,000 and 2,000 meticais a day. She saves money through a traditional rotating savings system known as Xitique. She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku because it is near the bank where she works. This is her 7th loan and it is for 25,000 meticais. She will use it to buy bundles of used clothing to diversify her products even more and satisfy the market. Her previous loans were for 3,200, 5,000, 5,000, 8,000, 15,500, and 20,000 meticais and were all used for the same activity. In the future, she would like to finish building her home and to request more loans to pipe water to her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Noily

texts.en:
Noily is 42 years old. She lives on a farm with her husband, Fray Araya Masís, and their son and daughter. Their farm is located in the rural region of Turrialba, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Noily has a small business producing and selling cheese. Fray works on a local sugar cane farm as an agricultural labourer. This will be Noily´s second loan from Fundacion Mujer. Her first loan, for 100,000 colones, was paid back, on time and in full, in only six months. 

Noily has been producing and selling cheese for 2 years. She started her business with an investment of 600,000 colones. She owns 4 cows and can extract 15 litres of milk per day from each cow. Depending on the quality of milk, 15 litres can yield 2-3 kilograms of cheese. Cheese production is an intricate process that requires attention to detail at every step to ensure a quality product. Because cheese is easily contaminated, Noily must invest in expensive bacteria-fighting chemicals. Noily has found it challenging to manage this necessary cost. In a good week, she produces and sells 45 kilograms of cheese. At 1400 colones per kilogram, this translates into 250,000 colones per month. In a bad month, she might earn 140,000 colones. 

Noily is applying for a loan of 350,000 colones to buy another cow so she can increase her weekly cheese output. Her long term goals are to buy more cows and improve the cheese-production process by creating a workshop separate from her house. At the moment, Noily's kitchen doubles as her cheese-production facility. Noily also wants a line of credit from Fundacion Mujer. This loan is a step in the loan process to qualify Noily for a line of credit.

Rural areas, such as Turrialba, are characterized by many difficulties, such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education, and lack of available financial services. The highest level of formal education Noily has attained is the completion of primary school. Nevertheless, she has developed her talent for the art of commerce. Noily has arranged for a distributor from San Jose (the capital of Costa Rica) to pass by her farm every week. This distributor purchases all the cheese that Noily and her son have been able to produce. The cheese distributor travels from Turrialba to San Jose, where he sells the cheese to various restaurants and shops. 

The field consultant who has been working with Noily for the past 2 years has described Noily as shy, sincere, and hard working. Loans from Fundacion Mujer have helped her to overcome personal obstacles in periods of depression. Running her business and the resulting relationships she has formed have helped her and her family significantly.

During the 1980's, in an effort to fight the plague of poverty, the Costa Rican government decided to allocate land to impoverished citizens. The Institute of Agricultural Development (IDA) is the governmental body responsible for the selection and approval of citizens for land allotments. Many IDA land recipients, although grateful for the government’s efforts, lack the necessary funds, as well as agricultural know-how, that would allow them to use their lands in an efficient and productive manner. Noily and her family were allocated land because they met the criteria for extreme poverty. Despite her entrepreneurial spirit, Noily's efforts have been hamstrung due to her exclusion from the traditional banking system. 

This is where you can help. Your loan is a direct investment to improve the living conditions of a family living in a poor community of central Costa Rica. By lending to Noily, a proactive and hard-working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to take the first steps on a path that leads to the end of poverty.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Noily from  Costa Rica

loans.use: To buy a cow for her cheese-making business

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe B. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 29 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Phoebe owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Phoebe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Phoebe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario S. is from the village of Balanlinao Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Rosario is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosario raises pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $250 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Rosario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and to purchase feed for them. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and feed for them

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
H. Karim is an agricultural producer who has been working in this sphere of business for eleven years. He is a family man and feels responsible for supporting his three children who need help with their education. His wife is a very hardworking woman who also supports him in his production activities in order to improve their lives and be able to go on with their family life. 

Aware of the needs his family is going through, Karim requested and received a loan from IMON International three years ago. He used that loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for his harvest. Karim comes to IMON International today again to ask for a loan that may allow him to go on with his business and give his very beloved family the support they deserve.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Julián Heriberto

texts.es: Julián Heriberto H. Q. de 31 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Candelaria ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad. Julián posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, el cual esta ubicado sobre la carretera principal, la cual dirige al departamento de Cuscatlán. Desde hace 17 años que él realiza este tipo de trabajo, obteniendo mucha experiencia en el oficio, lo cual le da la ventaja de elaborar un excelente trabajo con sus clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por parte de Julián. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales para su taller tales como lijas, pinturas, herramientas y otros insumos más. Todo esto lo hace con el inmenso deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que su familia cuenta, es por ello que Julián se esfuerza mucho por realizar un excelente trabajo, y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a su hijo y su esposa.
texts.en:
Julián Heriberto H. Q. is 31 years old. He lives in the municipality of Caldelaria which is located in the department of Cuscatlan. He lives with his wife who takes care of the house and their small two-year old daughter. Julián has a paint and body shop located on the main highway to Cuscatlan. He has had this business for 17 years and has gained a lot of experience in this area. Because of his expertise, he produces excellent work for his customers and his customers are very happy with his work. He’s asking for a loan he can buy materials for his workshop with like: sandpaper, paints, tools, and other supplies. He is doing all of this to be able earn more money since this is the only source of income his family has. This is why Julian makes a great effort to do excellent work, so he can provide all the necessities for his child and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint, sandpaper, and tools to maintain cars.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 34 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Albertina  trabaja en el INABIF (El Programa Integral Nacional para el Bienestar Familiar) como cocinera, ya son dos años que trabaja en el programa. Albertina es una persona, trabajadora y emprendedora que aparte de su trabajo tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de cuyes y actualmente tiene 20 cuyes. El crédito que solicita Albertina, es para comprar 30 cuyes. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the “Qory Orcco” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 sons. Albertina has been working as a cook for INABIF (the National Integrated Program for Family Welfare) for the past two years. Albertina is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person. Aside from her regular job she also raises guinea pigs and currently has 20 of them. Albertina is requesting a credit to enable her to purchase 30 more guinea pigs.

She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to make all payments as stipulated in the repayment schedule.

(The communal bank members meet every 30 days in the city of Pucyura, a district of the city of Anta in the province of Cusco. Puycura is 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.)


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 30 guinea pigs

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He is also a farmer. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He is 48 years old and married with six children. 

He hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to buy groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kosar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen is a wife of M. R. and lives in the small city of Raiwind in Pakistan. She has a three-roomed house in which she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband has a fruit-selling business. He purchases fruits from the fruit markets and sells them on his fruit cart by travelling to various areas in the community.
Kosar runs a grocery shop in the community to share the financial burden with her husband. She also saves part of her income for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business by buying seasonal fruits in bulk.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits in bulk for resale

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 38 años de edad ella tiene mucha experiencia con los financiamientos pues han sido su principal fuente de ayuda.  Su actividad es la venta de ropa. Es madre de 2 hijos y que estaña a su cargo. Ella tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos por lo que recorre lugares muy lejanos para ofrecer lo que le encargan. Siempre esta depositando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma por lo que siempre busca la forma de mantener los ingresos para su hogar. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho pues solo así lograra mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria, 38, has two children under her care. She has a lot of experience working with loans because they have been her main source of help. She is a clothing merchant; she has been in this line of work for 10 years. She travels far and wide to fill orders. She always deposits her installment payments in a timely fashion and is always looking for ways to maintain her household income. She is asking for funding to buy raw materials because she has several pending orders to fill. Her wish is to continue working as she has done to date because this is the only way she will manage to make some needed home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es: Dolores Elizabeth B. D. P. D. 30 años D. edad, es una persona muy carismática y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos, tanto por ser muy responsable como por ser excelente persona, quien se dedica a su hogar y a su familia. Ella vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 5 y 8 años D. edad. Dolores posee un salón D. belleza en el cual se encarga D. realizar diferentes tipos D. trabajo para el cabello, así mismo comercializa productos para el cuidado D. la piel y del cabello, así mismo venD. cosméticos y ropa. Ella es muy emprendedora, quien cuenta con el deseo D. salir adelante por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos y D. esta manera poder realizar más trabajo y vender más productos. Dolores desea aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera brindarle un mejor presente y futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores Elizabeth B. D. P. is 30 years old and known for being a very charismatic and hardworking person. Her neighbors have provided good references on her behalf, stating that she is responsible and dedicated to her home and family. Dolores lives in the Department of Sonsonate with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8. She manages a beauty salon that provides different hair services. In addition, she sells hair and skin care products and clothing.

Dolores is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to purchase a large quantity of products. This will help her generate more business and increase her sales so that she can proviD. both a better present and future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 23 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen un hermoso hijo. Residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Sonia reconoce que no es fácil, salir adelante cuando se tiene consigo un hijo. Ella pensaba estudiar una carrera, pero cuando nació su hijo se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, puesto que sabe que su primera producción fue cacao y de las ventas le servían para los gastos del hogar. Hoy produce y comercializa cacao, café y maíz  y ya tiene posicionado su producto en el mercado, a la vez sus compradores se sienten satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Desde entonces sus ventas mejoraron con respecto al año anterior, de todas formas  agradece a su pareja, ya que ambos hacen buen trabajo en equipo, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de operarios para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su cosecha. Normalmente su producción lo vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un precio competitivo. Sus planes a futuro es remodelar su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago. Con el crédito que solicita invertirá en la compra de terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de ampliar su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Sonia, 23, lives with her partner and their beautiful son. They live in Quimbiri, located in the lovely jungle near Cuzco, in their own house. Sonia recognizes that it is not easy to get ahead financially when you have a child. She was thinking about studying for a career, but when her son was born, she began working in agriculture.
