Her first product was cocoa, and the sales provided enough money to cover the household expenses. Today, Sonia produces and sells cocoa, coffee, and corn. She has made a place for herself in the market, as her customers are very satisfied with the quality of the products. Sales are up compared with last year, thanks to the help of her husband who works together with her as a team. They also hire workers to help at harvest time. Normally, they sell their product in the markets of their community at a competitive price. Their future plans are to remodel their house with good materials, with the goal of improving the quality of life for their family. This is Sonia’s second loan with MFP, and she promises to faithfully meet her obligations. With this loan, she will invest in more farmland, to increase agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farmland

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
This village loan, which consists of twenty-one people, is located in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mai S. is 39 years old and is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Mai S. is a seamstress in a garment factory where she earns a small salary to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions, she is now requesting a loan to buy vegetables to resell. With her new business, she hopes her family living conditions will improve and be better than before.

Mrs. Mai S. is a widow with two children: one is a farm laborer while the youngest one is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Manuelina

texts.en:
Manuelina S. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Manuelina is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Manuelina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Manuelina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Manuelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Manuelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Manuelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle vend du carburant et des lubrifiants dans son village. Le village est très distant de la ville et on y note inexistence de station à essence alors le principal moyen de locomotion de la population est la moto. Elle tire profit de cette situation pour développer un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiants, ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer cette activité en achetant par quantité plus nombreuse. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a 34-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KANDIA since June 1, 2007 and has had six successive loans, which she has always repaid without a problem.  She sells fuel and lubricants in her village.  The village is far from the city, and people notice the lack of a gas station, while the principal means of transportation is the motorbike.  Aïssatou is deriving a profit from this situation in order to develop a small business for fuels and lubricants.  This loan will enable her to bolster this business through buying in greater quantities.  Her goal is to help to improve the family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing business in fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mahmadjon

texts.ru: Ширинов Махмадчон житель города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 24 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет в семной квартире. Клиент не имеет высшего образования. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Продает национальные женские платья. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. В будущем он хочет купить собственную квартиру.
texts.en:
Mahmadchon S. is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 24 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Mahmadchon lives in the family apartment. The client does not have a higher education. He is involved in retails sales at a market. Mahmadchon sells national women's dresses. He is requesting this loan in order to expand the merchandise assortment. In the future, he wants to buy his own apartment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise assortment

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 22 years of age and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she has established a small family home with other members. She is a good housewife who either takes care of a young child or arranges a daily routine. C. always relies on the income from her husband who works as a machinery repairman. He has a few employees who help provide his service. The family is often affected by transportation problems as they have no vehicle. Therefore, C. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 USD in order to purchase a new motorcycle to provide transport for the family. (Mrs. C.'s husband is pictured above).

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie J. sells provisions at O.I.C road in Makeni. She is hard working and committed to her business. She is married and got her start up capital from her husband, a high school graduate. She has 42 years of business experience. She needs a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to buy additional provisions and groceries. She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to send her five dependants to the university level and help her husband complete their house. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy provisions and grocery products

loans.name: Javier Esteban

texts.es:
Javier L. es el propietario de la “Tienda la Renovación”, en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la edades de 12 y 14 años, e inició con una experiencia de mas de 13 años, cuando trabajaba como empleado de un mercado de abastos, ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla, y posteriormente con su hermana emprendió un negocio de tienda, por unos años mas, hasta que decidió independizarse e iniciar su propia aventura  aprovechando este aprendizaje que hoy aplica a su microempresa.
En su tienda “La renovación”, también vende  mercancías variadas y trabaja con su esposa, la que impulsa el mercado, porque son muy reconocidos en todo el municipio. 
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización en la que fue referida por dos prestatarios vinculados a esta organización y de mucha excelencia. Con su credikiva planea incursionar en la línea de  papelería desechable, piñatería y dulcería potencializando el aumento de su clientela en la temporada de festividades que ya se acerca.
Su meta es adquirir un local propio y adicionarle una distribuidora al por mayor donde ofrecer servicios a domicilio y ver realizados a sus hijos a nivel profesional y especialmente vinculados exitosamente a una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Javier L. is the owner of the “Tienda la Renovación” store, in the Malambo municipality, a metropolitan area of Barranquilla. He lives in Barranquilla with his partner and their two children ages 12 and 14. He started with over 13 years of experience from working as an employee at a food market in downtown Barranquilla. After that, he and his sister started up a store which they ran for a few years, until he decided to become independent and start his own venture, taking advantage of this experience which he now applies to his business. In his store "La Renovación" ["Renewal"], he also sells varied merchandise. He works with his wife, the driving force behind the store, and they are very well-known throughout the municipality. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he was referred by two excellent borrowers of this organization. With this loan obtained from Kiva, he plans to enter into the areas of disposable paper, piñata sales and candy sales. This will promote an increase in his customer base during the holidays, which are fast approaching. His goal is to acquire his own location and include wholesale distribution to offer home services. Another goal is to see his children reach the professional level, and especially to see them successfully linked to a large company.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: breaking into the areas of disposable paper, piñata sales, and candy sales

loans.name: Nadia Cristina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Canuto  del cantón Chone ciudad conocida por ser una zona ganadera y por sus mujeres hermosas, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Santa Rosa.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nadia. Tiene 31 años y es madre soltera de un lindo bebito de dos años que es su fuerza para salir adelante, trabaja de secretaria en la casa parroquial (iglesia).

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y ropa de niños, este negocio lo viene realizando desde que tuvo a su hijo, nos cuenta que al verse sola y sin nadie que viera por su hijo,  le pidió a una amiga que le ayudara a entrar en el negocio y así lo hizo, primero vendía sabanas y después empezó a vender ropa de niños en lo cual le va muy bien ya que día a día tiene mas clientes. Trabaja todos los días en la noche  y los fines de semana en los cuales vende y cobra a la vez. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y a veces en Quito ya que allá se consigue a mejor precio y  mayor variedad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa íntima de damas ya que sus clientes le piden  y con esto espera aumentar su clientela. Es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las  facilidades del crédito.
 
Su sueño es darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
The parish of Canuto in Chone canton is a city known for livestock breeding and its beautiful women. Every 15 days the Santa Rosa Communal Bank meets in this area.

This is Sra. Nadia. She is 31 years old and a single mother of a beautiful two year old son for whom she strives to get ahead. Nadia works as a church secretary.

She earns a living by selling bed sheets and children’s clothing. Nadia started this business after giving birth to her son. Since she is single and does not have anyone to look after her son, Nadia asked a friend who agreed to help her start this business. At first she sold bed sheets and later began selling children’s clothing. She is doing very well because she acquires more customers day after day. Nadia works every evening and on the weekends, making sales and collecting payments. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and occasionally in Quito where she gets the best price and a wide variety.

This new loan will be used to buy women’s undergarments for which she has already received orders and will also help her increase her customer base. This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the loan services. Her dream is to provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: Purchase women’s undergarments

loans.name: Sankale Seki

texts.en:
Sankale is married and has three children.

Sankale was introduced to KADET LTD  by another client of KADET LTD. He is requesting his second loan from KADET, after successfully repaying his first loan. Sankale's primary business has been farming and his secondary business is running a primary school. Both business are doing quite well. He operates both business at the same time and has a good flow of income.The school is located in his residential area and most of his customers are people living within the area.  

With this loan, he plans to buy more textbooks for the school. He wants to grow his businesses. In the future he hopes to acquire and own a secondary school and to expand his farming activity by starting a fish pond.


Sankale believes he is  hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy textbooks for the school.

loans.name: Volcan Masaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo Volcán Masaya lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras provenientes de Masaya, ciudad de las Flores una de ellas es Janette de los Ángeles R. de 33 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos por catalogo (ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, lencería…etc.) desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Ella tiene un hijo el cual está en cuarto año de secundaria y el cual sueña en que tenga una carrera universitaria por lo cual trabaja arduamente. 
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Genaro L. Zamora de 44 años propietario de una pequeña, modesta y humilde farmacia desde hace 8 años y Justo Vidal A. desde hace diez años vende reloj de todo tipo. Ellos invertirán el préstamo en sus negocios especialmente por la época de navidad que es cuando aumentan las ventas.
texts.en:
The Masaya Volcano group is composed of three hard-working people from Masaya, in the city of Flores.  One member is Janette de los Ángeles R., who is 33 years old and has worked selling products from catalogs (clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, lingerie, and other items) for about four years.  She has a son who is in his second year of high school, and who works hard toward his dream of going to college.

The other members of the group are Genaro L. Zamora, who is 44 and has owned a small pharmacy for eight years and Justo Vidal A. who has sold watches for all types for ten years.  They will invest this loan in their businesses, especially during the Christmas season, when their sales increase.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other items

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Judith; tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas, ella cria en su casa los hace crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Urubamba y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere tener un lugar más grande donde pueda criar a los animales.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Judith is 30 years old.  She lives with her partner and her 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises the animals at home.  She raises them and then sells them in the streets of the city of Urubamba.  Through this business she has managed to support her children.  She would like to have a bigger place in which to raise her animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

She is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Josue Omar; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de ejecutivo de ventas, el trabajo desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, el por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

 Josue is 42 years old, is single and has one son.  He is a sales manager and works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 daily.  He gets ahead with his son through his work and wants to continue improving.  He is asking for this loan in order to perform maintenance on his home.

He appreciates those who help him achieve this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SR. Rogelio P. y su esposa Cynthia Lizbeth Fuentes son una pareja joven que esperan a su primer bebe, ellos tienen la ilusion de recibirlo con muchas comodidades, pero ahora es imposible ya que viven en casa de los Padres de Rogelio, quienes los estan apoyando  tanto economicamente, como  moralmente, y desean que Rogelio adquiera responsabilidades como nuevo Papa y empieze a responsabilizarse de obligaciones nuevas que contraera al venir el bebe es por esto que se interesaron en adquirir el credito, y asi poder comprar la Cuna que tanto han deseado ya que estan esforzandose dia a dia, por ser mejores como personas y prometen ser muy responsables con la familia en el Futuro. Asi como en las Responsabilidades adquiridas .
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio Pérez and his wife, Cynthia Lizbeth Fuentes, are a young couple expecting their first baby.  Their hope is to welcome the baby with many comforts.  However, that’s currently impossible because they live in Rogelio’s parents’ house that support them both economically and emotionally.  

They want Rogelio to take on his new responsibilities that will come with fatherhood and to face the new obligations he’ll have with the baby’s arrival. This is why they were interested in his acquiring a loan to buy the crib they want so much since they are making the effort every day to be better people.

They pledge to be very responsible with the family in the future as well as with the acquired obligations.

loans.use: To buy a crib for the baby that's on the way.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 44 years old and married to O.. Together they have seven children. They live in Kangemi, which is a very busy and highly populated trading center. She does embroidery work and sewing. She has been in this business for four years. 

She has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is her fourth loan from KADET. She has paid off her previous loans well and on time. With the current loan, she plans to buy more textile materials and embroidery threads. 

She hopes to give her family a better life and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: She wants to buy clothing materials, sewing and embroidery threads.

loans.name: Melelta Ole

texts.en:
Melelta, 32, has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last six years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Melelta hopes to run his livestock business in a profitable manner.

loans.use: To buy five cows, which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Lolita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport services with her husband as driver) to local community members. She also buys and sells fish such as sardines & milk fish. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sann S. I. was born I. 1963. She is a widow with three children: two are iron welders and the youngest is a fisherman who supports his mother's fishing business. 
Mrs. Sann S. I. is a villager from Preaek Dach village I. Kandal province. She is a grocery seller I. the local village, and I. this way she earns a small income to support her family. Aside from this business, she also earns a living by fishing. I. order to support her fishing business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to start her business

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 34 years old, and she has 5 children between the ages of 2-15 years old. Esperance sells cattle, and she works together with her husband. Esperance is requesting a loan to buy more cattle in order to make more profits. She plans to save her profits.

loans.use: Buying cattle.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, a married woman living in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, has four children, the oldest of whom is 26 years old. Remedios is engaged in both farming and hog-raising business. She mainly manages the fattening of the pigs prior to selling them to the market, while her husband maintains their rice farm. Remedios will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed. She hopes for a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA G.  LABORA COMO RESPONSABLE DE UNIDAD ,ES  SOLTERA ,TIENE  DOS  HIJOS A SU CARGO, ES  EL TERCER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO  QUE  LE HA BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA  COMPRAR MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ARENA,ESTRIBO , MANO DE OBRA,PARA REPARAR  PARTE        DE SU VIVIENDA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN MAL ESTADO..
texts.en: Alba, a responsible worker, is a single mother who cares for her two children. This is her third loan with Ceprodel. She is grateful for the support that Ceprodel has given her and for the expenditures that she has been permitted to make. With this loan, Alba will buy building materials such as cement block, iron, sand, stirrups and labor in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Me llamo Gloria, vivo en la localidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, me dedico a engordar reces y tambien al hogar, no tengo problemas con mis actividades ya que en mi casa tengo el tiempo suficiente para hacer la comida la limpieza y para cuidar mis reces, mi esposo trabaja en una carniceria, y ahi mismo vendemos las reces, despues de que la carne se vende yo voy a cobrar como a los 8 dias es cuando me pagan la res que les vendi, ya tengo siempre cliente para mis reces, este prestamo me va ayudar mucho para poder comprar mas reces y su alimento para que engorden, pienso que voy a tener mas ganancias para mi familia y para comprar mas cosas a la casa, mis metas son que tenga mas rendimiento mi dinero y una mejor calidad de vida para toda mi familia, soy casada y tengo 4 hijos que estudian y yo quiero darles una mejor educación para que les vaya mejor en un futuro, tengo 34 años y 12 años de casada, la casa donde vivimos es casa propia pero aun le faltan varias cosas para que se vea bonita.
texts.en: My name is Gloria and I live in the town of San Francisco Tlachichilpa.  I devote myself to raising cattle and taking care of my home.  I have no problems with my work because I have enough time to do the cleaning and cooking in my house as well as take care of my cattle.  My husband works in a butcher shop and this is where we sell the cattle. Eight days later, after the meat is sold, I collect payment for the cattle that I sold them.  I always have customers for my cattle.  This loan will enable me to buy more cattle and feed to fatten them.  I think that I will have more income for my family and be able to buy more household items.  My goals are to earn more return on my money and to provide a better quality of life for my entire family.  I am married and have 4 children who are students.  I want to give them a better education so they will have a better future.  I am 34 years old and have been married for 12 years.  The house where I live is my own but it still lacks several things to make it look pretty..

loans.use: buy cattle and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores  es una mujer D. 55 años D. edad, cuenta con su casa propia y vive junto con su esposo,no tiene hijos, se encuentra ubicada en una zona rural del caserío D. Pomape que pertence al distrito D. Monsefú se encuentra a unos 20 minutos D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como principal actividad la agricultura , ganadería y artesanía.  

Dolores se dedica  a la venta D. verduras,  en el mercado del distrito D. Monsefú , con una experiencia D. 20 años , es por eso que es muy conocida y tiene su propia clientela.  Lo que le permite a Dolores seguir incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó Dolores a Edpyme Alternativa fue D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mas productos alimenticios no solo verduras sino también frutas  y así mas adelante tener mayores ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su esposo que se desempeña como agricultor.

Dolores  es una mujer con muchos aspiraciones y uno D. ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más granD. su  puesto en el mercado y construir cu casa D. material noble (casa D. ladrillo).
texts.en:
Dolores is a 55 year old lady who lives with her husband in her own home, located in the rural area of the Pomape settlement, part of the Monsefú district, 20 minutes from the Chiclayo Province.  They don’t have any children.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock, and arts.

Dolores sells vegetables in the Monsefú district market, and has been doing so for 20 years.  She is well known and has regular, steady customers.  This allows her to continue growing her income to improve her quality of life.

Dolores will use the money from this loan for 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more food products, not only vegetables, but also fruits.  This way she will have more income in the future and will be able to pay the household expenses and help her husband develop as a farmer.

Dolores is a woman with many aspirations.  Among them is that, through her work and effort, she will be able to have a large stall in the market and also be able to have a brick home built.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Barsbold

texts.en: Mr.Barsbold, 33, lives with his mother and a younger brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His mother is a pensioner and his younger brother is unemployed at the moment. Barsbold is an engineer, and has worked for a construction company in the past. He now rents a restaurant and also runs it. The restaurant is made as a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. It looks like a huge dome and has the capacity to serve 30 people at one time. It attracts customers, especially tourists, in the summer season. He is very enthusiastic about his new business and dreams of building his own restaurant someday. His customers are now increasing due to the forthcoming spring and summer seasons. He is asking a loan for replacing some kitchen appliances and for buying more products to increase his serving capacity.

loans.use: to replace some kitchen appliances for his restaurant and to buy more products to increase his serving capacity.

loans.name: Suubi Savings And Development Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Idd subsists on earnings from a brick sales business that he operates from Mukono. The happily married, principled and down-to-earth father of two says he has been in this business for a decade now. 

Ten years has been a time frame long enough for him to make his deductions on how to survive and weather the unpredictable storms such business come with. He has also learned to be philosophical in the face of financial and other operational adversity that plagues businesses. In many respects, this has been of paramount importance in his business operations as he has learned to strike a balance. 

Many of his clients are truck drivers who are being caught up in the construction boom that is pervading Mukono and its surrounding environs. By all accounts, Idd makes strong and durable bricks. He has built a good rapport with many of his clients. The strong and durable bricks are liked by many of his clients, who in turn prevail upon other people around Mukono to purchase durable and sturdy bricks from him. 

As he casts his mind to the future, Idd knows the prospects for the future success of his business are good. Idd is also formerly employed as a teacher. Teaching is a profession he holds dear to his heart. Monthly, he says his business sales profit amounts to Uganda shillings 380,000, and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase a modern brick-making machine.

loans.use: The purchase of  a new brick-making machine

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a businessman who operates a (bodaboda) motorbike transportation business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years.  Previously, Stephen was employed. He works hard in his business to educate and provide for his seven-year-old child. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management, which has helped him to plan his finances. He hopes to grow his business ten times in five years. He has requested for 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Gabriela Hortencia

texts.es:
Gabriela Hortencia, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas, ella es casada con el señor  Ever y con quien procreo un hijo de nombre Ghiz-Van de quince años de edad.

     Ella se dedica  a la  elaboración de panes, en donde lleva seis años y cuatro  meses y comenta que le va bien y  solcito el préstamo para apoyarse con  la  compra de  ingredientes  con lo que elabora su actividad y son: queso, harina, aceite, huevo, entre otro ya que con ello obtendrá más ingresos en su hogar. 

    Lo que lo inspiro a esta actividad fue su suegra quien también se desde dedica a la misma actividad y con ella comenzó a practicarlo hasta que decido practicarlo sola para ver que tanto se podía independizarse  apoyando a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando para que mejor sea sus ingresos como también con el tiempo poder su propia panadería para trabajar con ellos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gabriela Hortencia lives in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas.  She’s married to Ever and they have a 15-year-old son called Ghiz-Van.

She’s been baking bread for the last six years and four months.  She comments that she does well and asked for the loan to help buy some ingredients she needs to make the bread.  They are: cheese, flour, oil and eggs, among others because this will lead to increased income for the home.

Her mother-in-law was her inspiration for this activity because she’s in the same occupation and she started out working with her until she decided to go at it alone and become independent helping her husband with household income.

What she most wants is that with this small activity and the loan she will be able to continue to work so that her income will improve and, in time, be able to have her own bakery to work with them and get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and lives with eight family members. Four of the family members work.

Haydar opened a bakery in 2010, making all kinds of bread and pastries. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a generator and to make a ceiling and a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and to make a ceiling and sliding door.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edward, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir un almacigo de café que el tiene. El cuenta con un almacigo de café ya establecido y en crecimiento, el quiere realizarle una asistencia para mejorarlo. El con esta mejora lo que pretende es darle una ayuda extra a la planticas para así darle una mejor presentación y buena calidad para poder venderlo fácilmente cuando esté en condiciones de venta. El quiere sacarle las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante como persona y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en él futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edward, 32, is married and lives with his two children and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy supplies for a coffee seedling business he has.  He already has planted seedlings in production and he wants to do some enhancements to improve them.  What he wants to accomplish with this improvement is to give a little help to the plants to improve their appearance and quality so that they will sell easily when they reach proper conditions.  He wants to gain profits needed to continue forward as a person and to provide his family with a better quality of life in the future.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has gotten no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Birajab

texts.ru:
Бирачаб честная и целеустремленная женщина.  Она замужем и  мать 4 детей. Более 12 лет она занимается куплей продажей женских тканей.    Она имеет арендованную торговую точку, где она может торговать. Она занимается одна в этом бизнесе. Она приобретает товар с рынка  города Душанбе, Истаравшан а также с города Дубай.   Бирачаб брала кредит уже 3 раза и погасила успешно. Среди клиентов она имеет хорошую репутацию и кредитную историю. Бирачаб хотела бы получит еще кредит в размере 1600$ США для покупки материалов с целью расширение бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Birajab is an honest and dedicated woman. She is married and the mother of four children. For more than twelve years, she has worked buying and selling women's fabrics. She rents a shop. She works alone in her business. She buys the goods from the market in Dushanbe, as well as from Istaravshan and the city of Dubai. Birajab has taken out three loans and paid them off successfully. As a borrower, she has a good reputation and credit history. Birajab  would like to receive another loan of U.S. $1,600 to purchase materials to expand her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El Señor Ignacio es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es soltero y vive con sus padres. El se dedica a la venta de celulares, discos y otros desde hace 7 años. El comenta que tiene muchas ventas por lo cual le gustaría seguir ampliando su negocio.Se define como un hombre muy trabajador, luchador y por sobre todo emprendedor y responsable. Uno de sus proyectos es tener un local propio donde ofrecer la gama de productos que tiene.
Comenta que tiene metas que le gustaría cumplir, quiere ir avanzando gradualmente en el mundo comercial, ya que sabe que es un mercado muy competitivo. El es cliente recurrente de la Fundación, por lo que ya posee un historial dentro del mismo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de teléfonos celulares, como así también de discos, los cuales son sus principales productos de venta. Agradece a la Fundación, por la nueva oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Señor Ignacio comes from the city of Encarnación; he is single and lives with his parents.

He has been working selling cellphones, CDs, and other items for the last seven years.  He comments that he has good sales, so he would like to continue expanding his business.  He describes himself as a very hard-working man, a fighter, who is above all enterprising and responsible.  One of his goals is to have his own premises where he can offer his full range of products for sale.

He comments that he has objectives he wants to meet; he wants to advance gradually in the business world, as he knows that it is a very competitive market.  He is a repeat client of the Fundación, where he has a good history.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cellphones and also CDs, as these are the main products he sells.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the new opportunity being offered to him.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and CDs.

loans.name: Lorena Isabel

texts.es:
Lorena, vive con su esposo y una hija de 12 años, Lorena administra una tienda en la que ofrece productos comestibles, está ubicado en el centro escolar, lleva 5 años en el negocio, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella necesita comprarse mercadería para el negocio, por eso a través de un préstamo adquirirá sodas, jugos, boquitas, dulces y galletas, con esta compra estará preparada para atender la demanda de los estudiantes.
El propósito de Lorena es que por medio del fortalecimiento del negocio, sus ganancias mejoren para llevar a su hogar todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Lorena lives with her husband and 12-year-old daughter.  Lorena manages a store where she sells snacks; it is located in an education center.  She has spent five years in this business, and works from Monday through Friday, from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.

She needs to buy merchandise for her store, and so as a result of this loan she will buy soda, juice, snacks, sweets, and cookies.  With this purchase she will be prepared to meet the demand of the students.

Lorena's plan is that by strengthening her business, her earnings will increase to provide her household with everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, snacks, sweets and cookies for her store.

loans.name: Lidia Mariana

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 45 años nacida en Latacunga en la provincia de Chimborazo. En la cordillera de "Los Andes" en la región central del Ecuador se encuentra Latacunga, la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi la cual se encuentra a 2850 metros a nivel del mar. Tiene un clima promedio de 12 grados centígrados. Este cantón es muy conocido por su colorida fiesta de "La mama negra"  que se celebra por su independencia. 
Lidia aprendió de sus padres a cuidar ganado vacuno y vender su leche y hace 10 años ella se dedica independientemente a esta actividad. A pesar de ser madre soltera ella nos cuenta que ha sabido salir adelante con su hijo y darle todo lo necesario. Ella quiere un crédito para poder comprar más ganado, de esta manera sacar más litros de leche para venderla y así tener mejores ingresos.
Es el primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa pero nos cuenta que anteriormente las instituciones financieras le ayudaron muchísimo a tener su propio ganado ya que los costos son elevados y es difícil empezar.
texts.en:
Lidia is 45 years old and was born in Latacunga, in the province of Chimborazo. In the Andes Mountains in the central region of Ecuador is Latacunga, the capital of Cotopaxi province, which is located at 2850 meters above sea level. The climate averages 12 degrees Celsius. This county is very well known for its colorful festival called the Fiesta of the Mama Negra that is a celebration of independence.

Lidia learned from her parents to care for cattle and to sell the milk and for 10 years she has worked on her own in this activity. Despite being a single mother, she tells us that she has known how to care for her child, giving all that is necessary. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more cattle, and in this way to get more liters of milk to sell and thus have higher earnings.  

This is her first loan with Fundación Alternativa but she tells us that financial institutions have been a big help before in purchasing her own cattle as the costs are high and it is difficult to start.

loans.use: to buy cows and thus increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi buys bags of salt and retails them in smaller quantities at Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. The salt business is about 5 years old. With the income she generates she is able to assist her husband to educate her children.

Esi will be using the loan to purchase more bags of salt to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to add the sale of food items.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of salt to resell

loans.name: Vueon

texts.en:
Vueon is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She is a pig feeder earning $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who also earns $5 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food and $20 on other expenses. 

Vueon is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy pigs and feed. She wants to increase her pig supply with the loan because she can earn a good income for her family selling pigs and use her knowledge in this area to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen was born in 1979. She lives in Phu Man village with her husband and two children. She grows rice and she buys and sells packaging. She has a monthly income of about 9,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to expand her business by buying more packaging.

loans.use: to buy more packaging to sell

loans.name: Abiyemeje /shyr Group

texts.fr:
Vedaste fait partie du groupe Abiyemeje /SHYR. Il a 41 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 6 mois à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4  ans de primaire.

Vedaste est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des haricots, des sorghos et d’autres articles pour les revendre. 

Dans les prochaines années, Vedaste voudrait être le grossiste. Avec les profits, Vedaste prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Vedaste is a member of the Abiyemeje/SHYR group.  He is 41 years old, married, and has two children, aged six months and eight years.  The older one attends school.  He (Vedaste) has had four years of primary education.

Vedaste is a merchant.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his credit to buy beans, sorghum, and other items to sell.

In the years to come, Vedaste would like to be a wholesaler.  With his profits, Vedaste foresees being able to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy beans, sorghum, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Zikrullojon

texts.ru: Зикруллочон занимается шитьем чехлов для мебели и салона автомобиля. В этой области он пять лет. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он просит кредит для покупки тканей и новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Zikrullojon does sewing of slipcovers for furniture and automobile seats. He has been in this business for five years. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. He is asking for a loan to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 23 years old and married, with three young children. The oldest child is only six years old.  Darlyn's husband is a fisherman.

Darlyn and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol.  They also sell crabs to community residents.  Darlyn says they earn 6000 PHP per month.

Darlyn has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.  She hopes that their business will grow. She wants to provide a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.

loans.name: Nha

texts.en:
Nha is a 36-year-old married woman. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living by washing and selling old vehicles.

Nha has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop and selling beverages to people in her community. She has been in business for six years.

She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and other materials.

loans.name: Khabibilla

texts.ru: Хабибилле 49 лет, живет со своей семьей в селе Кокташ, что на юге Кыргызстана.  Хабибилла  - счастливый отец трех дочерей и 8-летнего сына.  Хабибилла работает лаборантом в местной школе, но  к сожалению зарплата не позволяет покрыть расходы семьи, поэтому в начале 2000 года Хабибилла решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Хабибиллы, начатое с суммы в 3,500 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Торговлю он осуществляет на воскресных скотных рынках. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Хабибилла обратился в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Хабибилла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность оплатить учебу для своих детей.
texts.en: Khabibilla is 49 years old and lives with his family in the Kok-Tash village in southern Kyrgyzstan.  He is a happy father of three daughters and an 8 year-old son.  Khabibilla works as a lab technician at a local school, but, unfortunately, his salary does not allow him to cover family's expenses.  This is why he decided to start his own animal husbandry business at the beginning of the year in 2000.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, Khabibilla's business, started with a sum of 3,500 som (KGS), yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month today from sales of dairy and meat products.  He sells his products on weekend livestock markets.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Khabibilla requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into a further increase of domestic livestock quantities in order to have an opportunity to pay for his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married to Mark and they have three children. She has been in the business of selling curtain nets and clothing materials for the last six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 30,000. She plans to use the funds to buy more stock of curtain nets and clothing materials. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a large clothing store and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy curtain nets and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Yatchegbo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YATCHEGBO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Chantal (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Chantal est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Bland. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Chantal vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Chantal vend des mèches et divers produits cosmétiques depuis dix ans. Chantal s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Chantal ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et divers produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past 12 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food.the photo shows how she was preparing to peal the fresh bananas for cooking in front of the restaurant 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh and dry food for the restaurant for sale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and improve the well-being of her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more fresh and dry foods for the restaurant for sale

loans.name: Kotognokontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  KOTOGNOKONTALA 1sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NAGALA un des villages de Dogo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de   ANHE, 1ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  NAGALA après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married and has four children.

Wilma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to add electronics – battery charging machines, sockets, plugs adapters, heaters to her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is the mother of three and loves taking care of her family, but doing so can be hard in Moldova. In order to provide better financial support for them, she quit working in local public administration and began her own small business. Despite difficulties in getting started Maria, persisted and for over four years now she has been the proud owner of a small clothing store at the market in Cahul. Anyone who knows her will say that by nature she is a hardworking and honest person, and that trust is part of what has helped her get loyal customers. She now has an income that, while modest, allows her to better meet the needs of her family. Maria would like a loan to fund the purchase of new goods in order to diversify her product offerings and thereby begin growing her business.

loans.use: Purchase of new products

loans.name: Sognaméto

texts.fr:
MrsAGBODAN Sognameno was born in 1968 at Aklalou, is married and has five chidren. After primary school, she was trained as a hairdresser and beautician. She opened a beauty salon that she manages strictly and efficiently. A gifted and experienced woman, she provides a quality service to her community and the clients are so pleased with her work that she has been nicknamed "beauty mama". Her husband, a dressmaker, is only able to bring a little help to the household. As she wishes to make her salon more modern and attractive, Mrs AGEBOGAN requests a $1000 loan to buy hair dryers and other tools to improve her customer satisfaction. In this way, she will be able to improve her family's living condition.

Translated fromFrench by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1968, Madame A. Sognaméto est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Après ses études primaires, elle se lança dans la formation en esthétique et coiffure. Elle ouvre un salon de coiffure qu’elle gère avec rigueur et efficacité. Femme expérimentée et douée, elle offre un service de qualité aux habitants de sa localité et le niveau de satisfaction de sa clientèle lui a valu le surnom de « Maman Beauté ». Son mari couturier de profession contribue très peu aux charges du ménage. Voulant rendre son salon plus moderne et plus attrayant, Madame A. sollicite crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter des séchoirs, et autres matériels de travail afin d’augmenter la satisfaction de sa clientèle. Par là, elle pourra arriver à une amélioration parfaite du niveau de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Buying hair dyers and other work implements

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Delphine K. is a married woman with five (5) children. Her husband practices subsistence agriculture which barely suffices to feed the family. The household is confronted daily with all sorts of difficulties, especially hunger and illness. To contribute to the household needs, Mrs. Delphine K. has started a small business selling food products. Currently, she has acquired much experience, which allows her to define and run her business. Thanks to her heightened management sense, she has repaid all the loans she obtained.

She is asking for a loan of $1200 to increase her storage capacity in order to sell products in times of scarcity. This loan will serve as a foundation to buy, stock, and re-sell food products. The realization of this project will be very beneficial to her, especially in terms of savings. She will also succeed in better meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Delphine est une femme mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari pratique une agriculture de subsistance qui suffit à peine pour l’alimentation de la famille. Du coup, le ménage est confronté quotidiennement aux difficultés de tout genre notamment la faim et la maladie. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, Madame K. Delphine a entrepris le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien cerner les rouages de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle avait obtenus.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. Ce crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. La réalisation de ce projet lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’épargne. Aussi réussira-t-elle à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S. L., age 23, runs a small lottery business in her community near Siem Reap, earning about $2.50 per day. She would like to borrow $600 to purchase a motorbike so that her husband can operate a moto-taxi business to earn $2 per day. They have no children, but plan to save money for their children's education in the future. Her husband, also age 23, is pictured here next to the motorbike they would like to buy.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to operate a business

loans.name: Juan J.

texts.es:
Client history: Juan Jose works as a taxi driver for the sindicato avora [avora syndicate] where he works the route Tembladerani to Achachicala. His home is located in the zone of alto san pedro in the city of La Paz. It is the third time that he requests a loan; his previous loan history qualifies him as a No. 1 client, which means he is a client with outstanding repayment history. The amount requested will be used for the full maintenance of his vehicle and to buy a new car engine. His work coupled with his experience as a driver allows him to repay the credit; additionally, he has been working with the syndicate for 10 years.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Juan Jose trabaja como chofer en el sindicato avaroa - trufi #5 con los tramos de Tembladerani hasta Achachicala (esa es su ruta). Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo y la compra de motor. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer además que el sindicato al que pertenece esta fortalecido pues trabaja más de 10 años.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to buy a new car engine

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema joined the SPBD Programme in 2004 and she is the chief of the centre mentioned above. Most of her family moved to New Zealand, except her, her husband and their four kids. Without relying on remittances from overseas she applied for a second loan to buy chemicals, fertilizers, and other items for her taro plantation not far from her house. To enlarge her taro farm, she is now applying for another loan to support her plantation and to fix the floor of her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Shovgi

texts.ru:
Shovgi A. was born in 1971 in the city and currently lives in the Agsunisky region. He is married. Five years ago he started his own business. He has been working hard and actively moving forward. Now he needs the loan to help expand his business and this year he decided to turn to Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Шовги 1971 года рождения. Родился и проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Семейный. Пять лет тому назад начинал этот бизнес. Благодаря своему усилие активно двигался вперед. Нужны были средство чтобы расширятся. По этому в этом году он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Before opening up her convenience store business, Rita sold fish. Because of health problems she had to leave that work. For a period of time she was jobless, although she never stopped thinking about how she could continue to help out economically to raise her five young children.

About three years ago, she got the idea of putting a small store in her own home, and she did this. Starting off little by little, today she manages a convenience store. Rita has always dreamed of progressing, and that is why she plans to set up an area in the entrance of her home to sell food during the day. With the help of her husband and her children, she has enough support and confidence in her plan to make it happen.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Antes de abrir el negocio de su bodega, Rita trabajaba vendiendo pescados. No fue sino por problemas de salud que se vio obligada a dejarlo. Por un periodo estuvo sin trabajo, aunque nunca dejo de pensar cómo podría seguir ayudando económicamente en la crianza de sus cinco menores hijos.

Hace alrededor de tres años, se le ocurrió la idea de poner una pequeña tienda en su propia casa. Y así lo hizo. Empezando de a pocos, hoy maneja su bodega. En Rita siempre habito el sueño de mejorar y progresar, por esto planea ambientar el hall en la entrada de su casa para vender comida durante el día. Con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos ella tiene suficiente apoyo y confianza de que su plan se concretará.

loans.use: Set up an area in her home for selling food.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
K. Nafisa is 33 years old. She is married with four daughters. Nafisa has been baking the national bread called “lepeshka” for 11 years already. Nafisa's husband is also involved in the business. As a rule Nafisa, purchases all materials required for baking the “lepeshka,” like flour, coal, butter, and oil in the local market. Nafisa’s “lepeshka” are widely known in her neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan of $1000.00 for the term of 12 months. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Nafisa promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone supporting her today.

loans.use: To purchase materials like flour and coal, required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Yakoubou

texts.fr:
Yakoubou F. is 28 years old, married and the father of one. He lives and works in Adéta, Togo, a town located about 150 kilometers from the capital. To earn a living, Yakoubou purchases used motorcycles to repair and sell. The majority of people in this area do not own a car, and so, many people use motorcycles to get around because they are less expensive and easier to maintain. Motorcycle maintenance is a profitable enterprise because it is a service that is always in demand. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, Yakoubou would like to purchase another motorcycle to repair and sell. With the profit he will see, Mr. F. would like to improve the standard of living of his wife and child.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Yakoubou F. est âgé de 28 ans marié et pére d’un enfant. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, Togo, une ville située à environ 150 kilomitres de la capitale. Pour gagner de l’argent, Yakoubou achète les motos usées pour les réparer et les revendre. La majorité des personnes ici ne possède pas de voiture, donc beaucoup de gens utilisent les motos pour déménager parce qu’ils sont moins chers et plus faciles à maintenir. La maintenance des motos est une entreprise bien profitable parce que le service est toujours demandé. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Yakoubou désire acheter une autre moto pour réparer et revendre. Par les profits qu’il va gagner, Monsieur F. va améliorer la qualité la vie de sa femme et de son enfant.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle to repair and sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has five married children. None of her children help her in her business; rather, she has an assistant who performs this job. She began twenty years ago, when her ex-husband left her and she needed to support her children. She bought used clothing which she then resold to her friends and family members. Gradually, her sales have increased.

Now, Maria is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 4 months, so she can purchase a new awning since the framework of the one she has broke. With your help, Maria will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos casados, ninguno de sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio ella tiene un ayudante para esto. Ella comenzó hace 20 años, cuando su ex esposo los abandono y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que compro ropa seminueva y empezó a ofrecerla entre sus familiares y amigos poco a poco ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar un toldo nuevo, ya que el que tiene se rompió el armazón. con tu apoyo ella seguira proserando.

loans.use: Purchase a new awning.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen baji is a wife of M. Y.. She has been married for 20 years. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Noreen baji has no children. Her husband is a land owner. He wants a tractor for loading so he can make a profit. Therefore, Noreen baji is applying for a loan for her husband.

She has been joined in her loan by a few group members. Abida baji who wants loan to buy an ice-Cream maker. Shekeela baji wants a loan for her welding business. Fozia baji wants a loan for her garment business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

NOTE: 'Baji' (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

>

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Ghana, Ama G. was never able to attend school because her family was too poor to send her. She now lives in Lonvo with her husband and she practices a profession she truly enjoys: the preparation of palm oil. She cares for two of her sisters' children. Very much an entrepreneur, and having mastered her enterprise, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase more palm nuts so that she may increase her palm oil production. With this loan, she is hoping to increase her profits and to better her family's living conditions from now on.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1969 au Ghana, Madame G. Ama n’a pas évolué dans le domaine scolaire par manque de support. Installé à Lonvo avec son mari depuis longtemps, elle a embrassé avec amour la préparation de l’huile de palme. Elle a en charge deux (2) enfants de ses sœurs. Très entreprenante, et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter de noix de palme afin d’augmenter la quantité de sa production. Par ce crédit, elle pense accroître ses revenus et contribuer davantage dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 31 years old, married, and has four children ages 2, 6, 8 and 12. In addition, she also cares for another 18 year old child. She owns her own charcoal and firewood business. Every day, she works from 6AM to 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $35 from her sales.

In the past, Pili has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Pili is now requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 50, and her husband have been growing rice and yams since 2004, earning about $15 per day in revenue. They live with six children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. While weather conditions last year were bad, this year has seen a marked improvement, with stable rainfall, so Neang is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, its local partner, to purchase fertilizer and hire farm workers to grow yams.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire farm workers to grow yams.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Jeune dynamique et très entreprenant, Monsieur H. Kodjo s’est lancé très tôt dans une profession qui attire de plus en plus les jeunes sans emploi c’est à dire la conduite de taxi moto reconnu comme le moyen  le plus rapide et disponible à tout bout de champs pour nos déplacements.

Mais pour une meilleure prestation de service, il faut un engin solide et en bon état. Ceci dit, il sollicite un appui financier pour s’acquérir une moto à l’état neuf pour une meilleure prestation de service.

La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’autosuffisance financière.
texts.en:
Young, energetic, and very enterprising, Mr. Kodjo H. started off very early on working in a profession that attracts more and more unemployed young people; that is to say, driving a motorbike taxi, which is acknowledged as the fastest and most available means of travel to anywhere within range. But to provide better service performance, a dependable engine in good condition is needed. That said, he is requesting financial support to acquire a new motorbike. Realizing this dream will be highly beneficial to him, notably with regards to being financially self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine S. est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse de riz au bord de la route à  Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles et autres condiments nécessaires pour la restauration du riz. Christine espère améliorer les conditions de sa vie avec cette opportunité.
texts.en:
Christine S., 27, is married and the mother of one child. She sells cooked rice along the road in Wome, a village northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants to use this loan to buy sacks of rice, jerry-cans of oil, and the condiments necessary for preparing cooked rice for sale. Christine hopes to improve her living conditions thanks to this opportunity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of rice, jerry-cans of oil, etc. to make cooked rice for sale

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es: Feliza, de 35 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo con el cual vive desde hace más de 10 años. Se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y frutas diversas por temporada, esta actividad la acompaña también por más de 10 años, y la desarrolla junto a su pareja. Lo que más le agrada es que puede trabajar y cuidar a sus hijos al mismo tiempo, ya que éstos, después de clases, la ayudan en sus terrenos de cultivo. Además, esta actividad le da la posibilidad de tener ingresos económicos altos por temporadas, como por ejemplo, el cultivo de café, aunque es lo más difícil de cultivar por los diversos procesos que necesita. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Feliza tiene proyectado invertir lo solicitado en la compra de plantas de café y de plátano.
texts.en:
Feliza, 35, is married, has four children. She has lived with her husband for more than ten years. She cultivates plantains and a diversity of other fruits seasonally. This activity has also accompanied her for more than ten years, and the development together of her relationship. What pleases her most is that she can work, and at once take care of her children, who already help her in cultivating her fields, after classes. Furthermore, activities such as the cultivation of coffee, although it is more difficult to cultivate because of the diverse processes that it requires, allow her to have high seasonal incomes. This is her first loan with MFP. Feliza projects to invest the loan she is asking for to buy coffee plants and plantain trees.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantain trees and coffee plants.

loans.name: Hanifan M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 43 year old married lady who lives in Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. R., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Hanifan baji has five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her elder son works with his father. The next to him is a welder. The other kids attend school near their house. Hanifan baji spends her time knitting clothes for her neighbors. She is saving her income and plans to renovate the house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store. 

She is a group leader of some more women. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy products (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 53 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells kerosene in wholesale and retail, a business she has been doing for a long time.

Mary needs the loan of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en:
Alaga A. is a 50-year-old man who sells spare parts for Russian and foreign cars. He is married and has four children.

Alaga started his business more than 12 years ago when he lost his job. Alaga is a very polite and friendly man, that’s why his shop is always full of people. Alaga applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase more spare parts for his store.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts for his store

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan to three people, all of whom are residents of Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., aged 43, currently earns a living selling sweet cake in the village, and earning an average of $2.50 per day. To earn additional income, S. is asking for a loan to begin raising pigs. 

Another family's income source is the job of the husband, Channom, who works as a motorcycle taxi driver and earns approximately $4 each day. The couple has been married for years and has given birth to three children who are students in the primary school.
