The other borrowers are S. and P.. S., is a widow who raises poultry from home to earn a living. She needs a loan to buy more poultry to raise. P. is a widowed mother who sells breakfast foods. She is applying for a loan to purchase the necessary ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To begin raising pigs

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 32 years old.  She is married with two children; sons.  Both are in school, junior high school and primary school.  Her husband is a farmer, while she is a food vendor.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

She cooks and sells rice and stew.  Vida cooks the food in her house and sells in front of her house in the mornings. Vida buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community.  She has been in this business for eight years. 

Vida wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
This is a picture of Hawa W., Edna K., Petam C., Alice Y. and Oredola C.. They named their group Hold Tight. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of $165. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses. 

Hawa W. (left) is the leader of this group. Hawa is forty-six years old. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is married to a village headman, and they have three children, who are all still in school. Hawa is a pig farmer, and she will use this loan to buy two additional pigs. Hawa has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: Buy two pigs

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr: Gnima D. est une veuve domiciliée à Kadior, elle vend au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés de Ziguinchor. Avec l'appui de l'IMCEC, elle a acheté un terrain et a entamé la construction pour éviter la location à vie à ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des zincs et déménager chez elle avant le début de la saison des pluies.
texts.en:
Gnima D. is a widow who lives in Kadior. She sells merchandise at the central market Saint Maures des Fossés of Ziguinchor. With IMCEC support, she bought a plot of land and began construction, so that she can forever save her children from paying rent. She’s requesting this loan to buy tin roofing material and to move out of her place before the seasonal rains begin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of housing

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.
Roxana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, además los días domingos y lunes viaja  a las ferias de la región. Roxana esta estudiando la carrera de Obstetriz.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de jeans.
Los sueños de Roxana son construir su casa, ejercer su profesión y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the community bank, Unión II. Roxana is 28 years old, has 2 children, and lives with their father. Roxana has a stand in the market, 12 de abril, where she sells a variety of clothing. In addition, on Sundays and Mondays, she travels to the region's fairs. Roxana is studying the career of midwifery. Roxana needs a loan of 900 PEN, which will be invested in buying jeans. Roxana's dreams are to build a home, practice her profession, and to bring up her children.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: D. Lucienne est née vers 1969 dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Lucienne est mariée à GAOUNGA Lucien, chauffeur de profession. Lucienne est mère de six (6) enfants. L'aîné est âgé de 24 ans et le benjamin de 10 ans. Ces enfants sont encore à la charge de Lucienne et de Lucien. Lucienne et sa famille vivent à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Lucienne est dans la restauration. En effet, Lucienne vend du riz, de haricot, de pâte de maïs, de manioc et de causette d'igname. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Lucienne fait ses provisions de restauration. Lucienne a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé et a bien remboursé ces crédits. Actuellement, Lucienne sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Lucienne was born around 1969 in Ouémé County. She is married to GAOUNGA Lucien, a driver by profession. She is the mother of six children. The eldest is 24, and the youngest is 10. These children are still in their care. Lucienne and her family live in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is in the restaurant business. Basically, she sells rice, beans, and mashes made of cornmeal, cassava, or yam chips. Her supplies are gotten from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Lucienne has already benefited from three Alidé loans and has repaid them. Currently, she’s requesting a fourth loan from Alidé to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d'un sac de maïs de 50Kg, de deux sacs de riz de 50Kg, de 25 Kg de haricot, de 25 litres d'huile d'arachide et de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Micerina

texts.es: Micerina es una mujer de  50 años, se caracteriza por su gran sentido del humor y la alegría que siempre mantiene, lo cual es gracias a su familia quienes son el motor de su trabajo. La preparación de diversos platillos y bocaditos se ha convertido en la mejor actividad económica que realiza, ya que los pedidos que tiene son continuos, lo cual refleja la habilidad que tiene para la cocina. Esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años en su casa, donde prepara los diversos pedidos para llevarlos a los eventos sociales donde la contratan, los cuales durante las fechas festivas son mayores, tratando de aprovecharlos aunque le tome noches sin dormir, pues sus ganancias son muy buenas. Para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes participa en diversos talleres de preparación de alimentos y siempre aprende nuevas formas de sazón y presentación de los platos. De esta manera, Micerina trata de aprender cada día más, pues su deseo es ampliar sus redes sociales para incrementar sus pedidos y darse a conocer dentro de su distrito. Asimismo, desea instalar una tienda en su casa donde pueda tener un negocio adicional que la ayude a mantener sus ingresos estables. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 24 créditos a través de su banco comunal, el cual formó hace más de 10 años junto a un grupo de amigas con quienes viene trabajando armoniosamente. Con los 3200 soles que solicita comprará los comestibles e ingredientes que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas y la instalación de su tienda.
texts.en:
Micerina is a 50-year-old woman known for her great sense of humor and for her upbeat personality, which are both thanks to her family who is the motivation for her work. The preparation of different dishes and sandwiches has become her largest source of income since the orders that she has are continuous, which reflects her skill in the kitchen. She has been doing this for 6 years from her home, where she prepares the different orders to take them to the social events where she has been hired and which occur more often during the holidays. She tries to take advantage of them even if she goes without sleep some nights since her earnings are very high. In order to attract more attention from clients, she participates in different food preparation workshops and always learns new ways to season and present the dishes. In this way, Micerina tries to learn a little more each day, since her wish is to expand her social networks in order to increase her orders and make herself known throughout her district. Likewise, she wants to set up a store in her home where she can have an additional business that will help her maintain a stable income. With PRISMA Microloans, she already has 24 loans through her communal bank, which she formed more than 10 years ago with a group of friends with whom she continues to work well. With the 3200 soles that she is requesting, she will buy groceries and ingredients that she needs to prepare foods and to set up her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for food preparation and for setting up her shop

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Неъмат – мужчина 47 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детишек. Неъмат как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Паллос. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего такси.
texts.en:
Nemat is a 47-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of their small children. As head of the household, Nemat works and earns money. He drives a shuttle bus on the Khujand-Pallos route. He works according to this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings on his workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his vehicle on his day off. Nemat wanted to use this loan to repair his taxi.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Ke, 41, and her husband, Mr. Touch Soeur, 38, were married in 1996 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom are in primary school. The family lives along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Y. was hired by the villagers to spin thread for income. Her husband has been a baker for 20 years. He works at a bakery shop located in Phnom Penh. She is applying for her first loan of $600 to purchase two more spinning devices for her thread-spinning business.

loans.use: To purchase two more spinning devices for her thread-spinning business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a 50-year-old married woman with three children ranging in ages from school-age to young adult. The M. family lives in Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Nenita tells us that although she has been running her carinderia (luncheonette) for the past ten years, it was not until she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago that she was able to expand and improve her business, making the carinderia lucrative enough to support her family and to pay for the tuition fees of her children.

Now on her fourteenth loan cycle, Nenita is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can offer a wider variety of food to her customers and earn enough to support her family and to continue to be able to pay tuition fees.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To be able to offer a wider variety of food at her luncheonette business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año y medio tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, donde ofrece los productos básicos comestibles y debido a la buena ubicación de su establecimiento sus ventas se mantienen estables. Adicionalmente, por la mañana, Karina es profesora de una escuela de su localidad, por lo que contrata a una persona para que atienda su tienda, pero por la tarde ella se  encarga personalmente. A pesar de las dificultades de su tiempo limitado con su profesión y la atención de sus hijos, ella continúa con su trabajo porque desea mejorar la situación económica de su familia, pues sus intenciones son de implementar su negocio con otros productos no comestibles requeridos por sus vecinos; como útiles de escritorio, diversos adornos, etc. 
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que menciona que ser parte de un banco comunal le ha permitido crecer como persona conociendo del trabajo en grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería en bebidas gaseosas y abarrotes por sacos.
texts.en:
Katrina, 32, lives with her husband and their two children in a rented house. She has had a grocery store in her house for one and a half years. She sells basic food products. Due to the good location of her establishment, her sales remain stable. Also, in the mornings Katrina works as a teacher at a school in her town. Therefore, she hires someone to work at the store, but in the afternoons she personally runs the store. In spite of the difficulties of her limited time in her profession and taking care of her children, she continues with her work because she wants to improve the family’s economic situation. Her intentions are to set up her store with other non-food products like desk supplies and different decorations, etc. that her neighbors need. This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan with MFP. Being part of a community bank has allowed her to grow as a person knowing how to work in a group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy merchandise like soft drinks and sacks of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Innocent's Group

texts.en: T. Innocent is 30 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a married man with 4 children all in primary and secondary schools as he also takes care of 4 dependants. Innocent has a hard ware shop in Engabisya trading center that has been running for over 10 years and he is able to make 400,000/= as monthly profits. He is a friendly and hard working man with a strong drive to succeed. He needs a loan to help restock his hard ware shop with more products like cement, iron sheets and bars in order to avoid a shortage. He is such a grateful man for the loans disbursed to him and his group members.

loans.use: Buying more hard ware equipment for increased stock.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Juan está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que comercializan las frutas y verduras. Ellas son originarias de la zona rural Quebrada Honda, esta carece de muchos recursos necesarios para la vida como lo es el agua potable.

Aracely de los Ángeles A. hace tres años con ayuda de su suegra puso un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Oriental y su mayor su ello es tener su propio tramo. Antonia

loans.use: para comprar frutas y verduras como ayote, yuca, chilote, chayote etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 41 years old, and is married with one child who has just completed senior high and is awaiting his results to enter tertiary education. She is a hardworking woman who trades in Ghanaian-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both men and women. Abena takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She purchases shoes in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She rents a stand in the market where she sells her footwear.

Abena has no regrets about the business because it has given her lots of experience in marketing and sales. She is requesting a loan to buy stock in bulk, and would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy Ghanaian footwear for retail

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She works very hard to support her business and her children in school. She trades in flip-flops and Ghana-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both sexes. She takes delivery of stock from Accra. She purchases them in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She mostly sells them through hawking (house to house selling), and sometimes in the community market. She has no regrets regarding her business choice because it has given her lots of marketing and sales experience. In spite of keen competition in the market she manages to make plenty of sales every day. She is requesting Kiva loan assistance to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for the support of Kiva lenders as the festive Christmas season approaches.

loans.use: To buy flip-flop and Ghana-made slippers in bulk from Accra.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 52 years old. She is married and has seven children. Currently only two of her children are in school. The rest have completed school and are working. She is a petty trader who trades in foodstuffs such as tomatoes, egg plants, yam, pepper, plantain, dry fish, etc. Through this business, she has been able to provide for her family. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make a bigger income to send her last two children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY BEANS, SUGAR, RICE, BREAD, SOFT DRINKS, COOKIES, INSTANT SOUPS, PASTA, SALSA, TOILET PAPER, SANITARY NAPKINS, SOAP, SPICES, EGGS, MILK, ETC.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen C. is from the village of Lower Irasan. She is 47 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Aileen owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Aileen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Arouna Sékinatou

texts.fr: Cette dame habite  dans le quartier d’agoè zélikpato avec son époux et ses 06 enfants. Son mari est un mécanicien et son revenu ne leur permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, pour l’aider elle s’est engagée dans le commerce de bois de chauffage depuis 1996, elle y a associé plus tard la vente de maïs. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de 02 tas de bois de chauffage et 08 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This mother of six children and her husband live in the Zelikpato neighborhood of Agoe. Her husband is a mechanic and his earnings do not completely cover all the family expenses. To help, Arouna Sékinatou started selling firewood in 1996 and then later went into the business of selling corn. Facing a shortage of supplies, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 2 loads of firewood and 8 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of firewood and corn

loans.name: Makhsura

texts.en:
Y. Makhsura is 35 years old. She is married and has a son. Makhsura's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason that Makhsura decided to start her own business eight years ago, selling fabric for national dresses. Little by little, she has made her business grow and by offering installment payments to her clients, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business. She is asking for a loan of $1,100 USD. With this money, Makhsura will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El señor Luis Enrique Jiménez es casado con la señora Norma y son una familia muy estable pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, el tiene un negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes y Carnicería Jiménez” establecido desde hace 6 años.Son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución, ya que anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para la ampliación del local de su negocio, proyecto realizado con éxito y nuevamente están tramitando para colocar la losa de concreto del techo de un cuarto en construccion nuevo proyecto que están terminando.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique Jiménez is married to Norma; they are a stable and very hard-working family. He has had his own grocery store, called “Abarrotes y Carnicería Jiménez,” for 6 years. They are distinguished clients of our institution in that they were granted a previous loan to enlarge their place of business; the project was successful. Now, they are requesting additional funding to install concrete roof tiles on a room that is under construction; a new project they are about to complete.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install concrete roof tiles.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sonia,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene  32 años  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13, 11 años, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende gaseosas, agua mineral, papas, fritas, canchitas, dulces, y todo tipo de snack en un pequeño puesto en camino inka; Nuestra socia también vende algunos trabajos de artesanía desde el año 202 en el mismo camino del inka, Nuestra socia nos manifiesta que debido a las lluvias y al actual problema de inaccesibilidad de la zona a Machupicchu y a muchas otras provincias de Cusco, por las inundaciones ella se ve afectadísima y no sabe cuando arreglarán las autoridades el acceso a diferentes centros arqueológicos; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos porque en el mes de marzo muchos colegios abrirán sus puertas para un nuevo año escolar.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Sonia is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 15, 13, and 11). She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Sonia sells soft drinks, mineral water, French fries, chips, candy, and all types of snacks from a small vending post along one of the Incan roads. She also has been selling handicrafts since 2002 from the same location. Sonia says the recent heavy rains have resulted in floods, thereby making the area of Machupicchu and several other provinces around Cusco inaccessible. The authorities do not know when people will be able to access the various archaeological sites.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for her children because March is the month when many schools open their doors for the new school year. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to completing her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: Penina Zelia

texts.pt:
Penina Zélia T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade casada com 2 filhos de 10 anos e outro de 6 meses de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas ainda tenciona continuar com os seus estudos. Vive numa casa de aluguer com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seus filhos.
Nunca saiu da província de Maputo, apenas já esteve a residir num bairro arredores da cidade de Maputo e voltou para Matola. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e o seu rendimento varia de acordo com o movimento dos seus clientes, variando entre 2.000.00mt a 3.500.00mt por mês. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a hluvuku através de amigas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, sumos e outros) para aumentar e diversificar o seu produto.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Penina Zélia T. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province. She is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 10 years and 6 months. The elder child goes to school. Penina finished tenth grade. She did not continue with school because of a lack of money, but she still plans to continue her studies. She lives in a rented house with her family and does not support anyone other than her children. Penina has never left Maputo Province. She has moved only to a neighborhood outside the city of Maputo and then returned to Matola. She has had her own business for more than two years. She has no employees, and her income changes with the movements of her customers, varying from 2,000 to 3,500 meticais per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. Penina has never had a loan with another bank. She learned about Hluvuku through friends. This is her first loan, and she is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (beer, soft drinks, juices and other products) to increase and diversify her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan promptly so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to apply to the growth of her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (beer, soft drinks, juices and other products)

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 39 years old and married without children. Elie’s wife does not work. Elie owns a business selling green potatoes in the market of Nyagahunga center. Elie has been in the business for three years. This business is profitable for him so he can get all their basic needs. His business is well organized and well known in his region, which is a stimulus for him.


Elie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to grow his business by adding large quantities of green potatoes for sale. This increase in quantities will help him attract more customers, which is the way to obtain more profit. With this loan, Elie expects to reinvest the profits in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more green potatoes for sale

loans.name: Arasely Patricia

texts.es: Arasely Patricia posee un negocio de elaboración de tejas y ladrillo ubicado en las afuera de la ciudad. Desde hace tres años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ha sido otorgado de generación en generación y ha puesto de mucho empeño por seguir adelante. Es madre soltera y con su arduo esfuerzo a mantenido a su hijo, realiza sus compras de materiales para el negocio. Pero el crédito lo maneja de manera selectiva ya que algunos clientes no le pagaron ocasionándole pérdidas al negocio, pero a pesar de esto ella utilizara el financiamiento para capital de trabajo necesario. Su deseo es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Arasely Patricia has a business making roof tiles and bricks on the outskirts of the city. She's been in this business for three years; it's been passed down through the generations of her family and she's put a lot of effort into it in order to get ahead. She's a single mother who's worked hard to take care of her son and buy materials for her business. She's selective about offering her services on credit, since some clients haven't paid her and forced the business to take some losses. Nevertheless, she'd like to expand her business and will use this loan for necessary working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 53 años, casada con Julián y juntos tienen 2 hijos, Andy D. 21 años y Arthur D. 17 años. Todos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 20 años que resiD. al sur D. Lima, esto ayudó a que fuera bien conocida en el lugar, por lo que aprovechó para vender comida en un puesto D. venta ubicado en la parte exterior D. su casa. Su buena sazón y su gran carisma, hizo que muy pronto se hiciera D. varios clientes, quienes ahora son fieles a su establecimiento. A Lucía le agrada mucho su trabajo y es por ello que quiere mejorarlo y ampliarlo, pues le genera buenos ingresos. Por otra parte su esposo, la ayuda a elaborar algunos muebles y separadores, para que pueda dividir su cochera en dos partes, siendo una D. ellas, el puesto D. comida D. Lucia y la otra parte el taller D. carpintería D. su esposo. Ambos aportan a la economía del hogar y esperan progresar cada uno con su propio negocio y poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Este es su primer crédito con MFP  y espera ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación D. sus platillos.
texts.en:
Lucía, 53, is married to Julián; they have two children: Andy, 21 and Arthur, 17. They all live together in their own home. She has lived in south Lima for over 20 years and this has maD. her very well-known in the area. She took advantage of this and started selling prepared meals in a stand located outsiD. her house. Her great charisma and tasty seasoning quickly attracted several customers who are now her regular consumers. Lucía enjoys her work very much so she wants to enlarge and improve it because it produces good income. Her husband helps her by building some furniture and dividers so that she can diviD. her car port into two sections: one for Lucía’s food stand and the other for her husband’s carpentry shop. Both of them contribute to household expenses and each hopes to make progress with their own business so that they can proviD. their children with good educations. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with all her payments. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaet M. is 35 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Village in the province of Kandal. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. San Sao, is a cow middleman who can earn a little income to support his family. For the farm, Mrs. Ngaet M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming crop. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also support their mother's farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim W. M. lives in Vehari with her husband and a fifteen year old son who couldn’t get an education due to the financial condition of the family. Shamim’s husband is a government employee with a very little income. It has not been easy for him to fulfill the financial needs of the family. Shamim bibi decided to support her husband and started a clothes selling business by taking a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She purchases beautiful embroidered clothes in Multan, a city in the Punjab region of Pakistan which is famous for embroidered works, and sells them at different local shops and to her neighbors as well. Now she has applied for another loan from Asasah. With the help of a loan, Shamim will buy clothes in bulk which will minimize the cost of traveling and also enable her to fulfill larger orders from her customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Gilberto Arminda

texts.pt:
Gilberto Arminda L. nasceu no Distrito de Vilanculos, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 03 e 06 anos de idade, a mais velha vai a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe e irmão que vivem com ele. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Boane com a sua mãe atrás do pai que trabalhava neste Distrito. Tem um negócio e dono do mesmo ha mais de 6 anos, não possui empregados e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de mobilizações feitas pelos oficiais desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, açúcar e outros) para reforçar a mercadoria no seu negócio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar as condições de habitação na sua família e iniciar uma criação de gado bovino e caprino.
texts.en:
Gilberto Arminda L. was born in the District of Vilanculos, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique. He is married and is the father of 2 children, who are 3 and 6 years old. The oldest goes to school. Gilberto only studied through the 8th grade; he didn't continue due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother and brother, who both live with him. He left Inhambane for Boane with his mother after his father went to work in that district. He has been the owner of his own business for more than 6 years. He does not have any employees and earns about 4,500 MZN per month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He is even able to save some in his bank account. Gilberto never has had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku through institution officials who were conducting enrollment campaigns. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy supplies (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.) in order to build up his business's merchandise. He promises to pay back the loan on time so that he will be able to ask for others. In the future, he intends to ask for more loans in order to improve his family's living conditions and to start raising cattle and goats.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Diarga

texts.fr: Diarga D. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIANKANG depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit mais n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre, de piment, d'oignon et de condiment pour la cuisine et se nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises. Son ambition est de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diarga D. is a widowed, 59 year-old woman who is responsible for the care of five children. She has been a member of the Thiankang Banc Villageois since June 1, 2007. She has easily repaid her six previous loans. She has a small business that sells sugar, peppers, onions and seasonings for cooking. This new loan will allow her to increase her stock of products. Her ambition is to contribute financially to improving her family's living conditions and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her small business

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva S. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old and is single.

Geneva owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also grows and fattens hogs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years.

Geneva joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Geneva is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and feed for her pigs. This loan will be her second from CEVI.

Geneva plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en: Meliza B. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 26 years old. Meliza is single and has an infant child. To make a living, Meliza runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snack food products in the local community. Meliza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Meliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 32-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and only child. Ibrahim has worked as a car repairer and painter since 2004, now having 15 years of experience. Ibrahim is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary raw materials which are essential to his business and will increase his profit. His clients are people from his village and those they lead to him. His hardworking attitude is the secret of his success.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella was born in 1961. She has fourteen children, two of whom are now married and three of whom are adopted. 
Drocella sells fabrics and offers rental wedding gowns. She has been in this business since 1978. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics for sale and other wedding gowns for renting out. She hopes to make more profits in this venture.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and wedding gowns

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last twenty years and her mixed farm produces tea, tomatoes, maize, beans, vegetables and milk which she sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes in the local market. Her biggest challenges are bad debts, which pull back her business, the high cost of pesticides, and transportation problems.

Cicilia is 39 years old. She is married with five school-aged children.

Cicilia recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to expand her cereals business and her dairy farming. The income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family.

In the future, Cicilia plans to purchase a van that will help her transport her products to the market and help her to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business and her dairy farming

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 30 years old, with three children between the ages of 10 and four, two of whom attend school. She is married to a driver. Jeanne sells green vegetables and fruit and has spent seven years in this business. With the loan she will buy more fruit and vegetables. With the profits she will save money and buy more vegetables and fruit. She would like to be able to buy larger quantities because it would help her to make more profit. Her business is a profit-making business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisca Marleny

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la señora cuenta con estudios de Educación Superior Completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de animales menores.

Francisca solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá en su negocio venta de animales y frutas.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una propia empresa de productos lácteos y queso

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la organización, puntualidad y el tema educativo.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the community bank “Santiago Patrón”, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, in the Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 27 years old, single and she has one child. She has done university studies.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. The money was used to increase the capital of her business, selling small animals.

Francisca is requesting a new loan of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles. This money will be invested in her business of selling animals and fruit.

Her dream for the future is to have her own cheese and dairy product business.

The things she likes most about her community bank are the organization, the punctuality and the educational theme.

loans.use: to invest in her business of selling animals and fruit

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es: Sandra Maritza C. D. F. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Santo Tomás, en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo verduras, y así mismo junto a 2 hijos menores D. edad. Sandra posee una venta D. ganchos, diademas, peines, cremas para cuerpo y el cabello, esmaltes, y otros productos más, su venta es bastante estable, la cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. Este negocio es D. mucha importancia para ella, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza como maquillajes y otros más y D. esta forma pueda aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es su principal objetivo.
texts.en: Sandra Maritza C. D. F. is 41 years old and lives in Santo Tomas in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who works selling vegetables and with her two small children. Sandra sells hooks, hair bands, combs, body and hair lotion, nail polish and other products. Her sales are very stable which has allowed her to have everything she needs to live. This business is very important to her which is why she is requesting a loan with which she can buy a greater quantity of beauty products such as make up and other products. This will allow her to increase her sales which is her primary objective.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other beauty products.

location.town: Santo Tomás, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Georgea Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgea está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Miriam del Carmen M. A. de 40 años quien hace 20 años inicio con unos ahorros y una máquina de coser su pequeño taller de costura.  Ella con el crédito comprara telas para realizar vestidos, togas, trajes y uniformes por la época.
Ella desea tener su propia tienda de ropa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ángela M. Vivas de 55 años quien venta de gaseosa, tortilla, frescos, pan y helados desde hace 10 años y Paulo Aguirre R. vende verduras desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The Georgea group has three hard working members.  One of them is Mrs. Miriam del Carmen M. A., 40, who twenty years ago used her savings and one sewing machine to set up a small sewing workshop.  She will use the loan to buy fabric to make dresses, graduation robes, suits and uniforms according to the season.  Her desire is to own her own clothing store.

The other members of the group are: Ángela M. Vivas, 55, who has sold soft drinks, tortillas, fruit drinks, bread and ice cream for the past 10 years and Paulo Aguirre R. who has sold vegetables for the last 8 years.

loans.use: For fabric.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 42. He operates a matatu (van for transporting people) in Nairobi for a living. Business is very good during peak hours of every day, i.e. morning and evening, since everyone is going to work in the morning and leaving work for home in the evening. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to repair his matatu. He is a member of Lucky Seven SHG and the loan is guaranteed by the group. He is married and is a father of four, who are in school. He describes himself as a people person and reliable.

loans.use: To repair his matatu (van for transporting people)

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 33 years old. She is married to Peter Njuguna, who contributes to the family income.They have three children. She has been operating a grocery store for the past five years and earns an income of Kshs. 10,000 per month.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She hopes to be a leading supplier of green vegetables, to give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy pineapples and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Nakinyi Ene

texts.en:
Nakinyi Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last one year. She is 36 years old and married to Kiranto Ole L.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep, which she will sell later at a profit.

In the future, Nakinyi hopes to practice zero grazing and increase her produce.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep, which she will sell later at a profit

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Juliet is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras (dried coconut) in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts and increase working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copras. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts for copras

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Майбалиев Парвиз проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Холост. Имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии проработал три года. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу. Открыл интернет-кафе. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для приобретения мониторов.
texts.en: Parviz M. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 28 years old and single. He has a college degree in economics. He has worked in his field for three years. Now he provides  businessservices. He opened an Internet café. He has been in this line of work for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase computer monitors.

loans.use: Purchasing computer monitors

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: pig fattening. Her husband Jose, who is 44 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have nine children who are between 4 and 25 years old. Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as funds for her business operation so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Lucia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operation

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margarita es comerciante de su pequeño negocio que inicio hace un año, con la venta de productos lácteos, para lograr ayudarse económicamente, y lograr tener su propio negocio. Es madre de seis hijos, madre soltera.
Todo su vida ha trabajado en servicios domestico, un trabajo en donde se cansa mucho, y gana poco, es por eso toma la decisión de mejorar en su círculo de vida, para el bienestar de su familia.
Para aumentar más sus productos, recurre al financiamiento para mejorar su inversión, ya que trabaja con poco capital.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: veinte libras de queso fresco, queso seco, queso de crema,  crema dulce, mantequilla lavada, cuajada fresca y seca, entre otros productos que le genere mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Margarita has had a small business for a year selling dairy products in order to help herself out financially and to be able to have her own business.  She is a single mother with six children. She has worked all her life as a housekeeper, work that is very tiring and doesn't pay well.  She therefore made the decision to improve her life, for the wellbeing of her family.  She is requesting a loan In order to offer more products, as she has little capital.  With this loan she will purchase 20 pounds of fresh cheese, hard cheese, cream cheese, sweet cream, butter, fresh and dry cheese curds, and other products that generate better profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh and hard cheeses, butter, cheese curds and other products.

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma Y. is from the village of Tandul, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen near the school. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes and snacks to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to cook more dishes and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR P. LABORA COMO DOCENTE TECNICO DE LA BORATORIO ES CASADO, TIENE  DOS PERSONA A SU CARGO, ESTE ES EL CUARTO CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPROTUNIDAD QUE LE BRINDA, ESTE DESEMBOLSO LO NECESITA PARA CANCELAR DEUDA Y PARA COMPRA DE  MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION CERAMICA, PORCELANA, MANO DE OBRA, PARA PONER PISO EN SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Sr. Noel Antonio P. works at a laboratory as a technical instructor.  He is married and has two dependents.  This is the fourth loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him.  The funds will be used to repay a debt and to purchase construction materials such as ceramic, porcelain, as well as pay for labor in order to install a floor in his home.

loans.use: To pay for needed materials and labor for installing a floor.

loans.name: Manchaster Group

texts.en:
Sharifa S. is in her early 30s and is married with one young child. She has been running a vegetable business for two years and works from 5:00 a.m. to midday (seven hours). She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more vegetables and successfully paid it back. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of vegetables. Her dream is to one day be able to take her kid to a good school and also build her own house.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Manchaster, which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Sharifa is first on the left.

loans.use: to increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ledy Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ledy, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad,  los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, en la cual vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, artículos de bazar, ciertas medicinas y además útiles escolares y papelería en general. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva 11 años con su negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace mas de 6 años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio.

Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, know for years as the city of royal tamarinds, the Damas Positivas [Positive Ladies] community bank meets every two weeks.  

Here we meet Ledy. She is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 12 and 8. The two oldest are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a food store in her house where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent, variety store items, and certain medicines, as well as school supplies and general paper products. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later. She buys the products in a center in Portoviejo, although most are delivered to her locale. She tells us she has had this business for 11 years and it has gone very well for her.  

She is going to use this loan to supply her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli meats and variety store items. She has been in the community bank for more than 6 years and she likes it because through the loans she has been able to finance her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods and variety store items.

loans.name: Guali

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Guali works hard to support his family.

He buys and sells bananas and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a Sari Sari Store business. Guali is borrowing PHP 24500 through NWTF to purchase bananas and spices to sell.

Guali has been sustaining his business activities through his past 7 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and spices to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Stella has a salon business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Paula; tiene 52 años de edad; la socia tiene 6 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar; la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas caseras, la asocia elabora sus comidas típicas en casa y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado de Ocongate, la socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y de esta manera apoya en el hogar económicamente, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las comidas típicas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. de Tayancani”. She lives in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Paula is 52 years old and has six children. She divides her time between her household activities and her business of selling homemade food. Paula prepares traditional dishes at home and then sells them in the main square of the village of Ocongate. She is a hardworking woman who supports her household financially. Paula is requesting a loan so that she can invest in supplies for preparing traditional dishes.

She values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. For this reason, Paula promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing traditional dishes.

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
Juaquina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 70 años D. edad, está  casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos independientes. La señora no cuenta con estudios. 
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y  venta D. animales como ovejas, llamas y alpaca, trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año.  Su préstamo  anterior D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en la crianza D. animales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará ovejas y alpacas (5 en total), para engordarlos por dos  a tres meses y luego venderlos.  En  el negocio también le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Juaquina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. Concepción” which is located in the central village of Ayrumas Carumas in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. She is 70 years old, married, and has seven children. Juaquina was not able to pursue an education.

She and her husband buy and sell animals such as sheep, llamas, and alpacas. Juaquina has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her previous loan of 500 PEN was invested in animals that she raised.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy sheep and alpacas (five animals in total). She will fatten them for a period of two to three months before selling them. Her children also help her with managing the business. Her dream is to have more livestock so that she can increase her earnings. What she likes about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the convenience of the loan, and the punctuality.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and alpacas.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina has been farming in Litien in the Rift Valley of Kenya for 15 years. Her farm produces tea, maize, vegetables and milk, which are all sold locally. She also owns and manages a beauty salon (pictured in the photo). Selina is 41 years old and a widowed mother of 3 children who all attend school.

Selina has made a loan request of 90,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. With this loan, she says that she will be able to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this loan will help Selina pay her children's school fees.

Selina faces the challenge of diseases which affect her production. In 5 years' time, she wants to have increased the number of her dairy cows to 4 and to have purchased a van for transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; la socia tiene 44 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 5 hijos y ella se dedica a la compra y venta de vinos, la socia reparte vinos a domicilio y tiendas, restaurantes, barres, según los pedidos que le hagan, la socia trabaja en este negocio desde hace más de 2 años, su conyugue trabaja en preventas de una conocida empresa de fideos, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de vinos al por mayor para repartir a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vinos al por mayor.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 44, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and five children.  She is a wine merchant.  She delivers wine to stores, homes, restaurants and bars according to the orders she gets.  She’s been in this business for over two years.  Her husband works in presales for a well-known brand of noodles.  She wants to invest the loan to purchase wine at wholesale for improved delivery to her customers.  She is requesting the loan to buy wines at wholesale.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support provided her through this means and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy wine at wholesale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeanette has been a rice farmer for the past 20 years, having learned the trade from her parents. She is married, has six children and is applying for a loan to help plant her next rice crop. She will use the money to pay for nursery services, transplanting, field management, guarding birds and harvesting.
She will use the profits to expand her business by buying machinery to further increase her output. 

Agriculture accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs about 90 percent of Rwanda's people (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwanda, financial institutions view lending to farms as a high-risk proposition because profitability is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to help fund the production of her next rice crop.

loans.name: Isacio

texts.es:
El señor Isacio, es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Máxima. El es comerciante, se dedica al comercio, es decir, tiene una despensa en su domicilio, también cuenta con un negocio de vídeos juegos el cual le ayuda a aumentar el ingreso económico de la familia.
El se considera una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por el bien de su familia, ya que desea darles un buen porvenir. Uno de sus proyectos es agrandar su despensa hasta tener un supermercado donde pueda cumplir con todas las demandas de sus clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados para el abastecimiento del local. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio, ya que sabe que con la inversión podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Isacio is from the city of Villarrica. He is 54 years old and married to Sra. Máxima. He is a merchant and operates a food pantry out of his home. Isacio also has a video games business that helps to generate extra income for his family.

He considers himself to be a hardworking and enterprising person who has tremendous desire to succeed. Isacio says that everything he does is geared toward providing for the welfare of his family and giving them a good future. One of his projects is to expand his food pantry and convert it into a supermarket where he can meet all of the demands from his customers.

Isacio is requesting a loan to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, and baked goods to restock his shop. He is hopeful that the loan will be of great help to his business. Isacio already knows that this investment will allow him to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, and baked goods.

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lleva 20 años trabajando en esta actividad, cuando joven aprendió la preparación de las tortillas, porque su madre tenía el puesto de venta, de ahí adquirió experiencia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz, ya que se gasta rápido, y al comprar al por mayor obtendrá un mejor precio.
Esta compra le ayudara a producir más y trabajar de mejor manera, proveyendo para sus hijos lo necesario en ingresos.
texts.en: Lourdes is a widow and lives with her 2 children aged 17 and 21. She sells tortillas and has been doing this for 20 years. When she was young she learned how to make tortillas as her mother had a stall selling them and it was there she gained experience on the job. Currently she is asking for a loan to buy firewood and corn, as she quickly uses up her supplies and buying wholesale will give her a better price. This purchase will help her produce more and work more efficiently, providing her with the necessary income for her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua operates a shop where she sells already made dresses, shampoo, toilet rolls and other items at Jukwa near Abura. She is divorced. 

She has been in this business for five years now. The loan when received will be used to procure more dresses to sell.

loans.use: to procure more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime has been able to repay her first Kiva loan and her business has improved greatly. She also has been able to provide basic needs for her family and they are living a better life. 

Fatime is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to add merchandise to her food stall business to meet customer demand for wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana sells wakye, a traditional Ghanaian rice dish, in Elmina. To prepare wakye, Naana buys beans, rice, and colored leaves at the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the leaves to give them a reddish color. She then adds the rice to the bean mixture, which she cooks until it becomes tender. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish, or meat.

Naana is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. This loan will be used to procure beans, rice and other items to cook to sell. Naana plans to reinvest the new profits from her extended business for further growth.

loans.use: to procure beans, rice and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en: Bulgamaa is 42 years old and lives with her son in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in the Mongolian province of Bayanhongor. Her son is a school student. Her husband passed away. Her husband started the grocery trading business in 2000. After her husband died in 2008, she continued the business. She buys goods from the wholesalers and retails them in the local market. Recently, she bought a small piece of land to live on. Because of this purchase, she is lacking money. She is a strong and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy goods from Ulaanbaatar at whole sale price to sell.

loans.use: To buy goods from Ulaanbaatar at whole sale price to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and blessed with two children. For the last fifteen years, he has been repairing weighing machines. Previously, he was farming. 

With 65,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy spare parts for weighing machines.
 
In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and employ people. Fredrick dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for weighing machines.

loans.name: 03.1.15 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Đằm operates a food stall selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food…). Đằm has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Đằm is 49-years-old, is single and lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 15 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 

In 2007, Đằm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Đằm has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Đằm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Đằm hopes to build a new house and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 42, owns a business selling second-hand clothes at the local market. He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. Monday through Saturday. He currently employs one person to help him.

He and his wife have four children: the youngest is a two-month-old baby and the eldest is 16 years old.

Paul has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothing and bags to offer for sale. With the expected profits from the loan, Paul is confident that he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing and bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, ages 15, 13 and 7. She sells fish and mobile prepaid load credit in her community. Rosela used to be a scrap buyer but, due to some circumstances, she decided to focus more on selling fish.

Rosela has requested a loan to buy more fish and mobile prepaid load to sell. Rosela hopes to have a stable business that will help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish and mobile prepaid load to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 35-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes, in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.
Cecilia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan, to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her eldest son is a fruit seller and the second one is studying. Her 2 remaining children are very young and are not of school-going age yet.

Her husband sells fruit and operates his business from a nearby shop. He never compromises on quality and always provides fresh quality fruits to his customers at reasonable rates.

Nusrat is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very fond of sewing and works with great dedication.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity for selling.

He has been operating his business for many years and Nusrat is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for a fruit selling business
