Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband, to improve his business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Enrique de 54 años, quien es agricultor, y de su última hija, menor de edad, de 5 hijos que tiene pues el resto ya son mayores y viven independientes. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, y en la actualidad siembra junto a su esposo papas, arvejas, y flores de gladiolos. Dice que las faenas agrícolas son tediosas, pues es una constante vigilancia a cada planta para que la plaga de insectos no perjudique a sus plantaciones. Julia sabe que si se le brinda el cuidado adecuado a los cultivos echándoles fertilizantes y abono se puede esperar una buena producción; además el tiempo que tiene sembrando le ha hecho aprender las técnicas necesarias para que toda la cosecha sea recogida sin problemas. Además le gusta mucho su labor pues la realiza en compañía de su esposo y siempre juntos se esfuerzan por sembrar, para luego de unos meses vender todo a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, y de las ventas obtienen regulares ganancias que les permiten vivir cómodamente con su hija. Como ella es una dama muy trabajadora para mas adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de flores de gladiolos, y de arvejas, pues dice que los precios de estos productos  son muy  buenos en el mercado. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además conoce muy bien a las integrantes de su banco comunal y sabe que son muy responsables. Julia tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de gladiolos y arvejas para empezar a extender su producción.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband Enrique, who is 54 years old and a farmer, and her last daughter of the five children they have.  The rest are older and live independently.  

Since she was young, she has worked in agriculture and she currently grows potatoes, peas, and gladiolus flowers with her husband.  She says that farm work is tedious, because it is a constant watch on each plant so that a plague of insects doesn't harm their crops.  Julia knows that if given proper care and fertilizer, you can expect a good harvest.  Additionally, the experience she has with planting has allowed to her to learn the necessary techniques for harvesting the entire crop without problems.  She likes her work very much because she gets to work with her husband and together they work to plant and later sell everything to wholesale merchants in the city.  The sales give them a regular income that allow them to live comfortably with their daughter.

Since she is a very hard-working woman, she plans to increase her gladiolus flower and pea production since the prices of those items are very good at the market.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who made the loan possible, since it will allow her to continue working.  She also knows the members of her community bank very well and knows that they are responsible.  Julia plans to invest this loan in the purchase of gladiolus and pea seeds to begin to increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase gladiolus and pea seeds.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. has been selling palm oil at Mfuom near Abura for thirty years. Esi has a high-school education and is a widow with four children. Esi wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase additional quantities of palm fruit for sale. The profit realized from her sales will be used to buy an oil-extracting machine. In the photograph, Esi is standing next to her machine extracting the oil she will sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of palm fruit for sale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari business in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation. Julieta is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en: Melrose owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. Melrose has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Melrose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melrose is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack foods and canned goods. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Javira

texts.en:
Javira is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Javira has a small retail shop, which she has run for six years. She also has a second business running a poultry farm and rearing domestic animals.
To help expand her business, Javira has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Javira hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to take care of herself.
Javira is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es: El señor Teodocio es costurero; se dedica a confeccionar gorras y sombreros para toda edad las mismas las comercializa en la feria de la calle Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: tela, hilos, bordados y demás, con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco en la Ciudad de El Alto. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues es cliente nuestro desde el año 2009.
texts.en: Teodocio is a tailor; he makes caps and hats for all ages, which he sells at the market on Tumusla street in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting is for purchasing materials such as fabric, thread, embroidery, etc. Through this business, he covers his family's household expenses. He lives in his own home, which is located in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. He is very satisfied with the loans he has received before. He has been our client since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, embroidery, and lining for making caps and hats, which is his specialty

loans.name: Sobeida Elvira

texts.es:
Sobeida Elvira es una fémina trabajadora, emprendedora y entusiasta quien inicio vendiendo artesanías de manera ambulante en el Salvador pero como la situación socioeconómica no era la misma y las ventas bajaron decidió invertir en otro negocio. Ella desde hace un año que está comercializando productos plásticos por mayor en las distribuidoras, ventas y pulperías quienes son sus clientes.
El crédito lo invertirá en productos plásticos vasos, platos, tasas, cucharas, tenedor, cuchillos, panas…etc.
texts.en:
Sobeida Elvira is a hard-working, entrepreneurial, and enthusiastic woman who began selling handicrafts as a street vendor in Salvador.  However, as the socioeconomic situation was not the same and her sales declined, she decided to invest in another business.  For the last year, she has been selling plastic products at wholesale to the distributors, shops and grocery stores who are her customers.

The loan will be invested in plastic products such as cups, plates, mugs, spoons, forks, knives, etc.

loans.use: to buy plastic products.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 42 years old, married and has four children.

Ibtissam has been a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer. She has good experience and she well known in her area.

She is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy a new tailoring machine and to add more inventories (tissues, buttons, etc.). She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine and more inventory

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en: Yuri is 36 years old and married with one daughter who is one year old. His occupation is selling electronics in various markets around Cusco seven days a week. He is asking for a loan in order to make improvements to his house. Specifically, he plans to purchase cement and bricks as he wants to make his house larger. Yuri is a hardworking man and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Claver is a rice farmer who is married with eight children.  He has been a farmer for the past 20 years, and he learned rice farming from his parents.

He will use his Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding from birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Paul Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Paul es un buen cliente de la institución este es su segundo crédito donde pago de forma  puntual, el cliente tiene la actividad de carpintería el normalmente elabora muebles de cocina y catres, la esposa del señor Paul se llama nieves ella se dedica al cultivo de coca en los yungas la labor del cultivo de coca es sacrificado porque el trabajo de campo es duro, y para comercializar su producto la Sra. Nieves necesariamente tiene que venir a la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 2 hijos, el trabajo de l señor Paul es también duro porque tiene que levantar maderas muy pesadas, el destino del crédito es la compra de madera para la elaboración de muebles.
texts.en: Paul is a good client of the institution; this is his second loan that he’s repaid on time.  He has a carpentry shop where his usual production is kitchen furniture and cots.  Paul’s wife is called Nieves and she farms coca leaves in the Yungas (name given in Bolivia to the hot region of the north-east where famous coffee is raised).  Coca leaf cultivation is very demanding field work and to sell her products Nieves must necessarily come to the city of La Paz.  She has two children.  Paul’s work is also very hard because he has to lift the heavy lumber.  The loan is to buy lumber to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
La señora se dedicaba  a la venta de abarrotes, actualmente tiene una panadería - pastelería.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/  300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Este nuevo préstamo de  S/  1,500.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de cuatro quintales de harina, manteca.  Nos cuenta que vende y reparte pan todos los días, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien es profesor.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia, su carro y seguir adelante en el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo de la cuenta interna, los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She completed high school.

Ruth sells groceries.  She also has a bakery - cake shop.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her grocery store business.

Ruth will use this new loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying four 100lb bags of flour, and butter.  She tells us that she sells and delivers bread every day.  Her husband, who is a teacher, helps her in the business.

Ruth's dreams are to own her own home, to own a car and to get ahead in her business.

What Ruth likes about her community bank are the internal account loans, the savings and the interest she makes.

loans.use: to invest in buying four 100lb bags of flour, and butter

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en:
Sherifatu is a palm oil extractor at Jukwa near Abura.  She has been in this business for two years. 

Sherifatu is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She has been completed junior high school. 

The loan will be use to expand her palm oil business.  New profits will be reinvested for further growth.

loans.use: to expand the palm oil business.

loans.name: Raider

texts.en:
Raider is 40 years old and a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling cassava and maize in Hai Mahad in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Raider requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more cassava, maize for sale. She will use the extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Philomène est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses quatre enfants. Tous les enfants de Philomène sont scolarisés et sont à sa charge. Philomène n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène mène comme activité la vente des tissus, des chaussures et des bijoux.Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Philomène assure sans grande difficulté, les différentes charges de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne  dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Philomène sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: 52-year-old Philomène is a widow who lives alone with her four children.  All her children are in school and in her care.  Philomène herself never went to school.  In order to cover her own needs, as well as those of her children, she works selling fabrics, shoes and jewelry.  Thanks to the money that she makes from her business, Philomène is able to cover her family's different needs without much difficulty.  She stocks up at the main market in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers and improve her standard of living and income, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, fabrics, shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Jreb

texts.en: Jreb is 41 years old and is a cake seller earning $5 per day.  She is a single mother with two children, a five and one year old.  Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $8 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy materials to make cakes to sell.  She doesn’t wants to change her career because she earns a good income from this.  Jreb says she will make more cakes when she has more customers.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies for making cakes to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a cheerful lady who sells dried and smoked fish in an open-air market. Previously, she serviced a loan of 70,000 KES. She used the loan to add stock of dried and smoked fish and sacks for storage. With increased stock, she was able to make more sales and hence more income.

Eunice has requested another loan of 100,000 KES to add to her stock of dried fish.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is married with seven children, ages 6 to 25. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business, so that he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 18 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a boutique where she sells ladies' bags, shoes and trousers. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in Gilgil Shopping Centre. She describes her biggest business challenge as the increased cost of goods. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ladies' clothes, handbags and shoes. Her business goal is to sell potatoes using lorries within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock of ladies' clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is married and has three children. She is 31 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For 5 years, Glenda has owned and operated a business raising pigs. She earns PHP 4,000 monthly from the business. Glenda has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Glenda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Glenda plans to save her revenue as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Sarah has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is 26-year-old married woman with no children.  She has been running a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for five months.

Jenty is requesting this loan through Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice.  If she is able to make any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans save money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of fruits such as mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Mifonsite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIFONSITE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Georgette (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 39 ans. Georgette est mariée a un certain Séraphin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Georgette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Georgette vend des bidons d’huile et cartons de savons depuis cinq ans par la technique de distribution. Georgette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Georgette ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIFONSITE sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des bidons d’huile et cartons de savons.

loans.name: Jyamberemubyeyi Group

texts.en:
Jyamberemubyeyi is a group led by Antoinette, who is 52 years old. The group name means “Go ahead” in English.

Antoinette is married and has 4 children aged between 14 and 25 years. She sells foodstuff and has been in this business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives.

With this loan, Antoinette would like to buy more beans, potatoes and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, potatoes and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 55 years old, widowed with ten children.

Candida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, candies, bread and other snack foods.

Candida has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Candida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, candies, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children who all go to school. 

She has two businesses. In the rural area she has a plantation which grows cabbages, pumpkins, peas and egg plants. Usually these are sold from her house or sometimes the market.

She also prints material for lava lava (Samoan Sarong)which she sells in the market and to stores in town. She gets her designs from a wood carver.

loans.use: Purchase material for clothes printing

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn P. is 37 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her 3 children and husband. She sells vegetables at the market while her husband drives a Tuk-Tuk. Together, they can make between $20 and $30 a day.

Sorn P. will use this loan to buy a motorbike for her children so that her and her husband can focus more on their businesses. She feels they can generate far more income if they did not have to spend the time and money transporting their children to school each day. Sorn P. and her husband plan to work very hard so they can send all of their children to university and eventually into good jobs.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for children so she can stay at market

loans.name: Aduvi

texts.fr:
50 years old, Mrs A. Aduvi is married to a polygamous husband, has five children and takes care of three others. Her business is to sell beans in schools. It's a profitable business if you can buy beans and oil wholesale, but she has not enough money to do it. She asks for a $400 funding, to be able to stock in and get a bigger benefi that woul help improve her family'sconditiont

Translated fromFrenc by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Aduvi est mariée à un polygame et mère de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge trois (03) autres. Son activité est la vente de haricot dans les établissements scolaires. C’est un commerce très rentable quand le haricot et l’huile sont achetés en gros alors que les moyens de Madame A. Aduvi ne le lui permettent pas. Elle demande un financement de $400 pour s’approvisionner afin de dégager un revenu consistant pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
To supply with beans and oil
S'approvisionner en haricot et d'huile

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is originally from a place called Sabinas, in the state of Nuevo Leon. He is married and has 9 children, but the only one still dependent on Armando financially is the youngest one who is still in school. For many years now, Armando has sold ice cream, fruit, and a type of corn snack known as "elotes", from his bicycle cart. He started this business after he lost his job. His children were young still and he needed to earn money to take care of them. His previous boss had taught him how to make ice cream, and loaned him his first bicycle cart so he would be able to sell his ice cream in the street.

Armando has been growing his business thanks to the experience he has gained. He is asking for a loan of $275 which he will use to buy more merchandise to sell, and continue to increase his sales and grow his business further. Now is the time to help those most in need, so please help Armando if you can. Thank you very much.

Armando es originario de la localidad de Sabinas en Nuevo León, está casado y tiene nueve hijos, sólo el más pequeño, que estudia la primaria, depende económicamente de él. Desde hace ya muchos años Armando se dedica a la venta de helados, frutas y elotes en un triciclo, inició este negocio después de que lo perdió su empleo, sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaba obtener los recursos para su manutención, su anterior jefe le enseñó a elaborar helado y para poder vender en la calle le prestó su primer triciclo.

Ahora Armando ha estado creciendo con su negocio gracias a la amplia experiencia que ha obtenido, y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y continuar creciendo con su negocio. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Armando, muchas gracias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Olga Abilio

texts.pt:
Olga is a single mother with 2 children. She lives in a neighborhood nearby Xai-Xai. She works in a public institution as a clerk. She also works on her small businesses. She joined the credit program in 2006. She invested previous loans in her business. Now Olga wants to take this loan and buy construction material to build a home. Her children are both in school and she is able to support them.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga e mae solteira e tem 2 filhos.Ela vive num bairro periferico da cidade de Xai-Xai. Ela trabalha numa instituicao publica como escrituraria. Para alem de trabalhadora ela faz pequenos negocios. Ela entrou para o Programa de credito em 2006.Os emprestimos anteriores ela investiu no seu negocio. Porque o negocio esta a correr bem, ela quer agora tomar um outro emprestimo para a compra de material de construcao para poder construir a sua propria residencia.Anteriormente ela vivia numa casa de pau a pique.Os seus filhos ja vao a escola e ela consegue sustenta-los.

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed D. is thirty-seven years old and married with four children.  He needs to work hard to provide for the family.  Mohamed has so far accessed loans from SMT five times and has seen his business expand.  With the income, he said he is now constructing a family house and this will relieve him from renting.  He is requesting more loans to expand the business so that he can generate more income to complete the family house.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Increase his variety and assortment of clothing to attract new customers

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: I am Yasmin B. and the wife of Mohammad Azam. I have two sons of age 22 and 24 years. Both of my sons do a small business of selling rickshaw spare parts. Now they need a loan of $425 to purchase tires, rims and other spare parts of rickshaws in bulk for their business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for rickshaws

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the southeast part of Azerbaijan. She and her family (her husband is pictured) were relocated to the Lokbatan settlement of Baku city as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She and her husband, Bakhtiyar Najafov, trade vegetables and fruits. They have been in this business for more than 8 years. She wants to increase the volume of sales, invest more in her business and increase her income. She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. Now they apply again for $1000, to invest in business.

loans.use: To invest in business

loans.name: Zocima

texts.es:
Zocima started her business transporting food from Huaraz. She sold on the streets goods like: potatoes, lúcuma (a small apple-like fruit which grows in Peru and Chile), onions and oranges. Soon she diversified her product offering and began selling various types of groceries as well.

Business is going well for Zocima and she has a small store in her home. But she wants to purchase a stall in the market as this will really make her sales flourish. She is requesting a loan as her income is split in two; half is for upbringing her seven children and the other half is being saved to purchase the market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase a stall in the market

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline lives and works in Beirut. She owns a toy shop. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady B., age 59, is married and the mother of six children, one of whom she is looking after, in addition to her grandson. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne in Ziguinchor for six and half years. She buys "boubou thioub" (traditional dyed cloth), gems, and shoes in Ndiassane and Dakar, and she resells them in Ziguinchor. With her income, she helps to support her family. Khady has always honored her commitments. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Khady B., 59 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants dont 01 en charge en plus de son petit fils est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle achète des boubous thioub (boubous en tissus teintés), bijoux et chaussures à Ndiassane et Dakar et les revend à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Khady a toujours respecté ses engagements. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy boubous thioub and shoes for retail sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a widow who has 3 children: Rolando, age 26 (employed), Sergio, age 33 (employed), and Francisca, age 28 (homemaker). She started this business out of financial necessity since she did not have sufficient income to both raise her children and pay for their educational expenses. She started making candy and selling it from home 15 years ago. She now sells it in nearby communities, thus concurrently broadening her client-base and her profits.

She needs a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make her candy. With your help, Francisca will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es viuida y tiene 3 hijos: Rolando de 26 años empleado , Sergio de 33 años empleado y Francisca de 28 años se dedica al hogar. Inició el negociopor necesidad economica ya que no tenia ingresos suficientes y tenia los gastos de la escuela y manutención de sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio hace 15 años haciendo dulces y vendiendo en su su casa pero ahora, ya sale a venderlos en municipios cercanos, abarcando mas clientes y logrando mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un credito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus dulces. Con tu ayuda Francisca saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase the ingredients necessary to make candy

loans.name: Oybonu

texts.ru:
Oybonu T. lives in the region of Vakhsh. She is 44 years old, widowed, with three children. She has a secondary education. Oybonu sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. She supports her family herself since her husband is dead. Her sales are the only source of income for the family. The client wishes to increase the variety of the produce she sells. That is why she plans to take out a three-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Талбакова Ойбону жительница района Вахш.Возраст 44 года, вдова, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Ойбону торгует на местном рынке овощами и крупами.Свою семью она содержит сама , так как муж Ойбону умер. Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Клиентка хочет пополнить ассортимент торговой точки.Для этого она планирует взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Increase product line

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Creativity and ability in the visual arts are Teofila’s natural talents. She and her husband work on t-shirt screen printing, design and printing of cards and mementos for all occasions. This young couple partnered with a few of their relatives to open an offset and screen printing shop. Their creativity, hard work, and finely finished products have earned them many satisfied clients in Juliacan, who in turn have recommended their services to other people in town. Teofila is requesting a loan for 1000 soles to purchase a wider variety of paints.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La creatividad y habilidad en las artes visuales son la especialidad de Teofila, junto a su esposo se dedican a realizar trabajos de impresión de serigrafía en camisetas, estampado de recuerdos y diseños de tarjetas para diferentes ocasiones.Esta joven pareja, en sociedad con algunos familiares lograron abrir un taller de impresión en offset y serigrafía, donde con mucha creatividad, ofrecen sus servicios a la población juliaqueña, quienes se quedan satisfechos por el arte y acabado, haciendo que estos mismos clientes recomienden el trabajo ha otras personas.El deseo de Teofila es adquirir un préstamo por el monto de 1000 soles, dinero que tiene proyectado invertir en adquirir variedad de pintura, con ese propósito es su petición.

loans.use: Purchase of wider variety of paint for screen printing business

loans.name: Mahmadaub

texts.ru:
Mahmadaub F. lives in the Khuroson district, and works as a middle school teacher. He has also been raising animals for 4 years. He buys thin, unfinished bull calves, and after fattening them, sells them at a profit. He found out about the availability of loans, and came to us for one. He decided to take out a loan with a 15 month term in order to buy another calf. This will help him increase sales and income. Mahmadaub is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзов Махмадаюб проживает в районе Хуросон. Работает учителем в средней школе . Кроме того уже 4 года занимается животноводством. Поакупает худых , неоткормленных бычков и после откормки продает по выгодной цене. Узнал про возможность получить кредит , обратился к нам за кредитом. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев , для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и получить прибыль.Махмадаюб женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor S. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. Gulbahor is a woman determined to search for the best things in life and offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities.

Gulbahor is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this two years ago, when she moved to settle in her hometown. She devoted herself to selling women's dressing gowns, and now she is satisfied as her business provides her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary education for her two young children.

Today Gulbahor is requesting your help in getting a loan of 800 USD for a term of 6 months to add a new stock to her inventory. Your support means a great deal to Gulbahor. Please offer her your help.

loans.use: Increasing her working capital for development of business

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla N. est âgé de 49 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est distillateur  de « sodabi », une liqueur tant appréciée par la population locale. Komla réside à Wome un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des palmier à huiles pour tirer son vin. Notons que c’est le vin issu du palmier à huile qui permet d’obtenir de la liqueur « sodabi ». Komla compte sur cette opportunité pour assurer la survie de sa famille. Dans la photo Komla est la personne située du coté droit habillé en T-shirt blanc bandé de vert
texts.en:
Komla N. is 49 years old, married, and the father of 5 children. He distills "sodabi", a liquor much appreciated by the locals. Komla lives in Wome, a village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he wishes to buy oil palm trees to make wine. It should be noted that this wine is what makes it possible to obtain "sodabi" liquor. Komla counts on this opportunity to ensure the survival of his familya. In the photo, Komla is on the right and wears a white and green t-shirt.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil palm trees to make liquor

loans.name: Dolibeth

texts.es:
La señora Dolibeth, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 31 años de edad,  es madre de 2 niños quienes son la razón de lucha constante porque ella los cría sola. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de refrigerios y bebidas gasificadas en el puerto de la ciudad. Está aprovechando la construcción del puente por la cantidad de personas que trabajan en dicha obra para incrementar sus ventas.  Empezó vendiendo sólo golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y eso le permitió crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en  6 meses, comprará arroz y azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, harina para keres y gaseosas de diferentes tamaños y sabores, sobretodo lo que mayor salida tiene entre sus clientes, también quiere comprar una refrigeradora para preparar chupetes y congelar sus gaseosas.  

Dolibeth es una mujer emprendedora quien está agradecida de Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un préstamo, el cual ayudó a crecer en su negocio. Más adelante desea contar con un local para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dolibeth, a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Activas” (“Active Women”), lives in the San Martín region of the Bellavista province. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children, who are the reason that she struggles constantly as she is raising them on her own.

Currently, she dedicates herself to selling perishables and sodas at the city’s port. She is taking advantage of the construction of a bridge which has brought a number of people to work on this project, and this has allowed her to increase her sales. She started selling only sweets/snacks. She has been working with the communal bank for three years, and this has allowed her to grow her business.

With the loan of 1,700.00 soles, to be canceled in six months, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, flour, and different sizes and flavors of sodas. Most of all, she would like to buy a refrigerator so she can make popsicles and cool her soft drinks.

Dolibeth is a very enterprising woman, who is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the confidence they showed in providing her with a loan that helped her to grow her enterprise. In the future, she would like to have her own location so she can tend to her customers more efficiently.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, flour, different sizes of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja, Pamela de 17 años, con la cual tiene un bebe de una semana de nacido llamado Andy. El se dedica a trabajar en el negocio, que asociado con sus hermanos, puso hace ya 2 años. Atiende eventos, brindando servicio de decoración de los ambientes, el alquiler de vajilla, comida, etc. El negocio va prosperando y Guido se siente muy  inspirado con el nacimiento de su bebé, y quiere hacer crecer su negocio para brindarle a su hijo una buena educación y darle a su esposa las mejores comodidades. La dificultad de su trabajo reside en que tiene que renovar los bienes que salen afectados en las fiestas, como la ruptura de vasos, manchado de telas, etc, teniendo que renovarlas haciendo que el gasto sea mayor. Guido se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará nuevas telas, vajilla, etc., para renovar su negocio y poder brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Guido is 21 years old and lives with his significant other, Pamela, who is 17 years old, with whom he has a small baby boy named Andy who was born a week ago. He works in partnership with his brothers running an event rental and planning business that they started two years ago. They offer services including room decorations, china/tableware rental, food, etc. Their business continues growing and prospering and Guido feels very inspired by the birth of his son. He would like to grow the business more in order to offer his son a good education and provide a more comfortable life for his wife. The difficulty they encounter in their business is that they have to constantly repair or repurchase the assets that are damaged during the parties/events such as broken glasses, stained tablecloths, etc.; having to repair or repurchase them makes their expenses much greater. This is the first loan that Guido has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, he will purchase new tableclothes, glasses, etc. to renew his business and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tablecloths and tableware

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: This is a small group of three members. Mrs. P. is selected to be the group leader. Mrs. Sao P., 51, is a hairdresser and provides laundry services. Her business is located in Battambang Province. She is widowed with three children, one of whom is married and two who are single. Her son, Mr. Sao Sony, 19, works a lathe and can earn money to support the family's expenses. To increase her son business, P. needs a loan for her son to purchase a lathe for his own business. Other two members are: Mrs. Kim C. T., 48, on staff at a local NGO, who needs a loan to run a new business of a decorating business, and Mrs. Chim B., who is selling noodle soups. She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase lathe for her son's business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso G. G. es viudo, el vive con su hija y con su nieto, ellos tienen 13 años de vivir en su hogar. El señor Alfonso trabaja como mensajero desde hace 5 años, siendo este trabajo su principal fuente de ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia.
El señor Alfonso está solicitando un préstamo para contratar mano de obra para impermeabilizar el techo de la segunda planta de su casa por que hay mucha humedad en esa parte de su hogar. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Alfonso, sino aparece su hija).
Esta mejora a la vivienda del señor Alfonso permitirá que él y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Alfonso G. G. is a widower and lives with his daughter and grandson, who have lived in his home for 13 years. His daughter appears in the photograph above in Alfonso's stead.

Alfonso has worked as a messenger for 5 years, and this has been his principal source of income with which he is able to support his family. Alfonso solicits this loan so that he can hire workers to waterproof the roof of his house as there is a high level of humidity on the second floor. This loan will help him improve his home to ensure that he and his family are able to live comfortably.


Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of his home

loans.name: Seybou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Seybou Diabaté a 29 ans et vit avec ses 5 enfants et son épouse à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Diabaté après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce d’articles divers. Il dispose d’une quincaillerie à la gare routière de Sikasso. Il s’occupe de cette activité il y a environ cinq ans. Il est beaucoup sollicitté pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant dix mois. Il  est à son premier prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter,  10 boîtes de colle, 15 cartons baquette, 15 paquets de peinture, 50 mètres de file, 5 pelles, 5 piques, des talosses, etc . Il s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes à Bamako(capitale du Mali) avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs, de constructeurs de maison, de maçons, etc.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et rembourser les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Seybou Diabaté is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 5 children in Sanoubougou II, one of the populous districts in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several business activities without success, Mr. Diabaté began a business selling various hardware items. He runs a hardware store at the Sikasso bus station. He has been working in this business for about five years. He is much sought-after due to the quality of his products. To satisfy his increasingly growing clientele, he has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for about ten months. He is seeking his first individual loan and intends to use it to buy 10 cans of glue, 15 boxes of pliers, 15 packs of paint, 50 metres of thread, 5 shovels, 5 awls, etc. He supplies himself from wholesalers in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and then re-sells at retail to a clientele composed generally of entrepreneurs, house-builders, masons, etc. With this loan, he foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used mainly to increase his business, contribute to his family's expenses, and repay the loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glue, pliers, paint, thread, shovels, awls, and other hardware items

loans.name: Razihol

texts.ru: Клиент Чуманазаров Рузихол проживаещая в городе Турсунзаде в посёлок Джаврат. Клиентки 44 года она замужем и имеет 4 -ех детей. Образования клиентки среднее,клиентка занимается сельскохозяйством уже более 20 лет у клиентки имеется 15 сот земли, на этой земле она вырасщивает зерно и кортошку.Клиентка просит 2000 сомони на 8 месяцев для преобретения удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Razihol C. lives in the town of Tursun-Zoda in Djavrat city. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has high school education. Her main occupation is agriculture. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. She owns a piece of land, which she uses to grow grains and potatoes. Razihol asks for 2,000 Somoni for 8 months to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Rosa C. se dedica a la venta de comida en la ciudad de Managua habiéndose destacado como una excelente cocinera que ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio.

Ha sido una persona muy trabajadora que en todo momento busca la forma de cómo llevar el sustento de su hogar. Ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de esta manera continuar en su labor diaria destacándose como excelente cocinera.
texts.en:
Rosa C. works selling food in Managua, standing out as an excellent cook, and has been able to succeed in her business. She has been a hard-working woman in that always looks for ways to bring income into her household. She has come to Ceprodel to get a loan to be used to purchase ingredients to make her products so that she can continue her work as an excellent cook.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food dishes

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells a local variety of gin, popularly known in Nigeria as "ogogoro." She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more ogogoro for sale. She hopes to use this loan to meet the demands of her customers, and she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ogogoro for sale.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo L. se dedica a su actividad de zapatería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Él se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente trabajador y conocedor de este ramo de zapatería siendo visitado por sus clientes para que el señor L. le repare los zapatos.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de trabajo que le permitan llevar a cabo su actividad. Estos materiales son hilos, pegamento, cuero, agujas, entre otros. Espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo L. works as a cobbler in the municipality of Sandino in Managua city. He has been characterized as an excellent worker, and is well-known by the many clients who come to him to have their shoes fixed. He is currently looking for support from Ceprodel, in order to buy work materials that will help him improve his business. These materials include thread, glue, leather, and needles. He has a lot of faith and knows that his loan will be granted and allow him to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, with two school-aged children. To earn a living, Marites owns and operates a business selling home products. Her revenue comes primarily from selling personal home products to local community members. She has had her business for over 2 years, and earns approximately 8000 PHP per month.

In 2007, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Marites successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, to be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: D. purchases eggs in bulk from poultry farms and sub-sells to other smaller retailers. She started this trade three years ago and is doing fine but needs a loan of N100,000 to increase her inventory in order to meet with her customers’ demands. D. is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase eggs in bulk

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is twenty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, both daughters. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Gifty is a trader and trades in cereals – rice. She buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk. She has been in business for two years and aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 4 hijos, quien lo apoya en su negocio. Tiene un taller de carpintería en su propia casa, donde fabrica muebles en todas sus variedades y estilos, y al gusto del cliente; también repara muebles que se encuentren en mal estado dejándolos como recién salidos de la tienda, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y de su hijo quienes le son de gran utilidad. En esta labor de la carpintería y ebanistería ya lleva un periodo de 15 años y lo que le gusta es que le permite llevar una vida tranquila y demostrar su arte y creatividad. Por otro lado, lo considera muy rentable, ya tiene muchos clientes regulares quienes confían en su buen trabajo. Posteriormente, a Roger le gustaría poder exportar los muebles que fabrica a otros lugares. Este es tu 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que se gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos son puntuales en sus reuniones y pago de cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para mantenerse activo en la actividad que tanto le gusta.
texts.en:
Roger is 60 years old. He lives with his wife and one of his four children who helps him in his business. He has a carpentry shop in his house where he makes furniture in all varieties and styles, however the client likes. He also repairs furniture items that he finds in poor condition, making them look like they just came from the store. His wife and his son assist him in this and they are a great help to him. He has been working in carpentry and cabinetmaking for 15 years. He likes this profession because it allows him to have a tranquil life and to demonstrate his artistry and creativity. On the other hand, he also finds it to be good business; he has many regular clients who trust in his good work. Eventually, Roger would like to be able to export the furniture he makes to other places. This is his 4th loan with MFP and what he likes about working with his communal bank is that everyone is punctual at the meetings and in their payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy more wood to continue with the work that he likes so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Upendo is a member of the Furaha borrower group.  She is 26 years old, married, and a mother of two.  Her children are ages 8 and 3.

Upendo started her own business selling clothes 3 years ago; she works 9 hours a day and makes a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $225 US).

This is Upendo's second loan from BRAC Tazania. She requests the amount of 300,000 shillings in order to buy more clothes.  With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Upendo hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2006, he decided to open his own business as a builder and began a new career. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy an electric machine specialized for his job in order to facilitate his work.

loans.use: Buy an electric machine

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is single and has six dependants. She has received no educational background.  Comfort sells palm oil she goes to the market and buys palm nuts and process it into palm oil at Elmina near Ntsinman, which she has been doing since 2002. Comfort uses her income to pay school fees and settlement of utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts for oil and boxes of soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts for oil and boxes of soap for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 42 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años se ha dedicado al comercio, pero hace un par de años decidió incursionar en la venta de comida, lo hace desde la puerta de su casa y también en ferias comerciales de su  zona, uno de los platillos que vende es el tradicional “tamal”, hecho a base de maíz con carne de pollo o cerdo. Los fines de semana, se intensifica su labor porque vende los platos típicos de su región y por ello tiene mayor demanda. Su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante campestre y a la vez turístico donde tenga mayores opciones de venta. 
Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes de su banco comunal más perseverante, por lo que nuevamente se compromete a seguir realizando un trabajo solidario, pagando sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para sus comidas y ollas más grandes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her 4 children. She has been involved in business for 12 years, but 2 years ago decided to venture into food sales. She sells food from the door of her house and also at commercial markets in her neighborhood.

One of the dishes she sells in the traditional “tamal” made from corn along with chicken or pork. On weekends, she works harder because she sells the traditional dishes of her region which are in high demand. In the future, she would love to have a restaurant in the countryside which would also be a tourist destination.

This is Elizabeth’s fourth loan with MFP. She is one of the communal bank’s most perservering members, and once again will commit herself to operating a responsible business and making her payments on time. With this loan, Elizabeth will purchase ingredients for her food preparations and also larger cooking pots.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is a widow and has three children. She has no educational background.  Gladys sells groceries such as milk, soap, sugar and so on at a castle near Brofoyedur, which she has been doing since 1995. Gladys uses her income to pay school fees and settle utility bills.  Gladys will use the loan to purchase more milk, sugar, rice and so on for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys Intends to reinvest into her business and to further her children's education.

loans.use: Gladys will use the loan to purchase more milk sugar, rice and so on for sale

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family financially. She is a trader. Zenabu trades in cola nuts. She procures bags of cola nuts (seed pods from African evergreen trees) from nearby communities and sells at the local market. She also supplies other retailers. Zenabu has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure cola nuts in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cola nuts

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: El grupo “Candelaria” esta representado por la señora Reyna Marlen y conformada por 14  miembros los cuales van cursando su primer ciclo demostrando ganas para crecer y salir adelante. Las socias tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. productos como venta D. ropa deportiva, comida rápida, venta D. pelotas para todos los deportes, salchichas y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio.  El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel D. ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago a pesar D. existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito será invertido en la compra D. más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron atentes en instituciones financieras similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la que están muy agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The Candelaria Group, represented by Ms. Reyna Marlen, is comprised of 14 members who are in their first loan cycle, demonstrating the desire to grow and get ahead. The members own different types of businesses, such as selling sports apparel, fast food, balls for all kinds of sports, sausages, and provisions in neighborhood general stores. Sales are high and the businesses are very lucrative, which means that the members can repay their loan despite all the competition. The loan will be used to increase their capital. They hope to boost sales. They will purchase more merchandise in order to increase their profits to be able to offer their families a better quality of life and a brighter future, which is why they keep pushing forward. Regarding their loan experience, the group members have previously worked with other financial institutes similar to Fundación Agrocapital, to which they are very grateful for the trust and support they have given them.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Passion Inn Group

texts.en:
Jamesette P. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Passion Inn. She is 32 years old and married with two children who are two and six years old They are in nursery school and 1st grade. Jamesette also cares for a niece and a nephew.
She is a bachelor degree holder but chooses business.
Jamesette and her family live and work in the Virginia area, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.
Her business is the sale of used clothes. She buys used clothes from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of Virginia, northern Monrovia, Liberia.
Jamesette has been running this business for a year and hopes to improve the business to a better level in the future.
Jamesette sells at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.
She started selling with LD14000.00 that she borrowed, but sometimes faces difficulties with customers who buy on credit from her and don’t pay on time.
Jamesette needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. 
She dreams of giving her children a better education and changing their living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ylda

texts.es:
La señora Ylda es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao. Ella tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 3  hijos, 2 D. ellos viven con ella y uno es independiente y cuenta con estudios secunadrios completos.
Ylda trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; tiene un laboratorio dental, y paralelamente venD. jugo D. quinua los sábados. 
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró ganado: ovejas y chancho.
Ella solicitara un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar muebles para su laboratorio dental.
Su visión hacia el futuro es tener una casa propia y ampliar su laboratorio dental.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su banco comunal son los bajos interèses, y ademàs nos comenta que aprenden a ser puntuales y a compartir entre socias.
texts.en:
Mrs Ylda is a partner of the “Las Brisaa del Rio Blanco” community bank in the Pilcuyo district of the El Collao provence. She is 37 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children live with her and one is independent with her secondary education are completed. Ylda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years. She has a dental laboratory and also sells quinua grain juice on Saturdays. She told us her fist loan was for S/300 Peruvian nuevo soles with which she bought livestock: sheep and pigs. She is requesting a loan S/3,000 Peruvian nuevo soles for the purchase of fixtures for her dental laboratory. Her vision of the future is to have her own house and expand her dental laboratory. What she likes most about her community bank, are the low interest rates in addition to the skills she learns of being punctual and sharing with among associates.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dental office fixtures/furniture.

loans.name: Afi Koudjodé

texts.en: Mrs. A. makes and sells mattresses and pillows that come in a variety of colours and styles. She is married to a tailor and they have three children. This will be her second loan with WAGES, which she will use to purchase twenty-five bags of kapok (silky fibres used inside mattresses and pillows) and thirteen rolls of fabric to resupply her stock of mattresses and pillows. By helping Agoé, her home town, get a better night’s sleep, Mrs. A. will also be supporting her family and business.

loans.use: Materials used to make mattresses and pillows

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 43 years old. She is a widow and the mother of six children. She is hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She has a vegetable farm; after harvest, she takes the vegetables to the market to sell to vegetable sellers. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 8 years. Ramadhan, after facing a financial problem, thought of starting his own business. This business is the sale of foodstuffs including Irish potatoes. He started this business in 2000 and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Ramadhan is a proven entrepreneur and he spends a lot of time in keeping his business more stable as well as profitable. After realizing that his working capital in not enough for this purpose, he would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan to buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes and some other demanded foodstuffs.

If Ramadhan’s plan of increasing his business is successful, he hopes to save some of his profits in order to reinvest them in his business and to continue building a better living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Taufalaula

texts.en:
Taufalaula L. is 39 and married with 3 children (ages 6 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Taufalaula has 3 years of experience in this business.  Taufalaula needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Vagana joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vagana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vagana Pilato are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Emprendedores Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es:
EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO
La  Alcancía Comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO” es un grupo nuevo, cursan su 1 ciclo y está representado por su presidenta Raquel que es responsable y dedicada al grupo, sobre todo tiene las ganas D. trabajar para su mejora económica al igual que D. sus compañeras.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en su casa hace varios años, y con las ganancias pueD. contribuir con la economía ya que tiene 2 menores hijos. Raquel es una mujer positiva, tiene como objetivo abrir un restaurant y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Lucila es la tesorera del grupo, ella fue quien motivo a las personas para formar el grupo, es una persona responsable y dedicada a sus 4 hijos, Lucila venD. abarrotes en un puesto del mercado hace varios años, ello contribuye a la economía en casa ya que es separada.
Yolanda tiene una bodega en casa hace 8 años, es su única fuente D. ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos. Ella empezó con una vitrina y algunas golosinas, poco a poco pudo juntar dinero y comprar algunos productos que sus clientes solicitaban. Ahora desea poner otro tipo D. negocios por las noches para así mejorar sus ingresos.
Los 10 socios son responsables D. sus negocios y sus familias, por eso tienen como objetivo mejorar su situación económica y brindarles a sus hijos alguna profesión que en el futuro les permita solventarse a sí mismos.
texts.en:
EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO The communal fund “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO” is a new group. They are in their first cycle and are represented by their president Raquel. She is responsible and dedicated to the group. More than anything she has enthusiasm to work for her economic improvement as well as the other members. She has sold food from her house for several years. With the profits, she is able to contribue to expenses since she has two minor children. Raquel is a positive woman. Her goal is to open a restaurant and thus be able to give work to other people. Lucila is the group's treasurer. She was the reason these people formed the group. She is a responsible person and dedicated to her 4 children. Lucila has sold groceries from in a stall in the market for several years. This contributes to the household finances since she is separated. Yolanda has had a store at her house for 8 years. It is her only source of income to support her two children. She started with a window display and some candies. Little by litte, she was able to get money together and purchase some products that her customers were asking for. Now she wants to start another type of business at night in order to improve her income. The 10 members are responsible with their businesses and their families. This is why they have the goal of improving their financial situation and offering their children a profession in the future that wil allow them to be financially independent.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF PRODUCTS

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: E. Adèle est née en 1981 à Abomey, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Mariée à AGBODJALOU Jean-Mari, un cuisinier, Adèle est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle vit avec sa famille à Godomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis trois ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Adèle a très peu fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Adèle mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et de charbon de bois à son domicile, mais aussi par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et auprès des distributeurs, que Adèle s’approvisionne. Adèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Adèle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adèle E. was born in 1981 in Aborney, in the Zou region of Benin. She is married to Jean-Mari Agbodjalou, a chef, with whom she has two school-aged children. Adèle has lived with her family in Godomey, in the borough of Abomey Calavi for three years, and the couple work together to look after their family's needs. In order to help meet these demands, Adèle sells fabric and charcoal for a living, both through home sales and via a distribution network; she sources her goods from Benin's international market and through distributors. Adèle is an existing ALIDé client and has already received three loans from them, which have all been successfully repaid. She is seeking another loan in order to increase her inventory, thereby satisfying her customers' demands and increasing her profits.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags and charcoal

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 47 years old. He has a wife and four children who are between 12 and 17 years old.  Alex is known in the business of selling drinks and he has been in this business for about 10 years.  The hours of his business are from 6 am to 10 pm every day.  

Although Alex has been in this business for a long, his capital is still too low as well as his profits.  To end this, Alex needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, which in turn will allow him to increase the sales as well as the profits.  With these profits, Alex hopes to start saving as well as reinvesting in his business which hopefully will result in helping him to continue paying school fees for his children and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks to sell

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 1 Group

texts.en:
R. is the coordinator of her group Ruth Y Esther (Ruth and Esther), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsuL., a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure as a single mother with two children.

R. is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling assorted items in the street including, balloons, candy, mints, etc. She will use the profits for her children and family by purchasing medicine and school supplies, and towards saving to construct her own home. She hopes also to continue saving with Esperanza so that she can have a cushion when she can't work anymore She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy balloons, gum, and candy to sell.

loans.name: The New Club Group

texts.es:
EL SR. WILFREDO ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "EL NUEVO CLUB", INTEGRADO POR 9 SOCIOS MUY ENTUSIASTAS, QUIENES LO ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTE DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. ÉL TIENE 46 AÑOS, TIENE CINCO HIJOS; Y VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE HUAQUILLAY EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE UN AÑO INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE LA VENTA DE TELÉFONOS MÓVILES, ACCESORIOS Y SERVICIOS TÉCNICO.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO AUMENTAR SU CLIENTELA, TENER UN STOCK DE EQUIPOS, Y A LA VEZ HA IMPLEMENTADO UN NEGOCIO DE SERVICIO DE PINTURA, ESTOS NEGOCIOS LE PERMITEN MANTENER A SU FAMILIA.
MAS ADELANTE LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO FORMAR UNA EMPRESA QUE TENGA QUE VER CON EQUIPOS CELULARES, Y ESTABLECERSE EN UN LOCAL PROPIO.
CON EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE EQUIPOS CELULARES.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a member of the "El Nuevo Club" [the new club] group, made up of 9 very enthusiastic members who elected him as president of their group's management committee. He is 46 years old and has five children. They live in the Huaquillay area of the Comas district. He started his business a year ago, selling mobile phones, accessories and technical services.
